sentences.chinese: 这棵树很可能已经有100年了。

sentences.english: They’ve had this argument a hundred times before.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题他们以前已经争论过无数次了。

detailed_translations.english: the number 100
a very large number of things or people

sentences.english: I was cold, tired, and hungry.
sentences.chinese: 我又冷，又累，又饿。

sentences.english: If you get hungry, there’s some cold chicken in the fridge.
sentences.chinese: 你要是饿了，冰箱里有些冷鸡肉。

sentences.english: Do you still feel hungry?
sentences.chinese: 你还觉得饿吗？

sentences.english: She is hungry for success.
sentences.chinese: 她渴望成功。

detailed_translations.english: wanting to eat something

sentences.english: lion/rhino/stag etc hunt
sentences.chinese: 猎狮/犀牛/雄鹿等

sentences.english: the hunt for the missing child
sentences.chinese: 搜寻失踪儿童

sentences.english: Wolves tend to hunt in packs (= hunt in groups ) .
sentences.chinese: 狼往往成群捕猎。

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when people chase animals in order to kill or catch them
to chase animals and birds in order to kill or catch them

sentences.english: The hunters stalked their prey.
sentences.chinese: 猎人们隐伏跟踪猎物。

detailed_translations.english: a person who hunts wild animals, or an animal that hunts other animals for food

name: Huntsville
trans: 亨茨维尔（城市名，位于阿拉巴马州北部）

sentences.english: If we hurry, we’ll get there in time.
sentences.chinese: 要是赶紧的话，我们能及时到那里。

sentences.english: I hate having to hurry a meal.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌匆匆忙忙地吃饭。

sentences.english: We’ll have to hurry, otherwise we’ll miss the start.
sentences.chinese: 我们得赶紧，否则就会错过开头部分了。

sentences.english: There’s no need to hurry. We’ve got plenty of time.
sentences.chinese: 不必匆忙，我们有的是时间。

detailed_translations.english: to do something or go somewhere more quickly than usual, especially because there is not much time
to make someone do something more quickly

sentences.english: Was anyone hurt in the accident?
sentences.chinese: 事故中有人受伤吗？

sentences.english: Put that thing down - you might hurt someone with it.
sentences.chinese: 快把那东西放下，你会伤着别人的。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to hurt your feelings.
sentences.chinese: 我不是故意要伤害你的感情。

detailed_translations.english: to injure yourself or someone else

sentences.english: Have you met my husband Roy?
sentences.chinese: 你见过我的丈夫罗伊吗？

detailed_translations.english: the man that a woman is married to

sentences.english: a wooden hut
sentences.chinese: 小木屋

detailed_translations.english: a small simple building with only one or two rooms

sentences.english: Water contains hydrogen and oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 水含有氢和氧。

sentences.english: Water can be reduced to oxygen and hydrogen by electrolysis.
sentences.chinese: 水通过电解可以分解为氧和氢。

sentences.english: The first bubbles to escape from the liquid are a mixture of air and hydrogen.
sentences.chinese: 从该液体中最先逸出的气泡是空气和氢的混合物。

detailed_translations.english: Hydrogen is a colourless gas that is the lightest and commonest element in the universe

name: hypothesis
trans: n.假说，假设；（无根据的）猜测，揣测

sentences.english: One hypothesis is that the victim fell asleep while driving.
sentences.chinese: 一种假设是受害人开车时睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: an idea that is suggested as an explanation for something, but that has not yet been proved to be true

name: hysterical
trans: a.癔病的，歇斯底里的；患癔病的

sentences.english: Janet became hysterical and began screaming.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮特歇斯底里起来，开始尖叫。

sentences.english: Everyone in the studio burst into hysterical laughter .
sentences.chinese: 演播室里的每个人都爆发出一阵狂笑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 歇斯底里的；异常兴奋的
detailed_translations.english: unable to control your behaviour or emotions because you are very upset, afraid, excited etc

sentences.english: I moved to this city six years ago.
sentences.chinese: 六年前我搬到了这个城市。

sentences.english: I’m not late again, am I?
sentences.chinese: 我没有又迟到吧？

sentences.english: My husband and I enjoy going to the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫喜欢去剧院看戏。

detailed_translations.english: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself

sentences.english: The ship ran upon the iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 轮船撞到冰山上。

sentences.english: Their ship circled the iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 他们的船绕过了冰山。

sentences.english: The glacier calved a large iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 冰川崩解而产生一个大冰山。

detailed_translations.english: a very large mass of ice floating in the sea, most of which is under the surface of the water

sentences.english: You should talk to Ken – he's always full of good ideas.
sentences.chinese: 你应该和肯谈谈，他总是满脑子好主意。

sentences.english: I knew it was a bad idea to leave him on his own.
sentences.chinese: 我知道把他独自留下不是个好主意。

sentences.english: It was my wife’s idea to move house.
sentences.chinese: 要搬家是我妻子的主意。

sentences.english: He has some very strange ideas about education.
sentences.chinese: 他对教育有些非常奇怪的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or suggestion for a possible course of action, especially one that you think of suddenly

name: identical
trans: a.同一的；完全相同的，相等的

sentences.english: four identical houses
sentences.chinese: 四幢一模一样的房子

detailed_translations.english: exactly the same, or very similar

sentences.english: He was too far away to be able to identify faces.
sentences.chinese: 他离得太远，没法看面孔认出谁是谁。

sentences.english: The police took fingerprints and identified the body.
sentences.chinese: 警方采集了指纹，对尸体作了身份确认。

detailed_translations.english: to recognize and correctly name someone or something

sentences.english: The identity of the killer is still unknown.
sentences.chinese: 凶手的身份仍未查明。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s identity is their name or who they are

sentences.english: We’ll stay at home if it rains.
sentences.chinese: 如果下雨，我们就待在家里。

sentences.english: If you need money, I can lend you some.
sentences.chinese: 如果你需要钱，我能借给你一些。

sentences.english: If I didn’t apologize, I’d feel guilty.
sentences.chinese: 如果我不道歉，我会感到内疚。

sentences.english: If you had worked harder, you would have passed your exams.
sentences.chinese: 要是你再努力一点，就通过考试了。

sentences.english: What would happen to your family if you were to die in an accident?
sentences.chinese: 要是你在意外事故中身亡，你的家人会怎么样呢？

sentences.english: If Dad were here, he would know what to do.
sentences.chinese: 如果爸爸在这儿，他会知道怎么做的。

sentences.english: Taste the soup and add salt and pepper if necessary.
sentences.chinese: 尝一下汤，需要的话加一点盐和胡椒粉。

sentences.english: I want to get back by five o’clock if possible.
sentences.chinese: 如果可能的话，我想5点之前回来。

sentences.english: I think I can fix it tomorrow. If not, you’ll have to wait till Friday.
sentences.chinese: 我想明天我能修好它，如果不行，你只好等到周五了。

sentences.english: Is the book available, and if so, where?
sentences.chinese: 有没有这本书？ 如果有的话，在哪儿？

sentences.english: The missiles can be fired only if the operator types in a six-digit code.
sentences.chinese: 只有在操作员输入一组六位数密码后，导弹才能发射。

sentences.english: We’ll face that problem if and when it comes along (= if it happens or when it happens ).
sentences.chinese: 如果这一问题真的发生了，我们就要面对它。

sentences.english: If by any chance you can’t manage dinner tonight, perhaps we can at least have a drink together.
sentences.chinese: 万一你今晚不能来吃饭，或许我们至少可以一起喝一杯。

detailed_translations.english: used when talking about something that might happen or be true, or might have happened

sentences.english: Excuse my ignorance, but how does it actually work?
sentences.chinese: 请原谅我的无知，它究竟是如何运作的？

detailed_translations.english: lack of knowledge or information about something

sentences.english: The phone rang, but she ignored it.
sentences.chinese: 电话铃响了，但她只当没听见。

sentences.english: Sam rudely ignored the question.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆粗鲁地对这个问题不予理睬。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if you had not heard or seen someone or something

sentences.english: Bridget can’t come – she’s ill.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特不能来了，她生病了。

sentences.english: He was unable to join the army because of ill health.
sentences.chinese: 他因为身体不好没法参军。

sentences.english: The animals had been grossly ill-treated.
sentences.chinese: 那些动物受到了恣意虐待。

detailed_translations.english: suffering from a disease or not feeling well
badly or in an unpleasant way

sentences.english: illegal drugs
sentences.chinese: 违禁药品

sentences.english: They were involved in illegal activities.
sentences.chinese: 他们参与了非法活动。

detailed_translations.english: not allowed by the law

sentences.english: She had all the normal childhood illnesses.
sentences.chinese: 儿童的常见病她小时候都得过。

sentences.english: Her mother was recovering from a serious illness.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲重病后正在逐渐康复。

sentences.english: I’ve never missed a day’s work through illness.
sentences.chinese: 我从未因病耽误过一天工作。

sentences.english: ways to improve your health and reduce the risk of illness
sentences.chinese: 增进健康减少疾病的方法

detailed_translations.english: a disease of the body or mind, or the condition of being ill

sentences.english: She was under no illusion that he loved her.
sentences.chinese: 她不再幻想他爱她了。

sentences.english: It is an illusion that the Arctic is dark in winter.
sentences.chinese: 认为北极冬天一片黑暗是错误的。

sentences.english: She had no illusions about her physical attractiveness.
sentences.chinese: 她对自己外表的吸引力不抱幻想。

sentences.english: ‘I hate to shatter your illusions,’ he said.
sentences.chinese: “我不愿意打破你的幻想。”他说。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幻想， 错误的观念； 错觉， 幻觉， 假象
detailed_translations.english: an idea or opinion that is wrong, especially about yourself

name: illustrate
trans: vt.说明，阐明；给…作插图说明

sentences.english: Let me give an example to illustrate the point.
sentences.chinese: 让我举个例子来说明这一点。

sentences.english: She illustrated her discussion with diagrams.
sentences.chinese: 她用图表来说明她的论述。

detailed_translations.english: to make the meaning of something clearer by giving examples

sentences.english: The book contains 62 pages of illustrations.
sentences.chinese: 这本书有62页插图。

detailed_translations.english: a picture in a book, article etc, especially one that helps you to understand it

sentences.english: attempts to improve the image of the police
sentences.chinese: 提升警察形象的努力

sentences.english: He had the clearest image in his mind of his mother and father.
sentences.chinese: 他脑海中对父母的印象极其清晰。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion people have of a person, organization, product etc, or the way a person, organization etc seems to be to the public

name: imagery
trans: n.写作中直喻或比喻的使用；意象

sentences.english: Their dreams commonly involved complex stories with visual imagery.
sentences.chinese: 他们的梦里常常有很多复杂的情节，充满了生动的画面。

detailed_translations.english: the use of words or pictures to describe ideas or actions in poems, books, films etc

sentences.english: a storyteller with an incredible imagination
sentences.chinese: 想象力极丰富的讲故事者

sentences.english: It does not take much imagination to understand their grief.
sentences.chinese: 不难想象他们是多么悲伤。

sentences.english: With a little imagination, you can find great inexpensive gifts.
sentences.chinese: 稍微动点脑筋，你就会找到物美价廉的礼物。

sentences.english: These people do exist; they’re not figments of my imagination.
sentences.chinese: 这些人确实存在，他们不是我凭空想象出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to form pictures or ideas in your mind

name: imaginative
trans: a.富于想像力的，爱想像的

sentences.english: an imaginative use of computer technology
sentences.chinese: 计算机技术的妙用

sentences.english: children’s imaginative play
sentences.chinese: 儿童富有想象力的游戏

sentences.english: an imaginative solution to the litter problem
sentences.chinese: 解决乱扔垃圾的问题的有创意的方法

detailed_translations.english: containing new and interesting ideas

sentences.english: Imagine that you have just won a million pounds.
sentences.chinese: 设想你刚刚赢得一百万英镑。

sentences.english: He didn’t quite dare to imagine himself as a real artist.
sentences.chinese: 他不太敢把自己想象成一个真正的艺术家。

detailed_translations.english: to form a picture or idea in your mind about what something could be like

sentences.english: She was a splendid mimic and loved to imitate Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 她是个出色的模仿者，喜欢模仿温斯顿·丘吉尔。

sentences.english: The Japanese have no wish to imitate Western social customs and attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 日本人无意仿效西方的社会习俗和处事态度。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

sentences.english: Young people might be provoked into imitative crime by the exploits they see on TV.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人可能会从电视上看到的“英勇行为”中受到启发而仿效电视主人公实施犯罪。

detailed_translations.english: copying someone or something, especially in a way that shows you do not have any ideas of your own

sentences.english: He doesn't take chances; that's why he's survived and most of his imitators haven't.
sentences.chinese: 他不去碰运气；这就是为什么他得以幸存下来，而他的大部分仿效者却没有。

sentences.english: ...the Beatles and their many imitators.
sentences.chinese: ...甲壳虫队及其很多效仿者们。

detailed_translations.english: An imitator is someone who copies what someone else does, or copies the way they speak or behave

name: immediate
trans: a.立即的，即刻的；直接的，最接近的

sentences.english: Our immediate response to the attack was sheer horror.
sentences.chinese: 我们对攻击的第一反应就是非常惊恐。

sentences.english: They promise immediate action to help the unemployed.
sentences.chinese: 他们承诺立即采取行动帮助失业者。

sentences.english: If the eyes are affected, seek immediate medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 如果眼睛感染了要立即就医。

sentences.english: The funeral was attended by her immediate family (= her parents, children, brothers and sisters) only.
sentences.chinese: 只有她的直系亲属参加了葬礼。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done at once and without delay

name: immediately
trans: ad.立即地，即刻地；直接地，紧密地

sentences.english: He retired immediately after the end of the war.
sentences.chinese: 战争一结束他就退休了。

sentences.english: Those most immediately involved in the disaster will be given support.
sentences.chinese: 灾害最直接受害者将获得援助。

detailed_translations.english: very soon before or after something

name: immigrant
trans: a.移民的，侨民的 n.移民，侨民

sentences.english: an illegal immigrant
sentences.chinese: 非法移民

sentences.english: a new wave of immigrants from the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 来自中东的一股新兴的移民浪潮

detailed_translations.english: someone who enters another country to live there permanently

sentences.english: He called for a common European policy on immigration.
sentences.chinese: 他要求欧洲国家实施共同的移民政策。

detailed_translations.english: the process of entering another country in order to live there permanently

sentences.english: The broken limb must be immobilized immediately.
sentences.chinese: 断肢必须立即加以固定。

sentences.english: She was immobilized with a broken leg.
sentences.chinese: 她的腿断了，不能行走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使固定；使不动；使停止流通
detailed_translations.english: to prevent someone or something from moving

name: immovable
trans: a.固定的；不改变的，坚定不移的

name: impact
trans: n.冲击，碰撞；影响 vt.装紧，压紧

sentences.english: Such schemes mean little unless they impact people.
sentences.chinese: 除非能对人们造成影响，否则这样的计划意义不大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 影响， 作用， 冲击
detailed_translations.english: to have an important or noticeable effect on someone or something
the effect or influence that an event, situation etc has on someone or something

sentences.english: Use a piece of fresh ginger to impart a East Asian flavour to simple ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 用一片鲜姜给简单的原料添上东亚的风味。

sentences.english: She had information that she couldn’t wait to impart.
sentences.chinese: 她得到了消息，迫不及待地想告诉别人。

detailed_translations.english: to give a particular quality to something

name: imperative
trans: a.绝对必要的；命令的，强制的；祈使的

sentences.english: It is imperative that politicians should be good communicators.
sentences.chinese: 政治家应该是很好的沟通者，这很重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的；紧急的，极重要的；命令的
detailed_translations.english: extremely important and needing to be done or dealt with immediately

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的事， 必须完成的事； 【语】祈使语气
detailed_translations.english: something that must be done urgently

sentences.english: ...writing implements.
sentences.chinese: …书写用具。

sentences.english: We have decided to implement the committee’s recommendations in full.
sentences.chinese: 我们已决定全面实施委员会提出的建议。

detailed_translations.english: a tool, especially one used for outdoor physical work
to take action or make changes that you have officially decided should happen

name: implication
trans: n.含意，暗示；牵连，涉及，卷入

sentences.english: They are called ‘Supertrams’, the implication being that (= which is meant to suggest that ) they are more advanced than earlier models.
sentences.chinese: 它们被称作“超级电车”，这是暗指它们比先前的型号更先进。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion that is not made directly but that people are expected to understand or accept

sentences.english: an implied threat
sentences.chinese: 隐含的威胁

sentences.english: The high level of radiation in the rocks implies that they are volcanic in origin.
sentences.chinese: 这些岩石内的高辐射水平显示它们是由火山作用形成的。

detailed_translations.english: to suggest that something is true, without saying this directly

sentences.english: a ban on beef imports
sentences.chinese: 禁止进口牛肉

sentences.english: In 2001, Britain exported more cars than it imported.
sentences.chinese: 2001年英国的汽车出口量大于进口

detailed_translations.english: a product that is brought from one country into another so that it can be sold there, or the business of doing this
to bring a product from one country into another so that it can be sold there

sentences.english: He was full of his own importance (= he behaved in an annoying way which showed that he thought he was very important ).
sentences.chinese: 他自以为很了不起。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being important

sentences.english: a very important meeting
sentences.chinese: 很重要的会议

sentences.english: The accident taught him an important lesson.
sentences.chinese: 那次事故给了他很大的教训。

sentences.english: Happiness is more important than money.
sentences.chinese: 快乐比金钱更重要。

sentences.english: ‘What did you say?’ ‘Oh, nothing important.’
sentences.chinese: “你说什么？”“噢，没什么大事。”

sentences.english: It’s vitally important that you understand the danger.
sentences.chinese: 了解危险所在是极为重要的。

sentences.english: a very important customer
sentences.chinese: 一位大客户

detailed_translations.english: an important event, decision, problem etc has a big effect or influence on people’s lives or on events in the future

sentences.english: ‘I want to speak to Mr Franks.’ ‘I’m afraid that’s impossible.’
sentences.chinese: “我想和弗兰克斯先生谈谈。”“恐怕不行。”

sentences.english: It’s impossible to be accurate about these things.
sentences.chinese: 这些事情不可能准确无误 。

sentences.english: The noise made sleep impossible.
sentences.chinese: 噪音吵得人无法睡觉。

sentences.english: Members with young children often found it impossible to attend evening meetings.
sentences.chinese: 有小孩的会员常觉得没法参加晚上的聚会。

sentences.english: It is difficult to find work these days, but for blind people it is virtually impossible.
sentences.chinese: 现在找工作很难，对于盲人来说几乎是不可能。

sentences.english: He was faced with a seemingly impossible task.
sentences.chinese: 他面临着似乎不可能完成的任务。

sentences.english: It was physically impossible to get the fridge through the door.
sentences.chinese: 根本不可能把冰箱从这扇门搬过去。

sentences.english: Six months ago, peace seemed an impossible dream.
sentences.chinese: 六个月前和平还似乎是个无法实现的梦。

sentences.english: Such mental attitudes are difficult, if not impossible, to change.
sentences.chinese: 即使有可能，要改变这样的心态也是很难的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is impossible cannot happen or be done

sentences.english: It is the lament of an impoverished peasant.
sentences.chinese: 它是一个已贫穷化的农民的哀词。

sentences.english: He dropped the gold down the chimney to save face for the impoverished father.
sentences.chinese: 他将黄金扔进烟囱以保留这位穷困的父亲的脸面。

sentences.english: The grants did give new opportunities to many impoverished farmers from the East and Midwest, but much of the land granted under the Homestead Act fell quickly into the hands of speculators.
sentences.chinese: 这些赠拨确实了为来自东部和中西部穷困潦倒的农民带来了一个新的机遇，但是大部分《宅地法》赠拨的土地很快落入了投机者的手中。

name: impractical
trans: a.不切实际的，不能实行的

sentences.english: The road toll scheme was dismissed as impractical.
sentences.chinese: 公路收费计划由于不切实际而遭到否定。

sentences.english: James was a foolish man, full of impractical plans.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯是个愚蠢的人，满脑子都是不切实际的计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不切实际的，不现实的；不能实行的
detailed_translations.english: not sensible or possible for practical reasons

sentences.english: Steve borrowed his dad’s sports car to impress his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫借来他爸爸的跑车向女友炫耀。

detailed_translations.english: to press something into a soft surface so that a mark or pattern appears on it

sentences.english: When we looked around the school we got a very good impression.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了学校，对它的印象很好。

sentences.english: I got the impression that she wasn’t very happy with her job.
sentences.chinese: 我有这样的印象，她的工作干得并不愉快。

sentences.english: Some of the fallen trees had left a clear impression in the hardened mud.
sentences.chinese: 有一些倒下的树木在坚硬的泥地上留下了清晰的压痕。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion or feeling you have about someone or something because of the way they seem

name: impressive
trans: a.给人印象深刻的，感人的

sentences.english: The figures certainly look impressive.
sentences.chinese: 这些数字看上去确实很可观。

sentences.english: Among the guests was an impressive array of authors and critics.
sentences.chinese: 来宾中有不少出色的作家和评论家。

detailed_translations.english: something that is impressive makes you admire it because it is very good, large, important etc

sentences.english: a course for students wishing to improve their English
sentences.chinese: 为想提高英语水平的学生开设的一门课

sentences.english: The doctors say she is improving (= after being ill ).
sentences.chinese: 医生说她正在康复。

sentences.english: You could use the money for improving your home.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用这笔钱改善家居。

sentences.english: Many wines improve with age (= get better as they get older ).
sentences.chinese: 很多葡萄酒年代越久越香醇。

detailed_translations.english: to make something better, or to become better
to make something better, or to become better

sentences.english: Our results have shown some improvement this month.
sentences.chinese: 我们的成绩这个月有所提高。

sentences.english: Are you making some improvements to your home?
sentences.chinese: 你在改善家里的居住条件吗？

detailed_translations.english: the act of improving something or the state of being improved

name: improvise
trans: vt.即兴创作；临时准备，临时凑成

sentences.english: I forgot to bring my notes, so I had to improvise.
sentences.chinese: 我忘了带笔记，只好临时发挥。

detailed_translations.english: to do something without any preparation, because you are forced to do this by unexpected events

sentences.english: There’s some sugar in the cupboard.
sentences.chinese: 碗橱里有一些糖。

sentences.english: My mother was in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲在厨房里。

sentences.english: He took us for a drive in his new car.
sentences.chinese: 他开着他的新车载我们去兜风。

sentences.english: I found her sitting up in bed.
sentences.chinese: 我发现她直直地坐在床上。

sentences.english: Manson spent fifteen years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 曼森在监狱里待了15年。

sentences.english: a hole in the ground
sentences.chinese: 地上的一个洞

sentences.english: Mr Fisher is in Boston this week.
sentences.chinese: 费希尔先生本周在波士顿。

sentences.english: My parents live in New Zealand now.
sentences.chinese: 我父母现住在新西兰。

sentences.english: I never went in pubs.
sentences.chinese: 我从不进酒吧。

detailed_translations.english: used with the name of a container, place, or area to say where someone or something is

sentences.english: Information must be encrypted and privacy maintained in accordance with established policies, according to the role of the consumer.
sentences.chinese: 信息必须根据客户的角色按照确立的策略进行加密和以保密方式进行维护。

sentences.english: They aim to provide detailed editorial feedback in accordance with the standards of journals such as Nature and Science — where many of them have been published.
sentences.chinese: 他们的目标是按照《自然》和《科学》等期刊的标准提供详细的编辑反馈——他们之中的许多人在这些杂志上发表过论文。

sentences.english: In addition, you can elect to share your files with others.
sentences.chinese: 另外，您可以决定与其他的用户共享 您的文件。

detailed_translations.english: used when you want to mention another person or thing after sth else

sentences.english: So what should we do to promote peace, in addition to the proposals mentioned above?
sentences.chinese: 那么，除了上述提到的方案外，我们应该采取什么行动来促进和平呢？

sentences.english: But only wear on perspective glasses to see, or we can't see it, that is why in addition to the players, but not others.
sentences.chinese: 但是只有佩戴上透视眼镜才能够看见，要不然是看不到的，这也是为何除了玩家以外，其他人却看不到的原因。

sentences.english: If there is any change about the time of the meeting, please notify us in advance.
sentences.chinese: 开会时间如有变， 请提前告诉我们。

name: in effect
trans: 实质上，实际上；正在实行，有效

sentences.english: I know the mayor really well. In fact, I had dinner with her last week.
sentences.chinese: 我跟市长很熟，事实上，我上周还和她一起吃过饭呢。

detailed_translations.english: used when you are adding something, especially something surprising, to emphasize what you have just said

name: in favour of
trans: 赞成，支持；为…的利益，有利于

sentences.english: I am not in favour of the Arsenal system.
sentences.chinese: 我并不支持阿森纳的运营方式。

sentences.english: He often pamphleteers and lectures in favour of free trade.
sentences.chinese: 他经常讲演及写小册子支持自由贸易。

sentences.english: So today, we call upon the world leaders to change their strategic policies in favour of peace and prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我们呼吁世界各国领袖改变他们的政策方针以支持和平与繁荣。

sentences.english: I'll not want to say in front of the reporters.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿在记者面前谈论我的观点。

sentences.english: She spent hours in front of the mirror, combing through her long hair.
sentences.chinese: 她在镜子前花费好几个钟头梳理她的长发。

sentences.english: If so, your wardrobe may be in need of editing.
sentences.chinese: 假如是，那么你的衣橱就需要整理了。

sentences.english: It connects those who want to give with those in need of receiving.
sentences.chinese: 它帮助那些希望捐赠的人和需要赠品的人取得联系。

sentences.english: If you keep cutting yourself off from opening up to others, you risk not sharing your skills, talents, and abilities with others in need of help.
sentences.chinese: 如果你始终拒绝向他人敞开心怀，在需要帮助时就可能出现不与他人分享你的技能、才智和能力的问题。

sentences.english: Jack and Helen had dropped behind in order to be alone.
sentences.chinese: 为了单独呆在一起，杰克和海伦故意让别人走在前面。

sentences.english: He polished off his work in order to see his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 为了去见女朋友，他匆忙地做完手头的工作。

sentences.english: She decathected from him in order to cope with his impending bankruptcy.
sentences.chinese: 为了对付他的即将来临的破产，她不再依恋他。

sentences.english: Competitive intelligence or in other words knowing who your competitors are and what they do and how they do it is essential for any business.
sentences.chinese: 竞争智能，或者换句话说，弄清楚谁是你的竞争者，以及他们做什么和怎样在做，是任何商业的要义。

sentences.english: Outwardly she seemed confident but in reality she felt extremely nervous.
sentences.chinese: 表面上看，她显得信心十足，而实际上她紧张得要命。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that a situation is different from what has just been said or from what people believe

sentences.english: "Then can I have one answer in return?" he demanded.
sentences.chinese: “那么，作为回报我要索取一个回答咯？” 他要求道。

sentences.english: And in return for an acknowledgment, which must give me some pain, you cannot deny me the privilege of disliking him as much as ever.
sentences.chinese: 不过，这种应承肯定会给我带来痛苦，作为对我的报答，你不能剥夺我可以一如既往地不喜欢他的权利。

detailed_translations.english: as a way of thanking sb or paying them for sth they have done

sentences.english: Hungry beggars roamed the streets in search of food.
sentences.chinese: 饥饿的乞丐在街上徘徊寻找食物。

sentences.english: Some tribes migrate with their cattle in search of fresh grass.
sentences.chinese: 一些部落为寻找嫩草带着他们的牲口迁徙。

sentences.english: The geological prospecting team ranged over the desert in search of valuable deposits of oil.
sentences.chinese: 地质勘探队走遍了这片沙漠，寻找有开采价值的油层。

sentences.english: The policemen bore up to  their duty in the face of the terrorists.
sentences.chinese: 面对恐怖分子，警察始终忠于职守。

sentences.english: Perhaps you have great intentions, but they crumble in the face of reality.
sentences.chinese: 你也许有长远的打算，但是当你面对现实时，它们破灭了。

sentences.english: What to do in the face of terrorism?
sentences.chinese: 那么面对恐怖主义，该怎么办呢？

name: in the least
trans: 一点，丝毫（不）（用于否定句）

sentences.english: The doctor will be here soon. In the meantime, try and relax.
sentences.chinese: 医生很快就来，现在尽量放松一下。

sentences.english: She sheered off in time to avoid an accident.
sentences.chinese: 轮船及时转向，避免了一次事故。

sentences.english: The jet was descending steeply, but its pilot was able to pull it out just in time.
sentences.chinese: 这架喷气式飞机直线下降，但飞行员及时制止了飞机的俯冲。

sentences.english: In order to catch the train in time, he polished off two bowls of rice in 5 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 为了及时赶上火车， 他在5分钟内就把两碗饭狼吞虎咽地吃光了。

sentences.english: We will examine each of these methods in turn.
sentences.chinese: 我们将按照顺序依次分析这些方法。

sentences.english: This, in turn, would require changes to all users of those interfaces.
sentences.chinese: 依次的，这需要那些接口的所有用户作出相应的改变。

sentences.english: Have ye suffered so many things in vain? if it be yet in vain.
sentences.chinese: 你们受苦如此之多，都是徒然的吗。难道果真是徒然的吗。

sentences.english: Have ye suffered so many things in vain?
sentences.chinese: 你们受苦如此之多，都是徒然的吗。

sentences.english: Her inability to concentrate could cause an accident.
sentences.chinese: 她无法集中注意力可能会导致意外。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being unable to do something

sentences.english: The brain cells are inactive during sleep.
sentences.chinese: 在睡觉时脑细胞不活跃。

sentences.english: Young people are becoming politically inactive.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人变得不热衷政治了。

detailed_translations.english: not doing anything, not working, or not moving

sentences.english: inadequate resources
sentences.chinese: 资源缺乏

sentences.english: The new air conditioning system proved inadequate.
sentences.chinese: 新的空调系统不够好。

detailed_translations.english: not good enough, big enough, skilled enough etc for a particular purpose

sentences.english: He seemed incapable of understanding how she felt.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎不能理解她的感受。

sentences.english: Seventy-five percent of the electorate believe his party is incapable of government.
sentences.chinese: 75%的选民都认为他领导的政党无能力执政。

detailed_translations.english: not able to do something

sentences.english: The curtains were an inch too short.
sentences.chinese: 窗帘短了一英寸。

sentences.english: Rainfall here is under 15 inches a year.
sentences.chinese: 本地的年降雨量不到15英寸。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring length, equal to 2.54 centimetres. There are 12 inches in a foot.

name: incidence
trans: n.影响程度，影响范围；发生率

sentences.english: an area with a high incidence of crime
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率高的地区

sentences.english: the angle of incidence
sentences.chinese: 入射角

detailed_translations.english: the extent to which sth happens or has an effect

sentences.english: His bad behaviour was just an isolated incident.
sentences.chinese: 他的不良行为只是个别事件。

sentences.english: Roads were sealed off because of a major incident.
sentences.chinese: 因为发生重大事故，道路被封锁了。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially sth unusual or unpleasant

sentences.english: Does the price include postage?
sentences.chinese: 这个价格包含邮费吗？

sentences.english: His job includes looking after under-21 teams.
sentences.chinese: 他的职责包括照管21岁以下球队。

sentences.english: The curriculum includes courses in computing.
sentences.chinese: 课程内容包括计算机技术。

detailed_translations.english: if one thing includes another, the second thing is part of the first

sentences.english: low-income families
sentences.chinese: 低收入家庭

detailed_translations.english: the money that you earn from your work or that you receive from investments, the government etc

sentences.english: Unfortunately, I do not have the information because our records are incomplete.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，由于我们的记录不完整，我无法提供有关资料。

sentences.english: an incomplete process
sentences.chinese: 未完成的工序

detailed_translations.english: not having everything that should be there, or not completely finished

name: inconsiderate
trans: a.不替别人考虑的；不体谅人的

sentences.english: It's a bit inconsiderate of her not to let you know when she expects to arrive.
sentences.chinese: 她不让你知道她什么时候会到，这样做有些不体谅人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻率的；不顾别人的；无谋得
detailed_translations.english: If you accuse someone of being inconsiderate, you mean that they do not take enough care over how their words or actions will affect other people

name: inconvenience
trans: n.不方便；麻烦，打扰 vt.麻烦，打扰

sentences.english: We apologise for the delay and any inconvenience caused.
sentences.chinese: 我们对延误和由此造成的不便深感抱歉。

detailed_translations.english: problems caused by something which annoy or affect you
to cause problems for someone

sentences.english: Monday’s a bit inconvenient for me. How about Wednesday?
sentences.chinese: 周一我不太方便，周三如何？

sentences.english: Am I calling at an inconvenient time?
sentences.chinese: 我电话打得不是时候吧？

detailed_translations.english: causing problems, often in a way that is annoying

sentences.english: The population increased dramatically in the first half of the century.
sentences.chinese: 该世纪上半叶，人口大幅度增加。

sentences.english: political tensions that might increase the likelihood of war
sentences.chinese: 或许会增加战争爆发可能性的紧张政治局面

sentences.english: Visits to the site have increased threefold since May.
sentences.chinese: 来这里的参观者自5月起已增至原来的三倍。

sentences.english: an increase in spending
sentences.chinese: 开支的增长

detailed_translations.english: to become or to make sth greater in amount, number, value, etc.
a rise in the amount, number or value of sth

sentences.english: Marketing techniques are becoming increasingly sophisticated.
sentences.chinese: 市场营销技巧越来越巧妙。

sentences.english: Increasingly, young people distrust all forms of government.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人越来越不相信任何形式的政府。

detailed_translations.english: more and more all the time

sentences.english: The blood tests prove that Vince is indeed the father.
sentences.chinese: 验血证明文斯确实是父亲。

sentences.english: ‘Would it help if you had an assistant?’ ‘It would indeed.’
sentences.chinese: “你要是有个助手，会有帮助吗？”“那是肯定的。

sentences.english: Most of the essays were very good indeed.
sentences.chinese: 这些文章大多数都非常好。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize a statement or answer

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

sentences.english: There are plans to split the corporation into a number of smaller independent companies.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要把这家大企业分割成一些独立的小公司。

sentences.english: an independent charity
sentences.chinese: 独立的慈善机构

sentences.english: small independent bookshops
sentences.chinese: 私营小书店

sentences.english: schools in the independent sector
sentences.chinese: 私立学校

detailed_translations.english: an independent organization is not owned or controlled by, or does not receive money from, another organization or the government

sentences.english: Burma borders on India.
sentences.chinese: 缅甸与印度毗邻。

sentences.english: This book treats of the caste system in India.
sentences.chinese: 这本书论述了印度的种姓制度。

sentences.english: If you come to India for just one thing, this should be it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你只为一件事来到印度，那就到这儿来吧。

sentences.english: the Indian government
sentences.chinese: 印度政府

detailed_translations.english: relating to India or its people
someone from India

sentences.english: The study indicates a connection between poverty and crime.
sentences.chinese: 研究显示贫穷和犯罪有关联。

detailed_translations.english: to show that a particular situation exists, or that something is likely to be true

sentences.english: Could you give me some indication as to when I am likely to receive a reply?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我透露一下什么时候我能收到回复吗？

sentences.english: Indications are that the situation hasn’t improved much.
sentences.chinese: 迹象表明局势并没有多大好转。

sentences.english: There is every indication (= there are very clear signs ) that it is true.
sentences.chinese: 很明显这是真的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 指示， 表示， 表明； 象征， 迹象
detailed_translations.english: a sign, remark, event etc that shows what is happening, what someone is thinking or feeling, or what is true

sentences.english: Whether you stay or leave is a matter of total indifference to me (= I do not care ).
sentences.chinese: 你是留是走我根本无所谓。

detailed_translations.english: lack of interest or concern

name: indifferent
trans: a.冷漠的，不关心的，不积极的

sentences.english: People have become indifferent to the suffering of others.
sentences.chinese: 人们已经变得对别人的痛苦漠不关心。

detailed_translations.english: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it

sentences.english: indigestible statistics
sentences.chinese: 看不懂的统计数字

detailed_translations.english: food that is indigestible cannot easily be broken down in the stomach into substances that the body can use

name: individual
trans: n.个人，个体，独立单位 a.个人的；个别的

sentences.english: Each individual leaf on the tree is different.
sentences.chinese: 树上每片叶子都不相同。

sentences.english: the needs of the individual customer
sentences.chinese: 每位顾客的需求

detailed_translations.english: considered separately from other people or things in the same group
a person, considered separately from the rest of the group or society that they live in

sentences.english: Most artists are very individualistic.
sentences.chinese: 大多数艺术家都非常我行我素。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone is individualistic, you mean that they like to think and do things in their own way, rather than imitating other people. You can also say that a society is individualistic if it encourages people to behave in this way.

sentences.english: We have the example of Aceh, Indonesia, to guide us.
sentences.chinese: 我们可用印尼亚齐省这一范例指导我们的工作。

sentences.english: In Indonesia she finds yet another piece of herself: the balance between the pleasures of eating and praying.
sentences.chinese: 在印度尼西亚，她又找到了另一份自我：在吃的乐趣与祈祷的乐趣之间的平衡。

sentences.english: It is an increasing presence in Thailand and Indonesia.
sentences.chinese: 在泰国和印尼，它是一个日益增长的存在。

sentences.english: By 1900, Britain was a mainly industrial society.
sentences.chinese: 到1900年英国已基本进入工业社会。

detailed_translations.english: relating to industry or the people working in it

sentences.english: Energy consumption rises as countries industrialize.
sentences.chinese: 能源消耗随着各国工业化而增加。

detailed_translations.english: When a country industrializes or is industrialized, it develops a lot of industries

sentences.english: I work in the oil industry.
sentences.chinese: 我在石油行业工作。

sentences.english: Italy’s thriving tourist industry
sentences.chinese: 意大利蓬勃发展的旅游业

sentences.english: Gould is a man of great industry.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德是一个很勤劳的人。

detailed_translations.english: businesses that produce a particular type of thing or provide a particular service

sentences.english: Every office has its share of favoritism, inefficiency and dumb decisions.
sentences.chinese: 每个公司都有他的偏袒、无效率和愚蠢的决定。

sentences.english: an inefficient use of resources
sentences.chinese: 资源的浪费

sentences.english: Local government was inefficient.
sentences.chinese: 地方政府效率低下。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无效率的，效率低的；无能的
detailed_translations.english: not using time, money, energy etc in the best way

name: inevitable
trans: a.不可避免的，必然（发生）的

sentences.english: A further escalation of the crisis now seems inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 危机的进一步升级现在看来已不可避免。

detailed_translations.english: certain to happen and impossible to avoid

sentences.english: The decision will inevitably lead to political tensions.
sentences.chinese: 该决定必然导致政治局势的紧张。

sentences.english: Inevitably, the situation did not please everyone.
sentences.chinese: 这种状况必定不能让所有人都感到满意。

detailed_translations.english: used for saying that something is certain to happen and cannot be avoided

sentences.english: Earthquake prediction is an inexact science.
sentences.chinese: 地震预测是一门不精确的科学。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不精确的；不严格的；不正确的
detailed_translations.english: not exact

name: inexpensive
trans: a.花费不多的，价钱不贵的

sentences.english: a good selection of inexpensive wines
sentences.chinese: 可供选择的各种价格公道的葡萄酒

sentences.english: Painting is a relatively inexpensive way to enhance your home.
sentences.chinese: 粉刷是美化居室的一种相对较便宜的方式。

detailed_translations.english: cheap – use this to show approval

name: infant
trans: n.婴儿，幼儿 a.婴儿的，幼儿的

sentences.english: An infant’s skin is very sensitive.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的皮肤非常敏感。

sentences.english: infant formula milk
sentences.chinese: 婴(幼)儿配方奶

detailed_translations.english: a baby or very young child
intended for babies or very young children

sentences.english: There were two inferences to be drawn from her letter.
sentences.chinese: 从她的来信可以得到两种推论。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true, based on information that you have

sentences.english: Police attempts to infiltrate neo-Nazi groups were largely unsuccessful.
sentences.chinese: 警方想打入新纳粹团体的行动基本上不成功。

detailed_translations.english: to secretly join an organization or enter a place in order to find out information about it or harm it

sentences.english: Human beings are infinitely adaptable.
sentences.chinese: 人类的适应力是无限的。

detailed_translations.english: extremely; with no limit

name: inflexible
trans: a.不可弯曲的；不可改变的，固执的

sentences.english: inflexible attitudes towards change
sentences.chinese: 对变革的顽固态度

detailed_translations.chinese: 顽固的；不可弯曲的；不屈挠的；不能转变的
detailed_translations.english: unwilling to make even the slightest change in your attitudes, plans etc

name: inflict
trans: vt.使遭受（损伤，苦痛等），使承受（on，upon）

sentences.english: ...the damage being inflicted on industries by the recession.
sentences.chinese: …经济衰退给工业造成的损失。

detailed_translations.chinese: 造成；使遭受（损伤、痛苦等）；给予（打击等）
detailed_translations.english: To inflict harm or damage on someone or something means to make them suffer it

name: influence
trans: n.影响（on）；势力，权势 vt.影响

sentences.english: He used his influence to get his son into medical school.
sentences.chinese: 他利用权势把儿子弄进了医学院。

sentences.english: He denies exerting any political influence over them.
sentences.chinese: 他否认曾向他们施加过政治影响。

detailed_translations.english: the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want

sentences.english: I need more information.
sentences.chinese: 我需要更多信息。

detailed_translations.english: facts or details that tell you something about a situation, person, event etc

sentences.english: Some countries lack a suitable economic infrastructure.
sentences.chinese: 一些国家缺乏适当的经济基础设施。

sentences.english: a $65 billion investment package in education, health care and infrastructure
sentences.chinese: 用于教育、医疗和基础设施的650亿美元一揽子投资计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造
detailed_translations.english: the basic systems and structures that a country or organization needs in order to work properly, for example roads, railways, banks etc

sentences.english: They would make infrequent visits to the house.
sentences.chinese: 他们偶尔去看一看那所房子。

detailed_translations.english: not happening often

sentences.english: a city of six million inhabitants
sentences.chinese: 有600万居民的城市

detailed_translations.english: one of the people who live in a particular place

name: inhibition
trans: n.抑制；阻止，禁止；[心]感情阻力

sentences.english: She had no inhibitions about saying what she felt.
sentences.chinese: 她毫不顾忌地说出自己的感觉。

sentences.english: People tend to lose their inhibitions when they’ve drunk a lot of alcohol.
sentences.chinese: 人们在喝多了酒之后往往会无所顾忌。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of shyness or embarrassment that stops you doing or saying what you really want

sentences.english: the inhumane treatment of political prisoners
sentences.chinese: 对政治犯的虐待

sentences.english: I was shocked by the inhumane conditions.
sentences.chinese: 我对这非人的条件感到震惊。

detailed_translations.english: extremely cruel and causing unacceptable suffering

name: initial
trans: a.最初的，开始的；词首的 n.首字母

sentences.english: an initial investment of £5,000
sentences.chinese: 5,000英镑的初始投资

sentences.english: The initial response has been encouraging.
sentences.chinese: 最初的反应情况很乐观。

detailed_translations.english: happening at the beginning
the first letter of someone’s first name

name: initiate
trans: vt.开始，创始；发起，倡议，提出

sentences.english: They have decided to initiate legal proceedings against the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定向该报提起法律诉讼。

sentences.english: Intellectuals have initiated a debate on terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 知识分子就恐怖主义发起了辩论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始， 创造， 发起； 使初步了解； 接纳， 让…加入
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something important to start, such as an official process or a new plan
someone who has been allowed to join a particular organization, club, or group and has been taught its secrets

sentences.english: The nurse gave me a tetanus injection.
sentences.chinese: 护士给我打了破伤风预防针。

sentences.english: The children hate having injections.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们讨厌打针。

sentences.english: a fuel injection system
sentences.chinese: 燃料注入系统

detailed_translations.english: an act of putting a drug into someone’s body using a special needle

sentences.english: She was taken to hospital with serious head injuries.
sentences.chinese: 她头部受重伤被送到医院。

sentences.english: Beckham has missed several games through injury
sentences.chinese: 贝克汉姆因伤错过了几场比赛。

sentences.english: He’s a lawyer who specializes in personal injury claims.
sentences.chinese: 他是个专门从事人身伤害索赔的律师。

detailed_translations.english: a wound or damage to part of your body caused by an accident or attack

name: inner
trans: a.内部的，里面的；思想的 n.内部；里面

sentences.english: an inner room
sentences.chinese: 内室

sentences.english: inner London
sentences.chinese: 伦敦中心区

sentences.english: the inner ear
sentences.chinese: 内耳

sentences.english: Yoga gives me a sense of inner calm.
sentences.chinese: 练习瑜伽使我感到内心平和。

detailed_translations.english: on the inside or close to the centre of something

sentences.english: inorganic matter
sentences.chinese: 无机物

detailed_translations.english: not consisting of anything that is living

sentences.english: an insect bite
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的叮咬

sentences.english: flying insects
sentences.chinese: 飞虫

sentences.english: Don’t forget to bring insect repellant (= a chemical to keep insects away ).
sentences.chinese: 不要忘记带上驱虫剂。

detailed_translations.english: a small creature such as a fly or ant, that has six legs, and sometimes wings

sentences.english: He took a small key from his pocket and slowly inserted it into the lock.
sentences.chinese: 他从衣袋里掏出一把小钥匙，然后缓缓地将其插入锁孔里。

detailed_translations.english: to put something inside or into something else

detailed_translations.chinese: 插入物；管芯；镶块；[机械]刀片
detailed_translations.english: something that is designed to be put inside something else

sentences.english: He concealed the key inside his tie.
sentences.chinese: 他把钥匙藏在领带里面。

sentences.english: The door had been locked from the inside.
sentences.chinese: 门从里面锁上了。

detailed_translations.english: in or into a container or other closed space so as to be completely covered or surrounded
the inner part of something, which is surrounded or hidden by the outer part

sentences.english: Stay for supper – I insist!
sentences.chinese: 留下来吃晚餐——一定的！

detailed_translations.english: to demand that something should happen

sentences.english: I got out of the car to inspect the damage.
sentences.chinese: 我下车查看损坏情况。

sentences.english: Police inspected the scene and interviewed all the staff.
sentences.chinese: 警察仔细检查了现场并询问了所有员工。

sentences.english: General Allenby arrived to inspect the troops.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦比将军前来检阅部队。

detailed_translations.english: to examine something carefully in order to find out more about it or to find out what is wrong with it

sentences.english: We need someone who can inspire the team.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一个能鼓舞团队士气的人。

sentences.english: Inspired by the sunny weather, I decided to explore the woods.
sentences.chinese: 阳光明媚的天气令人振奋，我决定到森林里寻幽探胜。

sentences.english: The story was inspired by a chance meeting with an old Russian duke.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事的创作灵感来自与一位俄国老公爵的不期而遇。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something

sentences.english: They’ve installed the new computer network at last.
sentences.chinese: 他们终于安装了新电脑网络。

sentences.english: Security cameras have been installed in the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 在市中心已安装了一些监控摄像机。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment somewhere and connect it so that it is ready to be used

sentences.english: In this instance I think she was mistaken.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上我认为她弄错了。

detailed_translations.english: an example of a particular kind of situation

sentences.english: You probably picked up my keys instead of yours.
sentences.chinese: 你可能没拿你的钥匙而错拿了我的。

sentences.english: Could I have tuna instead of ham?
sentences.chinese: 我可否要金枪鱼来代替火腿？

sentences.english: Instead of being annoyed, he seemed quite pleased.
sentences.chinese: 他没有生气，反而似乎很高兴。

detailed_translations.english: used to say what is not used, does not happen etc, when something else is used, happens etc

sentences.english: You probably picked up my keys instead of yours.
sentences.chinese: 你可能没拿你的钥匙而错拿了我的。

detailed_translations.english: used to say what is not used, does not happen etc, when something else is used, happens etc

sentences.english: Her instinct told her that something was wrong.
sentences.chinese: 直觉告诉她有些不对劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 本能； 直觉， 生性
detailed_translations.english: a natural tendency to behave in a particular way or a natural ability to know something, which is not learned

name: instruction
trans: n.教学，指导；命令，指示，用法说明

sentences.english: (= I have been told ) to give the package to him personally.
sentences.chinese: 我接到的指示是亲手把包裹交给他。

sentences.english: Make sure you carry out the doctor’s instructions.
sentences.chinese: 你一定要遵照医生的嘱咐。

sentences.english: The school gives instruction in first aid.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校教授急救课

detailed_translations.english: a statement telling someone what they must do

sentences.english: surgical instruments
sentences.chinese: 外科(手术)器械

detailed_translations.chinese: 仪器， 工具； 乐器
detailed_translations.english: a small tool used in work such as science or medicine

sentences.english: Your father took out insurance to cover the mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲购买了抵押借款保险。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement with a company in which you pay them money, especially regularly, and they pay the costs if something bad happens, for example if you become ill or your car is damaged

name: integrate
trans: vt./vi.使结合，使并入；使成一体

sentences.english: These programs can be integrated with your existing software.
sentences.chinese: 这些程序能和你的已有的软件整合成一体。

detailed_translations.english: to combine two or more things so that they work together; to combine with sth else in this way

name: integrated
trans: a.成整体的，完全的，完整的

sentences.english: an integrated public transport system
sentences.chinese: 综合公共交通体系

sentences.english: a racially integrated community
sentences.chinese: 一个各种族和谐相处的社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合的；完整的；互相协调的
detailed_translations.english: an integrated system, institution etc combines many different groups, ideas, or parts in a way that works well

detailed_translations.chinese: 整合；使…成整体（integrate的过去分词）

name: intellectual
trans: n.知识分子 a.智力的，理智的

sentences.english: Mark’s very intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 马克很聪明。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ability to understand things and think intelligently
an intelligent, well-educated person who spends time thinking about complicated ideas and discussing them

name: intelligence
trans: n.智力，理解力，聪明；情报，消息

sentences.english: To be good at the game, you need a reasonable level of intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 要想把这种游戏玩好，需要一定的智力水平。

sentences.english: According to our intelligence, further attacks were planned.
sentences.chinese: 根据我们的情报，还会有更进一步的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to learn, understand, and think about things

sentences.english: a group of highly intelligent (= very intelligent )students
sentences.chinese: 一组聪明异常的学生

sentences.english: Sontag was once famously described as the most intelligent woman in America.
sentences.chinese: 桑塔格曾被称为美国最聪明的女人，这是众人皆知的事。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly

sentences.english: Philosophy is a study that lets us be unhappy more intelligently.
sentences.chinese: 哲学是让我们更聪明地不快乐的一门学问。

sentences.english: Maybe your relationships will be your primary focus for a period of life, as well as learning how to cultivate them more intimately and intelligently.
sentences.chinese: 或许生活中的一段时期，你的主要焦点是人际关系，了解怎样聪明地培养人际亲密关系成为了关注点。

name: intend
trans: vt.想要，打算，计划；意指，意思是

sentences.english: Oddly enough, that is precisely what I intend.
sentences.chinese: 说也奇怪， 那正是我的打算。

sentences.english: They intend to be an army of light against the onslaught of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 他们打算成为一支光明之师对抗黑暗军团的猛烈进攻。

sentences.english: Young people today are under intense pressure to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 如今的年轻人面临要出人头地的巨大压力。

sentences.english: the intense heat of the desert
sentences.chinese: 沙漠的炽热

sentences.english: The pain was so intense I couldn’t sleep.
sentences.chinese: 疼得我都睡不着觉。

sentences.english: He took an intense interest in all religious matters.
sentences.chinese: 他对所有宗教事宜都很感兴趣。

sentences.english: a look of intense dislike
sentences.chinese: 极端厌恶的表情

sentences.english: The job demands intense concentration.
sentences.chinese: 这工作需要全神贯注。

detailed_translations.english: having a very strong effect or felt very strongly

sentences.english: The intensity of the hurricane was frightening.
sentences.chinese: 飓风的猛烈程度令人恐惧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈，剧烈；〔光、声等的〕强度
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being felt very strongly or having a strong effect

sentences.english: They went into town with the intention of visiting the library.
sentences.chinese: 他们进了城，打算参观图书馆。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or desire to do something

name: interact
trans: vi.互相作用；互相影响；交往

sentences.english: While the other children interacted and played together, Ted ignored them.
sentences.chinese: 当其他孩子们相互交往、一起玩耍时，泰德却不理他们。

detailed_translations.english: if people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together etc

sentences.english: But you only get the maximum benefit if you implement all of them, because their power comes from their interaction.
sentences.chinese: 但您只能在实现所有方法的情况下获得最大收益，因为它们的力量来自它们之间的交互。

sentences.english: But you only get the maximum benefit if you implement all of them, because their power comes from their interaction.
sentences.chinese: 但您只有在实现所有方法的情况下才能获得最多的收益，因为它们的力量来自于它们之间的相互作用。

sentences.english: The real power of the concept comes not from any one of these devices; it emerges from the interaction of all of them.
sentences.chinese: 这个概念的很正力量并不来自于这些设备的任何一个；它来自于这些设备之间的交互。

detailed_translations.english: a process by which two or more things affect each other

sentences.english: These two words are almost interchangeable.
sentences.chinese: 这两个单词几乎可以互换使用。

sentences.english: a camera with interchangeable lenses
sentences.chinese: 可换镜头的照相机

detailed_translations.chinese: 可互换的；可交换的；可交替的
detailed_translations.english: things that are interchangeable can be used instead of each other

sentences.english: I watched the first few episodes, but soon lost interest.
sentences.chinese: 我看了前几集，但很快就失去了兴趣。

sentences.english: The last round of bidding aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 最后一轮竞价引起人们相当大的兴趣。

sentences.english: Our survey reveals a disturbing lack of interest in teacher training.
sentences.chinese: 我们的调查显示人们对教师培训失去了兴趣，这很令人不安。

sentences.english: I read your article with great interest.
sentences.chinese: 我兴致勃勃地拜读了您的文章。

sentences.english: to promote/protect/safeguard sb's interests
sentences.chinese: 为某人的利益游说；保护 / 维护某人的利益

sentences.english: The money was repaid with interest.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱是带息偿还的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that you have when you want to know or learn more about sb/sth

sentences.english: That’s an interesting question.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个有趣的问题。

sentences.english: a really interesting TV programme
sentences.chinese: 十分有趣的电视节目

sentences.english: Did you meet any interesting people?
sentences.chinese: 你见过什么有意思的人吗？

sentences.english: It’s interesting that no one remembers seeing the car.
sentences.chinese: 竟然没人记得见过这辆车，真是有趣。

detailed_translations.english: attracting your attention because it is special, exciting or unusual

sentences.english: My daughter-in-law said that I was interfering, but I was only trying to help.
sentences.chinese: 我的儿媳说我多管闲事，但我只是想帮忙。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed

sentences.english: Industrial relations should be free from state interference.
sentences.chinese: 劳资关系应不受政府干预。

detailed_translations.english: an act of interfering

sentences.english: an intermediate coursebook
sentences.chinese: 中级课本

sentences.english: an intermediate stage/step in a process
sentences.chinese: 中间阶段 / 步骤

detailed_translations.english: having more than a basic knowledge of sth but not yet advanced

sentences.english: We have no interest in interfering in the internal affairs of other countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们对干涉其他国家内政不感兴趣。

sentences.english: the threat to internal security
sentences.chinese: 对国内安全的威胁

sentences.english: internal markets
sentences.chinese: 国内市场

sentences.english: There’s to be an internal inquiry into the whole affair.
sentences.chinese: 对整个事件将进行内部调查。

detailed_translations.english: within a particular country

sentences.english: the response of the international community
sentences.chinese: 国际社会的反响

sentences.english: the UN and other international organizations
sentences.chinese: 联合国和其他国际组织

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving more than one nation

sentences.english: They spoke good Spanish, and promised to interpret for me.
sentences.chinese: 他们西班牙语说得很好，答应替我翻译。

sentences.english: Freud’s attempts to interpret the meaning of dreams
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德对梦的含义的解析

detailed_translations.english: to translate spoken words from one language into another

name: interrupt
trans: vt.打断，打扰；阻碍 vi.打断，打扰

sentences.english: Will you stop interrupting me!
sentences.chinese: 别打断我的话！

sentences.english: Sorry to interrupt, but I need to ask you to come downstairs.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉打扰了，我得请你下楼来。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from continuing what they are saying or doing by suddenly speaking to them, making a noise etc

sentences.english: interstate commerce
sentences.chinese: 州际贸易

detailed_translations.english: involving different states, especially in the US
a wide road that goes between states, on which cars can travel very fast

name: interval
trans: n.间隔，间距；幕间（或工间）休息

sentences.english: He left the room, returning after a short interval with a message.
sentences.chinese: 他离开房间，过了一会儿就带回来一条消息。

sentences.english: We can get some drinks in the interval.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以在幕间休息时喝点什么。

sentences.english: Trees had been planted at regular intervals.
sentences.chinese: 树已按均距栽种。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time between two events, activities etc

sentences.english: a portfolio of work presented at interview
sentences.chinese: 在面试时呈递的工作成果样本

sentences.english: a police interview
sentences.chinese: 警方问讯

sentences.english: We’re interviewing six candidates for the job.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作我们要面试六名申请人。

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting at which someone is asked questions in order to find out whether they are suitable for a job, course of study etc
to ask someone questions during an interview

sentences.english: Being a good interviewer, however, requires much preparation and skill.
sentences.chinese: 不过，好的采访者需要许多准备和技巧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 采访者；会见者；面谈者；进行面试者
detailed_translations.english: the person who asks the questions in an interview

sentences.english: Attempts to intimidate her failed.
sentences.chinese: 恐吓她的企图失败了。

detailed_translations.english: to frighten or threaten someone into making them do what you want

sentences.english: Come into the office.
sentences.chinese: 到办公室里来。

sentences.english: He thrust his hand into his coat pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他把手插进大衣口袋里。

sentences.english: There must be another way into the cave.
sentences.chinese: 一定有其他的路可以进入洞穴。

sentences.english: Sue got back into bed and pulled the quilt over her head.
sentences.chinese: 休回到床上，拉过被子蒙住头。

sentences.english: I’ve got to go into town this morning.
sentences.chinese: 我今天上午得进城去。

sentences.english: We dived into the sea.
sentences.chinese: 我们跳进海里。

detailed_translations.english: to the inside or inner part of a container, place, area etc

sentences.english: Several senators introduced legislation aimed at sexual harassment.
sentences.chinese: 几位参议员提交了针对性骚扰的立法议案。

detailed_translations.english: to formally present a possible new law to be discussed

sentences.english: It invariably rains when I go there.
sentences.chinese: 我每次去那儿都下雨。

sentences.english: The security guards were invariably ex-servicemen.
sentences.chinese: 保安人员毫无例外地都是退伍军人。

detailed_translations.english: always

sentences.english: the invasion of Normandy
sentences.chinese: 对诺曼底的入侵

detailed_translations.english: when the army of one country enters another country by force, in order to take control of it

sentences.english: The invention of the computer has revolutionized the business world.
sentences.chinese: 电脑的发明使商界发生了根本变化。

sentences.english: They subsequently admitted that the story was pure invention.
sentences.chinese: 他们后来承认他们说的纯属虚构。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发明，创造；捏造， 假话
detailed_translations.english: the act of inventing something

sentences.english: Alexander Graham Bell, the inventor of the telephone
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大·格雷厄姆·贝尔，电话的发明者

detailed_translations.english: someone who has invented something, or whose job is to invent things

sentences.english: ...a scandalous inversion of the truth.
sentences.chinese: ...一个令人愤慨的是非颠倒。

detailed_translations.english: the act of changing something so that it is the opposite of what it was before, or of turning something upside down (= the bottom is on the top and the top is on the bottom )

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

sentences.english: We plan to buy some property as an investment.
sentences.chinese: 我们打算买些房地产作为投资。

sentences.english: a huge investment of time and effort
sentences.chinese: 时间和精力的大量投入

detailed_translations.english: the use of money to get a profit or to make a business activity successful, or the money that is used

sentences.english: The house was surrounded by trees, and invisible from the road.
sentences.chinese: 这所房子树木环绕，从路上是看不见的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is invisible cannot be seen

sentences.english: I’m afraid I wasn’t invited.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我没有受到邀请。

sentences.english: Successful candidates will be invited for interview next week.
sentences.chinese: 通过甄别的候选人将获邀于下周参加面试。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone to come to a party, wedding, meal etc

name: involve
trans: vt.使卷入，使参与（in）；牵涉；包含，含有

sentences.english: What will the job involve?
sentences.chinese: 这份工作包括什么？

sentences.english: I didn’t realize putting on a play involved so much work.
sentences.chinese: 我没想到上演一出戏剧需要做这么多的工作。

detailed_translations.english: if an activity or situation involves something, that thing is part of it or a result of it

name: involvement
trans: n.卷入，牵连；牵连到的事，复杂情况

sentences.english: School officials say they welcome parental involvement.
sentences.chinese: 校方说他们欢迎学生父母参与。

name: Iowa
trans: 衣阿华（或译爱俄华）（美国州名）

sentences.english: So why go to Iraq when you can go to Canada?
sentences.chinese: 因此，如果你可以去加拿大的话，为什么要去伊拉克呢？

sentences.english: I have a picture of you and I together in Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 我有一张您和我一起在伊拉克的照片。

sentences.english: I learned about the present acute situation in Iraq in the newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 我从报上得知伊拉克目前的严重局势。

sentences.english: We surmised you had gone to Ireland.
sentences.chinese: 我们还以为你去爱尔兰了呢，原来你并没去呀。

sentences.english: Etymology: over England; from one land to another; into Ireland.
sentences.chinese: 词源学：越过英格兰，从一个陆地到另一个陆地，爱尔兰。

sentences.english: Ireland, Portugal and Greece have all required rescues.
sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰，葡萄牙和希腊都需要救助。

sentences.english: the iron and steel industry
sentences.chinese: 钢铁工业

sentences.english: a driveway with large iron gates
sentences.chinese: 安装了大铁门的私家车道

sentences.english: the absorption of iron from food
sentences.chinese: 对食物中铁的吸收

sentences.english: ...a man of icy nerve and iron will.
sentences.chinese: …一个头脑冷静、意志坚强的男人。

detailed_translations.english: a common hard metal that is used to make steel, is  magnetic  , and is found in very small quantities in food and blood. It is a chemical  element  : symbol Fe
to make clothes smooth using an iron
You can use iron to describe the character or behaviour of someone who is very firm in their decisions and actions, or who can control their feelings well

name: irrelevant
trans: a.不相干的，离题的，与…不相干

sentences.english: We’re focussing too much on irrelevant details.
sentences.chinese: 我们过于关注不相干的细节。

sentences.english: Students viewed Latin as boring and irrelevant.
sentences.chinese: 学生认为拉丁语无聊且无关紧要。

detailed_translations.english: not useful or not relating to a particular situation, and therefore not important

sentences.english: It was highly irresponsible of him to leave the children on their own in the pool.
sentences.chinese: 他把孩子们独自留在游泳池里，真是太不负责任了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不对更高一级负责的；不承担责任的；无责任感的；无负责能力的
detailed_translations.english: doing careless things without thinking or worrying about the possible bad results

detailed_translations.chinese: 不负责任的人， 无责任感的人

name: Isaac Newton
trans: 牛顿（英国物理学家，数学家和天文学家）

sentences.english: What Sir Isaac Newton was doing late at night may surprise you.
sentences.chinese: 在深夜艾萨克·牛顿先生做的事可能会令你感到惊奇。

sentences.english: Sir Isaac Newton supposedly discovered gravity through the fall of an apple.
sentences.chinese: 据称艾萨克·牛顿爵士通过苹果落地，发现了万有引力。

sentences.english: One of the most well known tenets of physics — for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction — was first discovered by Isaac Newton.
sentences.chinese: 物理学最广为人知的一条定律——对任何一个动作而言，存在一个相同大小的反作用——由艾萨克·牛顿发现。

detailed_translations.chinese: 艾萨克•牛顿（英国科学家）

sentences.english: I live on an island.
sentences.chinese: 我住在一个岛上。

sentences.english: Then one day, an English ship anchored near the island.
sentences.chinese: 然后有一天，一艘英国船在岛附近抛锚了。

sentences.english: This is because the island is so close to the equator. So you can choose to go whenever you like.
sentences.chinese: 就因为这个岛是如此接近赤道。所以只要你愿意你任何时候都可以去。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of land completely surrounded by water

name: isolate
trans: vt.使隔离，使孤立 a.孤立的

sentences.english: The town was isolated by the floods.
sentences.chinese: 洪水使该镇与外界隔绝。

sentences.english: The US has sought to isolate Cuba both economically and politically.
sentences.chinese: 美国一直想在经济和政治上孤立古巴。

detailed_translations.english: to separate one person, group, or thing from other people or things

name: issue
trans: n.问题；（书刊的）期号 vt.发行，颁布，出版

sentences.english: Silva issued a statement denying all knowledge of the affair.
sentences.chinese: 西尔瓦发表声明，宣称对此事一无所知。

sentences.english: a warning issued by the Surgeon General
sentences.chinese: （美国）卫生局局长发出的警告

detailed_translations.chinese: 发行； 分发， 发出
detailed_translations.english: to officially make a statement, give an order, warning etc
a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people

sentences.english: ‘Where’s your office?’ ‘It’s on the third floor.’
sentences.chinese: “你的办公室在哪儿？”“在三楼。”

sentences.english: I love the spring – it’s a wonderful time of the year.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢春季——这是一年里最美妙的时节。

sentences.english: There were people crying, buildings on fire. It was terrible!
sentences.chinese: 有人在哭喊，楼房在燃烧―太可怕了！

sentences.english: Don’t blame me. It wasn’t my idea.
sentences.chinese: 不要责备我，这不是我的主意。

sentences.english: This little beast is a lemur and it lives in Madagascar.
sentences.chinese: 这小动物是狐猴，生活在马达加斯加。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer to a thing, animal, situation, idea etc that has already been mentioned or is already known about

sentences.english: I watch Italian football a lot.
sentences.chinese: 我常看意大利足球。

sentences.english: The Italian way is to round off a meal with an ice-cream.
sentences.chinese: 意大利人总是在用餐结束时来份冰激凌。

detailed_translations.english: relating to Italy, its people, or its language
someone from Italy

sentences.english: They decided to swan around Italy this summer.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定今年夏天去意大利游逛。

sentences.english: French troops negotiated the Alps and went on the road in Italy.
sentences.chinese: 法军成功地越过了阿尔卑斯山脉，行军在意大利的国土上。

sentences.english: All the newspapers reported on the football match of France versus Italy.
sentences.chinese: 所有的报纸都报道了法国队对意大利队的足球比赛。

sentences.english: He opened the cardboard box and took out each item.
sentences.chinese: 他打开纸板箱把里面的物品一一拿出来。

sentences.english: The store is having a sale on furniture and household items.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店正在减价出售家具和家居用品。

sentences.english: luxury items such as exotic spices and perfumes
sentences.chinese: 异国香料和香水之类的奢侈品

sentences.english: The original 1965 bottle is now a collector’s item (= one of a set of objects people like to collect because they are interesting or valuable ).
sentences.chinese: 这瓶1965年生产的原装酒现在是收藏品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔尤指清单上、一群或一组事物中的〕一项，一件，一条
detailed_translations.english: a single thing, especially one thing in a list, group, or set of things

sentences.english: He emphasized its importance to me.
sentences.chinese: 他向我强调它的重要性。

sentences.english: The child read the story but did not comprehend its meaning.
sentences.chinese: 这个孩子读了这篇故事，但不能理解它的意思。

sentences.english: The company disseminated information about its new programmes.
sentences.chinese: 公司传播有关其新计划的信息。

sentences.english: The cat lay on the sofa, washing itself.
sentences.chinese: 猫躺在沙发上把自己舔干。

sentences.english: The machine switches itself off when the process is complete.
sentences.chinese: 工作程序结束，机器会自动关闭。

sentences.english: a small local enterprise that has transformed itself into a highly successful company
sentences.chinese: 已发展为业绩喜人的公司的一家小型地方企业

detailed_translations.english: used to show that a thing, organization, animal, or baby that does something is affected by its own action

name: ivory
trans: n.象牙 a.象牙制成的；似象牙的

sentences.english: an ivory chess set
sentences.chinese: 一副象牙国际象棋

sentences.english: an ivory silk wedding gown
sentences.chinese: 乳白色真丝婚纱

detailed_translations.english: the hard smooth yellowish-white substance from the tusks of an  elephant

sentences.english: The wall is covered all over with ivy.
sentences.chinese: 墙上爬满了常春藤。

sentences.english: This ivy was green at a time when other ivies had pooped out.
sentences.chinese: 这棵常春藤在其他常春藤都已凋谢时却仍然是绿的。

detailed_translations.english: a climbing plant with dark green shiny leaves

name: Ivy League
trans: 常春藤联合会；名牌大学的

name: jail
trans: n.监狱，看守所；监禁 vt.监禁；拘留，禁锢

sentences.english: He’s been in jail for three months already.
sentences.chinese: 他已经入狱三个月。

detailed_translations.english: a place where criminals are kept as part of their punishment, or where people who have been charged with a crime are kept before they are judged in a law court

sentences.english: We always have snow in January.
sentences.chinese: 我们这里1月份总会下雪。

detailed_translations.english: the first month of the year, between December and February

sentences.english: We set sail from China for Japan.
sentences.chinese: 我们从中国启航驶往日本。

sentences.english: He punched him on the jaw.
sentences.chinese: 他一拳打在他的下巴上。

sentences.english: a rugged physique and a strong square jaw
sentences.chinese: 强健的体格以及结实的方下巴

sentences.english: She’s got a very determined jaw.
sentences.chinese: 她一脸坚毅。

detailed_translations.english: the lower part of your face. Its shape is sometimes thought to show your character

sentences.english: a jazz band
sentences.chinese: 爵士乐队

sentences.english: a jazz club
sentences.chinese: 爵士乐俱乐部

sentences.english: modern jazz
sentences.chinese: 现代爵士乐

detailed_translations.english: a type of music that has a strong beat and parts for performers to play alone

detailed_translations.chinese: 奏爵士乐，跳爵士舞；游荡

name: Jefferson Airplane
trans: 杰弗逊飞机（美国摇滚乐队名）

name: jeopardize
trans: vt.使处于危险境地；危及，损害

sentences.english: large-scale military offensives which could jeopardize the UN peace process
sentences.chinese: 可能会破坏联合国和平进程的大规模军事进攻

detailed_translations.english: to risk losing or spoiling something important

name: Jerusalem
trans: 耶路撒冷（西南亚巴勒斯坦地区著名古城）

name: jet
trans: n.喷射；喷嘴；喷气式飞机，喷气发动机

sentences.english: He owns a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 他拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 喷射，喷嘴；喷气式飞机；黑玉
detailed_translations.english: a fast plane with a jet engine
if a liquid or gas jets out from somewhere, it comes quickly out of a small hole

sentences.english: Many sacrificed their weekend to join the hunt for the missing girl.
sentences.chinese: 许多人牺牲周末时间，加入了寻找失踪女孩的行动。

sentences.english: the benefits of joining our pension scheme
sentences.chinese: 参加我们的退休金计划的好处

sentences.english: Church leaders have joined the campaign to end foxhunting.
sentences.chinese: 教会领袖参与了禁止猎狐的运动。

sentences.english: Join the two pieces of wood with strong glue.
sentences.chinese: 用强力胶水把两块木头黏合起来。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to take part in an activity that other people are involved in

name: journalism
trans: n.新闻业；[总称]报刊；新闻学

sentences.english: a career in journalism
sentences.chinese: 新闻工作生涯

sentences.english: The hospital has been the target of investigative journalism(= journalism that examines an event or situation in order to find out the truth ).
sentences.chinese: 这家医院成了调查报道的目标。

detailed_translations.english: the job or activity of writing news reports for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio

sentences.english: the friends they made on the journey
sentences.chinese: 他们在旅途中交下的朋友

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when you travel from one place to another, especially over a long distance
an occasion when you travel from one place to another, especially over a long distance

sentences.english: the look of joy on her face
sentences.chinese: 她脸上的喜悦表情

sentences.english: The garden was his pride and joy.
sentences.chinese: 这座花园是他的骄傲和乐趣所在。

detailed_translations.english: great happiness and pleasure

name: judgment
trans: n.审判，判决；看法，意见；评价；判断

sentences.english: I’ve known him for years and I trust his judgment.
sentences.chinese: 我与他相识多年，相信他的判断力。

sentences.english: a decision based on sound judgment
sentences.chinese: 以良好的判断力为基础的决定

sentences.english: Watch carefully and use your judgment.
sentences.chinese: 仔细观察并运用自己的判断力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 判断；裁判；判决书；辨别力
detailed_translations.english: the ability to make sensible decisions about what to do and when to do it

sentences.english: a carton of orange juice
sentences.chinese: 一纸盒橙汁

sentences.english: A Coke and a tomato juice, please.
sentences.chinese: 请来一杯可乐和一杯番茄汁。

detailed_translations.english: the liquid that comes from fruit and vegetables, or a drink that is made from this
