sentences.english: Homework should not be used as a means of controlling children.
sentences.chinese: 家庭作业不应该作为约束儿童的手段。

sentences.english: I had no means of telling him I would be late.
sentences.chinese: 我没有办法告诉他我会迟到。

sentences.english: Brian was prepared to use any means to get what he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩准备不择手段地得到他想要的。

sentences.english: They had entered the country by unlawful means .
sentences.chinese: 他们通过非法途径进入了这个国家。

sentences.english: the means by which performance is assessed
sentences.chinese: 评估表现的手段

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing or achieving something

sentences.english: My first novel was rejected by six publishers. In the meantime I had written a play.
sentences.chinese: 我的第一部小说遭到六家出版商的拒绝。其间我又完成了一部戏剧。

sentences.english: The doctor will be here soon. In the meantime, try and relax.
sentences.chinese: 医生很快就来，现在尽量放松一下。

sentences.english: I'll contact them soon. Meantime don't tell them I'm back.
sentences.chinese: 我会尽快和他们联系。在此期间，不要告诉他们我回来了。

detailed_translations.english: in the period of time between two times or two events
英文释义: meanwhile

sentences.english: New safety measures were being demanded after last night’s horrific train crash.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生严重的火车相撞事故后，民众要求制定新的安全措施。

sentences.english: The new bridge was erected as a temporary measure to replace the one which was destroyed by floods.
sentences.chinese: 建这座新桥是为了临时代替被洪水毁坏的那座桥。

detailed_translations.english: an action, especially an official one, that is intended to deal with a particular problem

sentences.english: What’s your waist measurement?
sentences.chinese: 你腰围是多少？

sentences.english: accurate measurement of body temperature
sentences.chinese: 体温的精确测量

detailed_translations.english: the length, height etc of something

sentences.english: I gave up eating meat a few months ago.
sentences.chinese: 我几个月以前开始不吃肉了。

sentences.english: raw meat
sentences.chinese: 生肉

sentences.english: a meat pie
sentences.chinese: 肉馅饼

sentences.english: a selection of cold meats
sentences.chinese: 各种冷盘肉

detailed_translations.english: the flesh of animals and birds eaten as food

name: mechanical
trans: a.机械的；机械学的，力学的；呆板的

sentences.english: The flight has been cancelled due to mechanical failure.
sentences.chinese: 因机械故障航班被取消了。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing because of mechanical problems.
sentences.chinese: 飞机因机械故障不得不紧急降落。

sentences.english: the mechanical properties of solids
sentences.chinese: 固体的力学性能

detailed_translations.english: affecting or involving a machine

sentences.english: the brake mechanism
sentences.chinese: 刹车装置

sentences.english: a clock mechanism
sentences.chinese: 钟表机件

detailed_translations.english: part of a machine or a set of parts that does a particular job

sentences.english: Medicines should be kept out of the reach of children.
sentences.chinese: 药应放在孩子够不到的地方。

sentences.english: She studied medicine at Johns Hopkins University.
sentences.chinese: 她曾在约翰•霍普金斯大学学医。

sentences.english: the remarkable achievements of modern medicine
sentences.chinese: 现代医学的非凡成就

detailed_translations.english: a substance used for treating illness, especially a liquid you drink

sentences.english: Advertising is a powerful medium.
sentences.chinese: 广告是具有强大影响力的传播媒介。

sentences.english: hair of medium length
sentences.chinese: 中等长短的头发

detailed_translations.english: a way of communicating information and news to people, such as newspapers, television etc
of middle size, level, or amount

sentences.english: You’ll never guess who I met in town.
sentences.chinese: 你绝对猜不出我在镇上碰到谁了。

sentences.english: I was worried I might meet Henry on the bus.
sentences.chinese: 我担心可能会在公共汽车上遇到亨利。

detailed_translations.english: to see someone by chance and talk to them
to see someone by chance and talk to them

sentences.english: We’re having a meeting next week to discuss the matter.
sentences.chinese: 我们下周将开会讨论此事。

sentences.english: I had felt drawn to Alice ever since our first meeting.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次见到艾丽斯就感觉被她吸引住了

detailed_translations.english: an event at which people meet to discuss and decide things

sentences.english: The majority of union members voted in favour of a strike.
sentences.chinese: 大多数工会成员投票赞成罢工。

detailed_translations.english: a person or country that belongs to a group or organization

sentences.english: He studied his map, trying to memorize the way to Rose's street.
sentences.chinese: 他研究了地图，努力记住去罗丝家那条街的路。

detailed_translations.english: to learn words, music etc so that you know them perfectly

sentences.english: He has lots of happy memories of his stay in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 他对在日本逗留的那段时光有许多美好的回忆。

sentences.english: The data is stored in the computer’s memory.
sentences.chinese: 数据储存在电脑的存储器里

detailed_translations.english: something that you remember from the past about a person, place, or experience

name: mental
trans: a.智力的，脑力的；精神的，思想上的

sentences.english: The centre provides help for people suffering from mental illness .
sentences.chinese: 该中心对精神病患者提供帮助。

sentences.english: Stress has an effect on both your physical and mental health .
sentences.chinese: 压力对身体健康和心理健康都有影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 心理的， 精神的， 思想上的； 精神病的； 智力的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the health or state of someone’s mind

sentences.english: Was my name mentioned at all?
sentences.chinese: 我的名字被提到过吗？

sentences.english: Some of the problems were mentioned in his report.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些问题在他的报告里提到了。

sentences.english: (= it is important enough to mention ) that they only studied a very small number of cases.
sentences.chinese: 必须说明的是他们仅研究了几个个案。

sentences.english: As I mentioned earlier , there have been a lot of changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 正如我刚才所说的，最近变化很大。

sentences.english: She mentioned in passing (= mentioned in a quick unimportant way ) that you had just been to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 她只是随口提了一下你刚刚去过罗马。

sentences.english: They all get a mention (= they are all mentioned ) in the book.
sentences.chinese: 他们在书中全都被提到了。

detailed_translations.english: to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details
when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

sentences.english: Could we have the menu, please?
sentences.chinese: 请把菜单给我们，好吗？

sentences.english: a three course set menu
sentences.chinese: 三道菜的套餐

detailed_translations.english: a list of all the kinds of food that are available for a meal, especially in a restaurant

sentences.english: the son of a wealthy merchant
sentences.chinese: 一名富商的儿子

sentences.english: There's been a big reduction in the size of the merchant fleet in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来商船队的数量大为缩减。

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys and sells goods in large quantities
Merchant seamen or ships are involved in carrying goods for trade

sentences.english: He showed no mercy to his enemies.
sentences.chinese: 他对敌人毫不仁慈。

sentences.english: God have mercy on his soul.
sentences.chinese: 愿上帝宽恕他的灵魂。

detailed_translations.english: if someone shows mercy, they choose to forgive or to be kind to someone who they have the power to hurt or punish

sentences.english: He’s merely a boy – you can’t expect him to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他只是个孩子——你不要指望他能理解。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize how small or unimportant something or someone is

sentences.english: The merit of the report is its realistic assessment of the changes required.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告的优点就是它对所要求的变动进行了实事求是的评估。

sentences.english: The great merit of the project is its flexibility and low cost.
sentences.chinese: 该项目最大的优点是它的灵活性和低成本。

sentences.english: Each of these approaches to teaching has its merits .
sentences.chinese: 这些教学方法每一种都有其优点。

sentences.english: Tonight’s meeting will weigh up the relative merits of the two candidates.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的会议将对两位候选人的相对优点进行考量。

sentences.english: It’s a fascinating book which merits attention.
sentences.chinese: 这是本引人入胜的书，值得关注。

detailed_translations.english: an advantage or good feature of something
to be good, important, or serious enough for praise or attention

sentences.english: He marched off, whistling a merry tune.
sentences.chinese: 他吹着一首欢快的曲子大步走了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愉快的；微醉的；嬉戏作乐的
detailed_translations.english: used to say that you hope someone will have a happy time at Christmas

name: Mesopotamia
trans: 美索不达米亚（亦称“两河流域”）

sentences.english: The message of the film is that good always triumphs over evil.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影的主题思想是善良终必战胜邪恶。

sentences.english: The result of this legal battle sends an important message to people in similar situations.
sentences.chinese: 这场诉讼战的结果给情况相似的人们传递了一个重要的信息。

sentences.english: It’s perfectly possible to get your message across (= communicate what you want to say ) without being so angry.
sentences.chinese: 就算不这么生气，你也完全可以把意思说清楚。

sentences.english: They use illustrations to convey their message.
sentences.chinese: 他们用图示来表达他们的意思。

detailed_translations.english: the main or most important idea that someone is trying to tell people about in a film, book, speech etc

sentences.english: This drug speeds up your metabolism.
sentences.chinese: 这种药物会加快你的新陈代谢。

detailed_translations.english: the chemical processes by which food is changed into energy in your body

sentences.english: The gate is made of metal.
sentences.chinese: 这扇大门是用金属做成的。

sentences.english: a small black metal box
sentences.chinese: 一个黑色的金属小盒子

sentences.english: They traded in gold and other precious metals (= valuable metals used especially for making jewellery ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们做黄金和其他贵金属的交易。

sentences.english: The old trucks were sold as scrap metal (= old metal that is melted and used again ) .
sentences.chinese: 这些旧卡车被当作金属废料卖掉了。

detailed_translations.english: a hard, usually shiny substance such as iron, gold, or steel

sentences.english: A man came to read the electricity meter .
sentences.chinese: 有个男的来抄电表。

detailed_translations.chinese: 米；仪表；[计量] 公尺；韵律
detailed_translations.english: a machine that measures the level of something
to measure how much of something is used, and how much you must pay for it, by using a meter

sentences.english: traditional teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 传统的教学法

sentences.english: I think we should try again using a different method.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们应该用不同的方法再试一次。

sentences.english: effective methods for the storage and retrieval of information
sentences.chinese: 信息存储和检索的有效方法

detailed_translations.english: a planned way of doing something, especially one that a lot of people know about and use

sentences.english: He quotes some students from the University of Michigan.
sentences.chinese: 他引述了几位密歇根大学学生的话。

sentences.english: He points out that some past offenders in Michigan have been released only to cause havoc and end up in jail again.
sentences.chinese: 他指出，过去密歇根释放的一些犯人只是与造成严重破坏的人有关，而且最后又都重新回到监狱里。

sentences.english: She grew up in a wealthy suburb of Detroit in Michigan and did well at school.
sentences.chinese: 她在密歇根底特律一个富裕的郊区长大，在学校表现也很好。

name: microelectronics
trans: n.微电子学，超小型电子学

name: microscopic
trans: a.显微镜的；微观的；微小的，细微的

sentences.english: a microscopic speck of dust
sentences.chinese: 微小的尘粒

sentences.english: Inspectors discovered microscopic cracks in the hull of the submarine.
sentences.chinese: 检测人员发现潜艇的船身有细微的裂缝。

detailed_translations.english: extremely small and therefore very difficult to see

sentences.english: We rowed out towards the middle of the lake.
sentences.chinese: 我们朝湖中央划去。

sentences.english: They spent the middle part of their vacation in Florida.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：假期的中间一段他们是在佛罗里达州度过的。

detailed_translations.english: the part that is nearest the centre of something, and furthest from the sides, edges, top, bottom etc
half of the way through an event or period of time

sentences.english: You can’t phone her now – it’s gone midnight (= after midnight ) !
sentences.chinese: 你现在不能打电话给她，都过午夜了！

sentences.english: By the time he arrived, it was well past midnight (= after midnight ) .
sentences.chinese: 他到的时候早已经是后半夜了。

sentences.english: He’s gone for a midnight swim.
sentences.chinese: 他深更半夜去游泳了。

detailed_translations.english: 12 o’clock at night

sentences.english: I fear we have an enemy in our midst.
sentences.chinese: 我担心我们中间有内奸。

detailed_translations.english: in a particular group
surrounded by people or things

sentences.english: If you need more information, you might try the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 如果你需要更多的信息，可以试试因特网。

sentences.english: I thought we might go to the new Chinese restaurant on the High Street.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们可以到大街上新开的那家中国餐馆去。

sentences.english: It might be a good idea to put those plants in the shade.
sentences.chinese: 把那些植物放在阴凉处也许是个好主意。

sentences.english: We’re going to a concert. You might like to come with us.
sentences.chinese: 我们要去听音乐会，你也许想和我们一起去吧。

detailed_translations.english: if something might happen or might be true, there is a possibility that it may happen or may be true, but you are not at all certain

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

sentences.english: It’s 40 miles from here to the Polish border.
sentences.chinese: 从这里到波兰边界有40英里。

sentences.english: an area 50 miles wide and 150 miles long
sentences.chinese: 一片50英里宽、150英里长的地区

sentences.english: We walked about half a mile .
sentences.chinese: 我们大约走了半英里。

sentences.english: He was driving at 70 miles per hour .
sentences.chinese: 他正以每小时70英里的速度驾车行驶。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring distance, equal to 1,760  yard s  or about 1,609 metres

sentences.english: a military helicopter
sentences.chinese: 军用直升机

sentences.english: military equipment
sentences.chinese: 军事设备

sentences.english: The government has threatened to take military action if the rebels do not withdraw from the area.
sentences.chinese: 政府警告说，如果叛乱分子不从该地区撤出，就要采取军事行动。

sentences.english: The United States is prepared to use military force to achieve its aims.
sentences.chinese: 美国准备动用武力达成目的。

sentences.english: a raid by European military forces
sentences.chinese: 欧洲军事力量发动的袭击

detailed_translations.english: used by, involving, or relating to the army, navy, or airforce
the military forces of a country

sentences.english: a bottle of milk
sentences.chinese: 一瓶奶

sentences.english: Would you like some milk in your tea?
sentences.chinese: 你茶里要加点奶吗？

sentences.english: a pint of semi-skimmed milk
sentences.chinese: 一品脱半脱脂奶

sentences.english: I helped to milk the cows.
sentences.chinese: 我帮忙挤牛奶。

detailed_translations.english: a white liquid produced by cows or goats that is drunk by people
to take milk from a cow or goat

sentences.english: a cup of milky coffee
sentences.chinese: 一杯牛奶咖啡

detailed_translations.chinese: 乳白色的；牛奶的；乳状的；柔和的；混浊不清的
detailed_translations.english: containing a lot of milk

sentences.english: The book sold more than a million copies.
sentences.chinese: 这本书售出了一百多万册。

sentences.english: I’ve got a million ideas.
sentences.chinese: 我主意多得很。

detailed_translations.english: the number 1,000,000
an extremely large number of people or things

sentences.english: It is impossible to understand the complex nature of the human mind.
sentences.chinese: 要想了解人类思维复杂的特性是不可能的。

sentences.english: Mind and body are closely related.
sentences.chinese: 思想和肉体紧密相连。

sentences.english: Meditation involves focusing the mind on a single object or word.
sentences.chinese: 冥想需要把思想集中在一个物体或单词上。

sentences.english: Sorry─your name has gone right out of my mind.
sentences.chinese: 对不起——我完全想不起你的名字了。

detailed_translations.english: your thoughts or your ability to think, feel, and imagine things

sentences.english: It was Glen’s idea, not mine.
sentences.chinese: 这是格伦的主意，不是我的。

sentences.english: ‘Is that your car?’ ‘No, mine is parked over the road.’
sentences.chinese: “那是你的车吗？”“不是，我的车停在路对面。”

sentences.english: You’ve got good legs – mine are too thin.
sentences.chinese: 你的腿很美——我的腿太细了。

sentences.english: His English is better than mine.
sentences.chinese: 他英语比我好。

detailed_translations.english: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with himself or herself

sentences.english: Therefore, we should be more like a miner to stand in reality, excavate off wastes, and get gold mines.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们更应该像一个矿工一样为执著于现实，挖开渣滓，淘出金矿。

sentences.english: From the standpoint of know-how the only difference between the miner of graphite in Ceylon and the logger in Oregon is in the type of know-how.
sentences.chinese: 从知道者的立场来看所谓的知道之间的不同不过是锡兰的矿工之于石墨和俄勒冈的伐木工人之间在某一类别的知道而已。

sentences.english: A miner bought food from a makeshift shop set up in the trunk of a car near a roadblock by striking miners.
sentences.chinese: 一位矿工从搭建在车厢中的临时食品店中购买食物，附近的道路都被罢工的矿工们设置了路障。

detailed_translations.english: someone who works under the ground in a mine to remove coal, gold etc

sentences.english: The area is very rich in minerals .
sentences.chinese: 该地区矿产非常丰富。

sentences.english: a country with few mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 矿产资源稀少的国家

sentences.english: mineral water
sentences.chinese: 矿泉水

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is formed naturally in the earth, such as coal, salt, stone, or gold. Minerals can be dug out of the ground and used
of or containing or derived from minerals

sentences.english: She’s her mother in miniature.
sentences.chinese: 她是她母亲的缩影。

sentences.english: a miniature railway
sentences.chinese: 微型铁路

detailed_translations.english: exactly like something or someone but much smaller
much smaller than normal

sentences.english: Every effort is being made to minimize civilian casualties.
sentences.chinese: 正在尽最大努力减少平民伤亡。

sentences.english: The rail company is bringing in more trains in an effort to minimize disruption to travellers.
sentences.chinese: 铁路公司正投入更多的列车来减少旅客的不便。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce something that is difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant to the smallest possible amount or degree

sentences.english: This will take a minimum of one hour.
sentences.chinese: 这最少要用一个小时。

sentences.english: The minimum number of students we need to run the course is fifteen.
sentences.chinese: 我们开这门课程最少要有15个学生。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest amount of something or number of things that is possible or necessary
the minimum number, degree, or amount of something is the smallest or least that is possible, allowed, or needed
a very short skirt

sentences.english: a senior Cabinet minister
sentences.chinese: 资深的内阁部长

sentences.english: He concluded a deal with the Danish minister in Washington.
sentences.chinese: 他在华盛顿与丹麦公使达成了一项协议。

detailed_translations.english: a politician who is in charge of a government depart-ment, in Britain and some other countries

name: minor
trans: a.较小的，较少的，较次要的；少数的

sentences.english: We have made some minor changes to the program.
sentences.chinese: 我们对那个程序做了一些小改动。

sentences.english: a relatively minor error
sentences.chinese: 相对较小的错误

sentences.english: a minor road
sentences.chinese: 小路

sentences.english: They played only a minor role in local government.
sentences.chinese: 他们在当地政府里只是扮演次要角色。

detailed_translations.english: small and not very important or serious, especially when compared with other things

sentences.english: It takes me ten minutes to walk to work.
sentences.chinese: 我步行上班要用十分钟。

sentences.english: The train arrived at four minutes past eight.
sentences.chinese: 火车于八点零四分到达。

sentences.english: He returned a few minutes later.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟后他回来了。

sentences.english: I’ll meet you at the car in five minutes.
sentences.chinese: 五分钟后我在车那儿和你见面。

sentences.english: Sam thought for a minute, then smiled at his brother.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆想了一下，然后冲着他的兄弟笑了。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 minutes in one hour

name: miracle
trans: n.奇迹，令人惊奇的人（或事）

sentences.english: It’s a miracle you weren’t killed!
sentences.chinese: 你没有死真是奇迹！

sentences.english: By some miracle, we managed to catch the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们奇迹般地赶上了飞机。

sentences.english: the economic miracle of the 1950s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪50年代的经济奇迹

sentences.english: She’s our miracle baby.
sentences.chinese: 她是我们的奇迹宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: something very lucky or very good that happens which you did not expect to happen or did not think was possible

sentences.english: He spends hours in front of the mirror !
sentences.chinese: 他老是照镜子！

sentences.english: When I looked in the mirror I couldn’t believe it. I looked fantastic!
sentences.chinese: 我看着镜子简直不敢相信，我看上去棒极了！

sentences.english: Henry’s sad smile mirrored that of his son.
sentences.chinese: 亨利脸上那苦涩的笑容跟他儿子一模一样。

sentences.english: The economic recovery in Britain was mirrored in the US.
sentences.chinese: 美国出现了和英国相似的经济复苏。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of special glass that you can look at and see yourself in
if one thing mirrors another, it is very similar to it and may seem to copy or represent it

name: misconception
trans: n.误解，错误想法；错误印象

sentences.english: It is a misconception that Peggy was fabulously wealthy.
sentences.chinese: 说佩吉以前极其富有，这是一个错误的看法。

detailed_translations.english: an idea which is wrong or untrue, but which people believe because they do not understand the subject properly

sentences.english: I’ve been so miserable since Pat left me.
sentences.chinese: 自从帕特离我而去后，我十分痛苦。

sentences.english: I spent the weekend feeling miserable .
sentences.chinese: 我那个周末心情很糟糕。

sentences.english: Jan looks really miserable .
sentences.chinese: 简看上去很痛苦。

sentences.english: Why do you make yourself miserable by taking on too much work?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么揽这么多活儿，把自己弄得很辛苦呢？

detailed_translations.english: extremely unhappy, for example because you feel lonely, cold, or badly treated

name: misguide
trans: vt.给予错误的消息或指导；使误入歧途

sentences.english: In addition, they will also misguide the innocent, which becomes a vicious circle.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他们将误导那些思想单纯的人，这将导致一个恶心循环。

sentences.english: The other type of behavior is non-deceptive information misguide or incompleteness of information, namely, significant omission of information disclosure.
sentences.chinese: 另一种行为是非欺骗性的误导或者信息不充分, 即信息披露的重大遗露.

sentences.english: One sort of behavior is incomplete or distorted information disclosure mentioned by Williamson, especially purposeful misguide, distortion, concealment and confusion, etc.
sentences.chinese: 第一种行为是威廉森提出的不完全或者扭曲的信息披露, 特别是故意误导, 扭曲和隐藏相关信息以及制造疑惑等等.

detailed_translations.english: to guide or direct wrongly or badly

sentences.english: Don’t be misled by appearances, he’s a good worker.
sentences.chinese: 不要被表象迷惑，他工作干得挺不错的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone believe something that is not true by giving them information that is false or not complete

name: misleading
trans: a.引入歧途的；使人误解的

sentences.english: The article was misleading, and the newspaper has apologized.
sentences.chinese: 那篇文章具有误导性，那家报纸已致歉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人误解的， 导致错误结论的； 引入歧途的； 欺骗的； 迷惑人的
detailed_translations.english: likely to make someone believe something that is not true

sentences.english: I’d like to make an appointment with Miss Taylor.
sentences.chinese: 我想约一下泰勒小姐。

detailed_translations.english: used in front of the family name of a woman who is not married to address her politely, to write to her, or to talk about her

sentences.english: It was nice talking to you, Miss Ellis.
sentences.chinese: 很高兴与你交谈，埃利斯小姐。

detailed_translations.chinese: 女士，小姐，年轻未婚女子
detailed_translations.english: You use Miss in front of the name of a girl or unmarried woman when you are speaking to her or referring to her

sentences.english: We found the missing piece of the jigsaw under the chair.
sentences.chinese: 我们在椅子下面找到了那块丢失的拼图。

sentences.english: The keys have been missing for ages.
sentences.chinese: 钥匙早已丢失了。

detailed_translations.english: something that is missing is not in its usual place, so that you cannot find it

sentences.english: The most common mistake is to plant them too deep.
sentences.chinese: 最常见的错误就是把它们种得太深了。

sentences.english: She mistook my meaning entirely.
sentences.chinese: 她完全误解了我的意思。

detailed_translations.english: something that has been done in the wrong way, or an opinion or statement that is incorrect
to understand something wrongly

sentences.english: Rachel, you must have misunderstood her! Ellie would never say something like that.
sentences.chinese: 雷切尔，你一定是误会她了！埃莉绝不会说那样的话。

sentences.english: Don’t misunderstand me. She’s a very nice person when you get to know her.
sentences.chinese: 不要误解我的意思。你了解她后就会知道她是个很好的人。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to understand someone or something correctly

sentences.english: Even harmless drugs can be misused.
sentences.chinese: 即使是无毒副作用的药物也有使用不当的时候。

sentences.english: The term ‘schizophrenia’ is often misused.
sentences.chinese: “精神分裂症”这个术语经常被误用。

sentences.english: There is concern that the judges might misuse their power.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心裁判员可能会滥用权力。

detailed_translations.english: to use something for the wrong purpose, or in the wrong way, often with harmful results
the use of something in the wrong way or for the wrong purpose

sentences.english: Oil and water don’t mix.
sentences.chinese: 油和水不相融。

detailed_translations.english: if you mix two or more substances or if they mix, they combine to become a single substance, and they cannot be easily separated

sentences.english: The town is a mixture of the old and the new.
sentences.chinese: 这个小城新旧结合。

detailed_translations.english: a combination of two or more different things, feelings, or types of people

sentences.english: Opposition MPs mocked the government’s decision.
sentences.chinese: 反对党议员讥笑政府的这一决策。

sentences.english: ‘Running away?’ he mocked.
sentences.chinese: “想逃跑？”他取笑道。

sentences.english: It’s easy for you to mock, but we put a lot of work into this play.
sentences.chinese: 你讲风凉话是很轻松，但我们这出戏可是费了很大力气的。

detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone or something and try to make them look stupid by saying unkind things about them or by copying them

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿制的， 假装的；模拟的， 演习的
detailed_translations.english: not real, but intended to be very similar to a real situation, substance etc
school examinations taken as practice before official examinations

sentences.english: a working model (= one with parts which move ) of a steam engine
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽机车的活动模型

sentences.english: a top fashion model
sentences.chinese: 顶级时装模特

detailed_translations.english: a small copy of a building, vehicle, machine etc, especially one that can be put together from separate parts

name: moderate
trans: a.中等的，适度的；温和的，有节制的

sentences.english: Even moderate amounts of alcohol can be dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 喝酒即使不多也会有危险。

sentences.english: a moderate degree of success
sentences.chinese: 一定程度上的成功

sentences.english: a student of moderate ability
sentences.chinese: 能力一般的学生

sentences.english: Moderate exercise, such as walking, is recommended.
sentences.chinese: 建议适度锻炼，比如散步。

sentences.english: Bake the pie for 30 minutes in a moderate oven.
sentences.chinese: 馅饼用中火烘烤30分钟。

sentences.english: moderate to strong winds
sentences.chinese: 中到大风

detailed_translations.english: not very large or very small, very hot or very cold, very fast or very slow etc
someone whose opinions or beliefs, especially about politics, are not extreme and are considered reasonable by most people
to make something less extreme or violent, or to become less extreme or violent

sentences.english: Some people think drinking in moderation can prevent heart disease.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为适量饮酒可以预防心脏病。

detailed_translations.chinese: 温和， 中庸； 适度， 合理

sentences.english: Such companies must change if they are to compete in the modern world .
sentences.chinese: 此类公司如果想在现代社会中与别人竞争，就必须有所改变。

sentences.english: They are the youngest children in modern times to face murder charges.
sentences.chinese: 他们是近代面临谋杀指控儿童中年龄最小的。

sentences.english: Smaller families are a feature of modern society .
sentences.chinese: 家庭规模变小是现代社会的一个特征。

sentences.english: Computers are an essential part of modern life .
sentences.chinese: 电脑是现代生活必不可少的组成部分。

sentences.english: a book about modern history
sentences.chinese: 一本关于现代史的书

sentences.english: The original supermarkets were small by modern standards.
sentences.chinese: 最初的超级市场按现代的标准来看是很小的。

detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time or most recent time

name: modest
trans: a.谦虚的，谦恭的；适中的，不过分的

sentences.english: You’re too modest! You’ve been a huge help to us.
sentences.chinese: 你太谦虚了！你帮了我们大忙呢。

sentences.english: a modest increase in costs
sentences.chinese: 成本的小幅上涨

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦虚的；不太大的；不很贵的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is modest does not want to talk about their abilities or achievements

sentences.english: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
sentences.chinese: 这些反馈意见将用于修改明年的课程。

sentences.english: The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
sentences.chinese: 这些法规只能由特别委员会来修改。

detailed_translations.english: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

sentences.english: Because of its flexibility, we can mold software into any form to do almost anything.
sentences.chinese: 由于灵活性，我们可以将软件塑造成任何形式从而处理几乎所有的问题。

sentences.english: The women of a nation mold its morals, its religion, and its politics by the lives they live.
sentences.chinese: 一个国家的妇女通过她们的生活方式塑造了这个国家的道德、宗教和政治。

sentences.english: molten iron
sentences.chinese: 熔铁

detailed_translations.english: molten metal or rock has been made into a liquid by being heated to a very high temperature

sentences.english: It was one of the most exciting moments in his life.
sentences.chinese: 这是他一生中最激动人心的时刻之一。

sentences.english: She may be in trouble at this very moment and trying to call you.
sentences.chinese: 此时此刻她可能遇到了麻烦，正想方设法给你打电话。

sentences.english: I remember the moment when I first saw him after the operation.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得手术后第一次见到他的那一刻。

sentences.english: Quinn always seems to be in the right place at the crucial moment.
sentences.chinese: 奎因似乎总能在关键时刻把握时机。

sentences.english: I just this moment (= only a very short time ago ) arrived and already Dan wants to know when I’m leaving.
sentences.chinese: 我才刚到，丹就想知道我什么时候走。

sentences.english: At this moment in time it would be inappropriate to comment on the situation.
sentences.chinese: 这个时候恐怕不宜对局势作出评论。

sentences.english: It was quiet for a moment, then Rae spoke.
sentences.chinese: 沉寂了片刻，然后雷开始说话了。

detailed_translations.english: a particular point in time

sentences.english: The president announced Monday that he would cancel the debt.
sentences.chinese: 总统周一宣布他会取消这笔债务。

detailed_translations.english: the day between Sunday and Tuesday

sentences.english: a heart monitor
sentences.chinese: 心脏监测仪

detailed_translations.chinese: 班长；监视器，检测器；显示器
detailed_translations.english: a television or part of a computer with a screen, on which you can see pictures or information
to carefully watch and check a situation in order to see how it changes over a period of time

sentences.english: ...saffron-robed Buddhist monks.
sentences.chinese: …身穿黄袍的和尚们。

detailed_translations.english: a member of an all-male religious group that lives apart from other people in a  monastery

sentences.english: The monkey is beating up and down.
sentences.chinese: 那只猴子到处乱窜。

sentences.english: The monkey engulfed the food whole.
sentences.chinese: 这只猴子囫囵吞下食物。

sentences.english: The monkey had deflowered an entire section of the garden.
sentences.chinese: 这只猴子把花园中一整块地方的花都糟蹋了。

detailed_translations.english: a small brown animal with a long tail, which uses its hands to climb trees and lives in hot countries

sentences.english: The company has monopolized the soft drinks market.
sentences.chinese: 该公司垄断了软饮料市场。

sentences.english: He monopolized the conversation all evening.
sentences.chinese: 整个晚上都是他一个人在说话。

detailed_translations.chinese: 垄断；独占；拥有…的专卖权
detailed_translations.english: to have complete control over something so that other people cannot share it or take part in it

sentences.english: In the past central government had a monopoly on television broadcasting.
sentences.chinese: 过去，中央政府对电视节目播放实行垄断。

sentences.english: A good education should not be the monopoly of the rich.
sentences.chinese: 良好的教育不应该成为富人的专利。

detailed_translations.english: the complete control of trade in particular goods or the supply of a particular service; a type of goods or a service that is controlled in this way

sentences.english: I hope I’ll have finished the work by the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我这个月底能完成工作。

sentences.english: She earns about £350 a month (= each month ).
sentences.chinese: 她每月约挣350英镑。

sentences.english: We update the schedule at least once a month.
sentences.chinese: 我们至少每月更新一次日程表。

detailed_translations.english: one of the 12 named periods of time that a year is divided into

sentences.english: You’re in a good mood this morning!
sentences.chinese: 你今天早晨心情不错啊！

sentences.english: the general mood of depression in the office
sentences.chinese: 办公室里普遍的沮丧情绪

detailed_translations.english: the way you feel at a particular time

sentences.english: They walked along the road in the moonlight.
sentences.chinese: 他们在月光下沿路散步。

detailed_translations.english: the light of the moon
to have a second job in addition to your main job, especially without the knowledge of the government tax department

sentences.english: It is easy to have an opinion on a moral issue like the death penalty for murder.
sentences.chinese: 对于判谋杀犯死刑这种涉及伦理道德的问题，有个观点并非难事。

sentences.english: If we accept that certain babies should be allowed to die, we place doctors in a moral dilemma .
sentences.chinese: 如果我们同意应该允许某些婴儿死去，那就是让医生在道德上处于两难境地了。

sentences.english: Man is gifted with a moral sense by which he distinguishes good from evil.
sentences.chinese: 人类天生有道德意识，能区分善与恶。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the principles of what is right and wrong behaviour, and with the difference between good and evil

detailed_translations.chinese: 品行， 道德规范； 寓意
detailed_translations.english: principles or standards of good behaviour, especially in matters of sex

sentences.english: The rent is reasonable and, moreover, the location is perfect.
sentences.chinese: 租金合理，而且位置也非常好。

sentences.english: The source of the information is irrelevant. Moreover, the information need not be confidential.
sentences.chinese: 信息来源无关紧要，而且也不一定必须是机密的。

detailed_translations.english: in addition – used to introduce information that adds to or supports what has previously been said

sentences.english: I hated those cold winter mornings.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌冬天里寒冷的早晨。

sentences.english: I’m not feeling very well this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上我觉得不大舒服。

sentences.english: He stayed in bed late on Sunday morning.
sentences.chinese: 星期日早上他睡到很晚。

sentences.english: She took the early morning train.
sentences.chinese: 她搭乘了一大早的火车。

detailed_translations.english: the early part of the day, from when the sun rises until 12 o’clock in the middle of the day

sentences.english: His mother and father are both doctors.
sentences.chinese: 他的父母都是医生。

sentences.english: the relationship between mother and child
sentences.chinese: 母亲和孩子之间的关系

sentences.english: Goodnight, Mother.
sentences.chinese: 晚安，妈妈。

sentences.english: Mother said they’d met at university.
sentences.chinese: 母亲说他们是在大学里认识的。

sentences.english: If food is scarce, the mother will feed the smaller, weaker chicks.
sentences.chinese: 如果食物稀少，母禽就喂较小、较弱的幼禽。

detailed_translations.english: a female parent of a child or animal

sentences.english: She motioned for the locked front doors to be opened.
sentences.chinese: 她打手势示意把锁着的前门打开。

sentences.english: He stood aside and motioned Don to the door.
sentences.chinese: 他站在一边，示意唐到门口。

detailed_translations.english: If you motion to someone, you move your hand or head as a way of telling them to do something or telling them where to go

detailed_translations.chinese: 运动；手势，眼色，动作；提议
detailed_translations.english: the process of moving or the way that someone or something moves

sentences.english: Graham remained motionless.
sentences.chinese: 格雷厄姆一动不动。

detailed_translations.english: not moving at all

sentences.english: A good teacher has to be able to motivate her students.
sentences.chinese: 好教师必须能够激发学生的积极性。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to achieve something and make them willing to work hard in order to do this

sentences.english: What do you suppose the killer’s motive was?
sentences.chinese: 你认为凶手的动机是什么？

sentences.english: The violence was clearly prompted by political motives.
sentences.chinese: 这次暴力事件显然是由政治动机引发的。

sentences.english: It’s not the kind of thing he’d do unless he had an ulterior motive (= a reason he kept hidden ) .
sentences.chinese: 他不会做这种事的，除非他另有隐情。

detailed_translations.english: the reason that makes someone do something, especially when this reason is kept hidden
the motive power or force for a machine, vehicle etc makes it move

sentences.english: an electric motor
sentences.chinese: 电动马达

sentences.english: That’s a nice motor you’ve got, Dave.
sentences.chinese: 你这车不错啊，戴夫。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a machine that makes it work or move, by changing power, especially electrical power, into movement

sentences.english: the highest mountain in Austria
sentences.chinese: 奥地利最高的山

sentences.english: the Rocky Mountains
sentences.chinese: 落基山脉

sentences.english: a steep mountain road
sentences.chinese: 陡峭的山路

sentences.english: magnificent mountain ranges
sentences.chinese: 雄伟的山脉

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山峰

sentences.english: a mountain rescue team
sentences.chinese: 山地营救队

sentences.english: She was the first British woman to climb the mountain .
sentences.chinese: 她是攀登这座山峰的第一位英国女子。

detailed_translations.english: a very high hill

name: Moussorgsky
trans: 穆索尔斯基（俄国作曲家）

sentences.english: He lifted his glass to his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 他把玻璃杯举到嘴边。

sentences.english: Liam was fast asleep with his mouth wide open.
sentences.chinese: 利亚姆大张着嘴，睡得很熟。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your face which you put food into, or which you use for speaking

sentences.english: Please keep the doors closed while the train is moving.
sentences.chinese: 火车行驶时请保持车门关闭。

sentences.english: ‘Come on,’ Sue said. No one moved.
sentences.chinese: “来吧。”休说。但没有人动。

sentences.english: Could you move your car, please? It’s blocking the road.
sentences.chinese: 你能把车挪一下吗？挡着路了。

sentences.english: Becca moved down the steps and into the yard.
sentences.chinese: 贝卡走下台阶，来到院子里。

sentences.english: The bar was so crowded you could hardly move .
sentences.chinese: 酒吧很挤，人都难以挪动。

sentences.english: His speech moved the audience to tears.
sentences.chinese: 他的演讲让听众感动得落泪。

sentences.english: He made no move to come any nearer.
sentences.chinese: 他没有再靠近。

detailed_translations.english: to change from one place or position to another, or to make something do this
when someone moves for a short time in a particular direction

sentences.english: It was like one of those old John Wayne movies.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影有点像约翰•韦恩演的一部老片子。

sentences.english: We took the kids to the movies.
sentences.chinese: 我们带孩子们去看电影。

detailed_translations.english: a film made to be shown at the cinema or on television

name: moving
trans: a.活动的，移动的；动人的，令人感动的

sentences.english: Attending the memorial service was a moving experience .
sentences.chinese: 参加这次追悼仪式是一次十分感人的经历。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel strong emotions, especially sadness or sympathy

name: mph
trans: （=mile per hour）每小时英里数，英里

sentences.english: ...Mr. Grant.
sentences.chinese: …格兰特先生。

sentences.english: ...Mr. Bob Price.
sentences.chinese: …鲍勃·普赖斯先生。

detailed_translations.english: Mr. is used before a man's name when you are speaking or referring to him

sentences.english: It is said that Mrs White rules her husband strictly.
sentences.chinese: 据说怀特夫人对她的丈夫管得很严。

sentences.english: Mr Brown and Mrs Smith have been carrying on for some months now.
sentences.chinese: 布朗先生和史密斯太太发生暧昧关系已经好几个月了。

sentences.english: He hitched his chair to me and told the secrets about Mrs Johnson.
sentences.chinese: 他把椅子向我身边挪了挪，然后把约翰逊夫人的秘密告诉了我。

sentences.english: The day ended much as it began.
sentences.chinese: 这一天结束时还像开始时一样。

sentences.english: I don’t have much money with me.
sentences.chinese: 我身上没带很多钱。

detailed_translations.english: by a great amount
a large amount of something

sentences.english: They daubed mud all over themselves.
sentences.chinese: 他们用泥涂满全身。

sentences.english: I dirty my trousers when I step on the mud.
sentences.chinese: 我一脚擩在烂泥里， 把裤子弄脏了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 泥；诽谤的话；无价值的东西
detailed_translations.english: wet earth that has become soft and sticky

sentences.english: ...the case of an insurance company using multimedia to improve customer service in its branches.
sentences.chinese: …一家保险公司利用多媒体技术改善其分支机构的客户服务的实例。

detailed_translations.english: You use multimedia to refer to computer programs and products which involve sound, pictures, and film, as well as text
involving computers and computer programs that use a mixture of sound, pictures, video, and writing to give information

sentences.english: Baxter was rushed to the hospital with multiple stab wounds.
sentences.chinese: 巴克斯特因多处刺伤被紧急送往医院。

sentences.english: Having multiple partners increases your risk of sexual diseases.
sentences.chinese: 性伴侣多会增加得性病的风险。

sentences.english: His new album includes multiple versions of the same songs.
sentences.chinese: 他的新专辑包括同一些歌曲的多种版本。

detailed_translations.english: many, or involving many things, people, events etc
a number that contains a smaller number an exact number of times

sentences.english: It also explains why we use a specific multiplicity in the correspondence.
sentences.chinese: 它还解释了我们在通讯中使用特定多重性的原因。

sentences.english: Provide a data type for these variables, both with the right type and with the right multiplicity.
sentences.chinese: 为这些变量提供一个数据类型，确保使用正确的类型和正确的多样性。

sentences.english: You can change the multiplicity of the call; for asynchronous calls, this could enable several components to be called in a publish/subscribe manner.
sentences.chinese: 您可以更改调用的多样性；对于异步调用，这样可以以一种发布/订阅方式调用几个组件。

detailed_translations.english: a large number or great variety of things

sentences.english: the municipal waste dump
sentences.chinese: 城市垃圾场

sentences.english: municipal elections
sentences.chinese: 市级选举

detailed_translations.english: relating to or belonging to the government of a town or city

sentences.english: On the night the murder was committed , he was out of the country.
sentences.chinese: 凶案发生当晚他不在国内。

sentences.english: The man accused of her murder will appear in court today.
sentences.chinese: 被指控谋杀她的那名男子将于今天出庭。

sentences.english: He was found guilty of attempted murder.
sentences.chinese: 他被判谋杀未遂。

sentences.english: She was charged with two counts of first degree murder.
sentences.chinese: 她被控犯有两项一级谋杀罪。

sentences.english: The mother of the murder victim wept in court.
sentences.chinese: 凶案死者的母亲在法庭上痛哭。

sentences.english: Police are searching for the murder weapon.
sentences.chinese: 警方在寻找杀人凶器。

sentences.english: He was convicted of murdering a policeman.
sentences.chinese: 他被判谋杀一名警察的罪名成立。

detailed_translations.english: the crime of deliberately killing someone
to kill someone deliberately and illegally

sentences.english: Relax your stomach muscles , then stretch again.
sentences.chinese: 放松腹部肌肉，然后再绷紧。

sentences.english: Regular exercise will help to strengthen your muscles .
sentences.chinese: 经常锻炼有助于强健肌肉。

sentences.english: It took muscle to work in an old-fashioned kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 在老式厨房里干活很费力。

detailed_translations.english: one of the pieces of flesh inside your body that you use in order to move, and that connect your bones together

sentences.english: She was fast and strong, with a slender, muscular body.
sentences.chinese: 她动作敏捷，身体强壮，身材苗条，肌肉结实。

sentences.english: He’s very muscular.
sentences.chinese: 他很强壮。

detailed_translations.english: having large strong muscles

sentences.english: The sloth-like times come when we lose touch with our inner muse.
sentences.chinese: 当我们与内心沉思失去联系的时候，懒惰就会出现。

sentences.english: I want to be a better writer and maybe my muse will provide the motivation.
sentences.chinese: 我希望成为一名更好的作者，也许我的沉思将为我提供动力。

sentences.english: Initially it will be really hard to ignore the mind that wants to plan for the future and muse about the past, but with time you will see through its insanity.
sentences.chinese: 开始时，忽视想要计划将来沉思过去的思想是很困难的，但是随着时间的推移，你将看穿它的荒谬。

detailed_translations.english: to say something in a way that shows you are thinking about it carefully

sentences.english: the Museum of Modern Art
sentences.chinese: 现代艺术博物馆

sentences.english: The museum has an extensive collection of early photographs.
sentences.chinese: 这座博物馆藏有大量早期的照片。

detailed_translations.english: a building where important  cultural, historical, or scientific objects are kept and shown to the public

sentences.english: I often listen to classic music when I’m in the car.
sentences.chinese: 我在车上经常听古典音乐。

sentences.english: A new piece of music was specially written for the occasion.
sentences.chinese: 为了这个活动专门写了一首新曲子。

sentences.english: I left my music at home.
sentences.chinese: 我把乐谱落在家里了。

detailed_translations.english: a series of sounds made by instruments or voices in a way that is pleasant or exciting

name: musically
trans: ad.在音乐方面；好听地；悦耳地

sentences.english: a talented young musician
sentences.chinese: 有天赋的年轻音乐家

detailed_translations.english: a person who plays a musical instrument or writes music, especially as a job

sentences.english: All passengers must wear seat belts.
sentences.chinese: 所有乘客都必须系安全带。

sentences.english: It’s getting late. I really must go.
sentences.chinese: 天晚了，我真的必须走了。

sentences.english: You must work hard.
sentences.chinese: 你必须努力工作。

sentences.english: We must all be patient.
sentences.chinese: 我们都必须耐心。

sentences.english: Must I pay now?
sentences.chinese: 我必须现在付款吗？

sentences.english: For the engine to work, the green lever must be in the ‘up’ position.
sentences.chinese: 要启动引擎，绿色操纵杆必须在“上”这一挡。

sentences.english: Accidents must be reported to the safety officer.
sentences.chinese: 出了事故必须向安全员报告。

detailed_translations.english: to have to do something because it is necessary or important, or because of a law or order

sentences.english: All my friends do not smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友并不全都吸烟。

sentences.english: Then you must be my cousin.
sentences.chinese: 那么你一定是我的远亲了。

sentences.english: I blame myself for what has happened.
sentences.chinese: 发生这一切都怪我自己。

sentences.english: I can look after myself.
sentences.chinese: 我可以照顾好自己。

sentences.english: I’m making myself a sandwich.
sentences.chinese: 我在给自己做三明治。

detailed_translations.english: used by the person speaking or writing to show that they are affected by their own action

sentences.english: Twenty years after the event, his death remains a mystery .
sentences.chinese: 事情过去二十年了，他的死仍然是个谜。

sentences.english: The way her mind worked was always a mystery to him.
sentences.chinese: 她脑子里在想些什么对他来说始终是个谜。

sentences.english: ‘Why did he do it?’ ‘I don’t know. It’s a complete mystery .’
sentences.chinese: “他为什么这么做？” “我不知道，这完全是个谜。”

sentences.english: The police never solved the mystery of Gray’s disappearance.
sentences.chinese: 警察一直没有侦破格雷失踪的谜案。

sentences.english: But why would anyone want to kill Jack? The mystery deepened .
sentences.chinese: 但为什么会有人想杀死杰克呢？疑团越来越深了。

sentences.english: What happened to the paintings after that is an unsolved mystery .
sentences.chinese: 后来那些画的命运如何是个不解之谜。

sentences.english: I don’t know how he got the job – it’s one of life’s little mysteries .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他是怎么得到那份工作的——那永远是个小小的谜。

sentences.english: How life began on Earth is one of the great mysteries of science.
sentences.chinese: 地球生命的起源是一大科学谜团。

detailed_translations.english: an event, situation etc that people do not understand or cannot explain because they do not know enough about it

sentences.english: The key was hanging on a nail by the door.
sentences.chinese: 钥匙挂在门边的一颗钉子上。

sentences.english: Stop biting your nails!
sentences.chinese: 别咬指甲！

sentences.english: A sign saying ‘No Fishing’ had been nailed to the tree.
sentences.chinese: 树上钉着一块写有“禁止钓鱼”的牌子。

detailed_translations.english: a thin pointed piece of metal with a flat top, which you hit into a surface with a hammer, for example to join things together or to hang something on
to fasten something to something else with nails

sentences.english: Her name is Mandy Wilson.
sentences.chinese: 她的名字是曼迪•威尔逊。

sentences.english: What’s your name?
sentences.chinese: 你叫什么名字？

sentences.english: He didn’t want to do anything to damage the good name of the company.
sentences.chinese: 他不想做任何有损公司良好声誉的事。

sentences.english: They’re a lot better than some airlines I could name.
sentences.chinese: 他们比我叫得上名字的一些航空公司要好得多。

detailed_translations.english: what someone is called
to say what the name of someone or something is, especially officially

sentences.english: Three students were mentioned, namely John, Sarah and Sylvia.
sentences.chinese: 有三名学生被提到，即约翰、萨拉和西尔维娅。

detailed_translations.english: used when saying the names of the people or things you are referring to

sentences.english: The stairs were very narrow.
sentences.chinese: 楼梯非常狭窄。

sentences.english: a long, narrow band of cloud
sentences.chinese: 窄长的云带

detailed_translations.english: measuring only a small distance from one side to the other, especially in relation to the length

sentences.english: the President’s radio broadcast to the nation
sentences.chinese: 总统对全国的广播讲话

sentences.english: an independent nation
sentences.chinese: 独立的国家

sentences.english: the world’s leading industrial nations
sentences.chinese: 世界上的主要工业国

sentences.english: the Cherokee nation
sentences.chinese: 切罗基族

detailed_translations.english: a country, considered especially in relation to its people and its social or economic structure

sentences.english: Religion matters very much at a national level.
sentences.chinese: 宗教事务在全国都非常重要。

sentences.english: Between 1929 and 1933 America’s national income fell by more than half.
sentences.chinese: 1929至1933年间，美国的国民收入下降过半。

sentences.english: There are strong indications that the Prime Minister will call national elections in May.
sentences.chinese: 有明显迹象预示首相将于5月召集全国大选。

detailed_translations.english: related to a whole nation as opposed to any of its parts

sentences.english: a nationwide search for a missing British tourist
sentences.chinese: 在全国范围内对一名失踪英国游客的搜寻

sentences.english: nationwide television
sentences.chinese: 全国性的电视节目

sentences.english: The figures show unemployment falling nationwide last month.
sentences.chinese: 数字显示，上个月失业数字正全国性地下降。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing in every part of the country
Nationwide is also an adverb

sentences.english: Singapore has many native species of palm.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡有很多土生的棕榈树种。

sentences.english: You can always tell the difference between the tourists and the natives.
sentences.chinese: 游客与当地人之间的区别一望即知。

detailed_translations.english: growing, living, produced etc in one particular place
someone who lives in a place all the time or has lived there a long time

name: native-speaking
trans: a.说本族语的，讲本国话的

sentences.english: The crash was a direct result of inadequate navigational aids.
sentences.chinese: 坠机是导航不力的直接后果。

detailed_translations.english: Navigational means relating to the act of navigating a ship or an aircraft

sentences.english: the British Navy
sentences.chinese: 英国海军

sentences.english: He joined the navy during the war.
sentences.chinese: 他在战争期间参加了海军。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a country’s military forces that fights at sea

sentences.english: They live near London.
sentences.chinese: 他们住在伦敦附近。

sentences.english: I’m sure they live somewhere near here.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定他们就住在这附近。

sentences.english: They moved house to be nearer the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们把家搬到离学校近一些。

sentences.english: She told the children not to go near the canal.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉孩子们不要走近运河。

sentences.english: I’m warning you - don’t come any nearer!
sentences.chinese: 我警告你别再靠近！

sentences.english: We heard voices as we drew near the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们走近村子时听见了说话声。

detailed_translations.english: only a short distance from a person or thing
only a short distance away from someone or something

sentences.english: Lucy was staying in the nearby town of Hamilton.
sentences.chinese: 露西当时住在附近的汉密尔顿镇。

sentences.english: He might easily have been seen by someone who lived nearby.
sentences.chinese: 他可能很容易被住在附近的人看到。

sentences.english: The helicopter crashed to earth nearby.
sentences.chinese: 直升机坠毁在附近的地面上。

detailed_translations.english: not far away
a short distance from sb/sth; not far away

sentences.english: It took nearly two hours to get here.
sentences.chinese: 到这里花了将近两小时。

sentences.english: Michelle’s nearly twenty.
sentences.chinese: 米歇尔年近二十。

sentences.english: Is the job nearly finished?
sentences.chinese: 这工作快干完了吗？

sentences.english: Louise is nearly as tall as her mother.
sentences.chinese: 路易丝差不多和她母亲一样高。

sentences.english: I nearly always go home for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 我几乎总是回家吃午饭。

sentences.english: He very nearly died.
sentences.chinese: 他差点送命。

detailed_translations.english: almost, but not quite or not completely

sentences.english: neat handwriting
sentences.chinese: 工整的笔迹

sentences.english: His clothes were always neat and clean.
sentences.chinese: 他的衣服总是很整洁。

sentences.english: Everything in the house was neat and tidy.
sentences.chinese: 房子里的每样物品都干净整齐。

sentences.english: She arranged the books in a nice neat pile.
sentences.chinese: 她把书摞成整齐的一堆。

detailed_translations.english: tidy and carefully arranged

sentences.english: The care of old people necessarily involves quite a lot of heavy lifting.
sentences.chinese: 照顾老年人必定要干很多搬重物的活儿。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that cannot be different or be avoided

sentences.english: The booklet provides all the necessary information about the college.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子提供了关于那所学院的所有必需信息。

sentences.english: No further changes were considered necessary.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要作出进一步改变。

sentences.english: The doctor says it may be necessary for me to have an operation.
sentences.chinese: 医生说我可能需要做手术。

sentences.english: The closure of the factory was a necessary consequence of increased competition from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 工厂倒闭是来自国外的竞争加剧的必然结果。

detailed_translations.english: something that is necessary is what you need to have or need to do

sentences.english: I’m afraid it’s become a matter of economic necessity.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕这已成了一个经济需求的问题。

detailed_translations.english: when something is necessary

sentences.english: Mike rubbed the back of his neck.
sentences.chinese: 迈克揉了揉后颈。

sentences.english: You have a lot of tension in your neck muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你的颈部肌肉很紧张。

sentences.english: He patted his horse’s neck.
sentences.chinese: 他拍了拍马脖子。

sentences.english: She had a mass of golden hair, which she wore in a coil at the nape  of her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她有一头金发，盘在脖子后面。

sentences.english: The dog picked up the puppy and carried it by the scruff of the neck into the house.
sentences.chinese: 那条狗叼住小狗的后颈，把它叼进了屋子。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body that joins your head to your shoulders, or the same part of an animal or bird

sentences.english: You don’t really need a car.
sentences.chinese: 你其实并不需要一辆车。

sentences.english: Plants need light in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 植物需要光才能存活。

sentences.english: The camcorder needs a new battery.
sentences.chinese: 这台摄像机需要一块新电池。

sentences.english: Are you sure that you have everything you need?
sentences.chinese: 你确定需要的都有了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to have to have something or someone, because you cannot do something without them, or because you cannot continue or cannot exist without them
to have to have something or someone, because you cannot do something without them, or because you cannot continue or cannot exist without them

sentences.english: The report caused needless anxiety to women who have attended the clinic.
sentences.chinese: 那份报告让去那家诊所就诊过的妇女产生了不必要的忧虑。

sentences.english: We need to bring to an end these needless deaths.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须终止这些无谓的死亡。

sentences.english: Charles hates needless waste.
sentences.chinese: 查尔斯痛恨不必要的浪费。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不需要的, 不必要的
detailed_translations.english: needless troubles, suffering, loss etc are unnecessary because they could easily have been avoided

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

sentences.english: The trader was obstinate in the negotiation.
sentences.chinese: 这个商人在谈判中拗强固执。

detailed_translations.english: official discussions between the repre­sentatives of opposing groups who are trying to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

sentences.english: "I do not accept the Negro as my equal, " Douglas said. "And I deny that he is my brother.
sentences.chinese: “我不会接受黑人与我平等的思想，”道格拉斯说，“而且我拒绝把黑人当成我的兄弟。

sentences.english: It meant that I, a humble Negro girl, had just as much chance as anybody in the sight and love of God.
sentences.chinese: 这就意味着，我这样一个卑微的黑人女孩，也可以像其他人一样有很多机会受到上帝的关注和爱。

detailed_translations.english: a word for a black person, usually considered offensive
relating to or characteristic of Negroes

sentences.english: Iterates may be categorized into stable and unstable sets depending on whether a neighborhood under iteration converges or diverges. Some move toward stability, others away.
sentences.chinese: 根据一个受迭代影响的社区是聚合还是发散，迭代可以被归类到稳定和不稳定集。有些转向稳定，有些转离。

sentences.english: One of the neighbors complained about the noise from the party.
sentences.chinese: 有位邻居抱怨聚会太吵。

sentences.english: FBI agents were interviewing all their friends and neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 联邦调查局人员正在向他们所有的朋友和邻居问话。

sentences.english: Our next-door neighbours (= the people who live in the house next to us ) say they’ll look after our cat for us while we’re away.
sentences.chinese: 我们隔壁的邻居说，我们不在时他们会照顾我们的猫。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives next to you or near you

sentences.english: Neither Oleg’s mother nor his father spoke English.
sentences.chinese: 奥列格的父母都不会说英语。

sentences.english: The equipment is neither accurate nor safe.
sentences.chinese: 这台设备既不精确，也不安全。

detailed_translations.english: used when mentioning two things that are not true or possible
used to show that a negative statement is also true about another person or thing

sentences.english: a condition which affects the nerves in the back
sentences.chinese: 影响背部神经的疾病

sentences.english: She finally found the nerve to tell him she wanted a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 她终于鼓起勇气告诉他自己想离婚。

detailed_translations.english: nerves are parts inside your body which look like threads and carry messages between the brain and other parts of the body

name: nervous
trans: a.神经系统的；神经紧张的

sentences.english: I wish you’d stop looking at me like that. You’re making me nervous.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你不要再那样看着我了，你让我紧张。

sentences.english: By the time I got into the interview I was a nervous wreck (= was extremely nervous ).
sentences.chinese: 到了面试的时候，我紧张得要命。

detailed_translations.english: worried or frightened about something, and unable to relax

sentences.english: a bird’s nest
sentences.chinese: 鸟窝

sentences.english: In May the females build a nest and lay their eggs.
sentences.chinese: 雌鸟在5月份筑巢产蛋。

sentences.english: Young eagles leave the nest after only two months.
sentences.chinese: 雏鹰仅仅两个月以后就会飞离鸟巢。

detailed_translations.english: a place made or chosen by a bird to lay its eggs in and to live in
to build or use a nest

name: network
trans: n.[纺]网眼织物；网状物，网络

sentences.english: Hungary’s telephone network
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利的电话网

sentences.english: a high-speed European rail network
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的高速铁路网

sentences.english: the network of blood vessels in the body
sentences.chinese: 人体内的血管网

detailed_translations.english: a system of lines, tubes, wires, roads etc that cross each other and are connected to each other

sentences.english: He seemed a neurotic, self-obsessed man.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎是个神经过敏又自恋的人。

sentences.english: These patients are not neurotics.
sentences.chinese: 这些病人不是神经官能症患者。

detailed_translations.english: unreasonably anxious or afraid
