sentences.chinese: 他们坐成一直溜儿。

sentences.english: The road was dead straight (= completely straight ) .
sentences.chinese: 那条路是笔直的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直的；连续的；笔直的；正直的；整齐的；异性恋的
detailed_translations.english: something that is straight does not bend or curve

detailed_translations.chinese: 直接地；不断地；立即；坦率地
detailed_translations.english: in a level or correct position

detailed_translations.chinese: 直；直线；直男，直女，异性恋者
detailed_translations.english: the straight part of a  racetrack

name: strain
trans: n.劳累，极度紧张 vt.绷紧 vi.尽力

sentences.english: I’ve strained a muscle in my leg.
sentences.chinese: 我的腿有一处肌肉拉伤。

sentences.english: You’ll strain your eyes trying to read in this light.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的光线下看书会伤眼睛的。

detailed_translations.english: to injure a muscle or part of your body by using it too much or making it work too hard
to try very hard to do something using all your strength or ability

sentences.english: a strange city
sentences.chinese: 陌生的城市

sentences.english: strange noises
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的噪声

sentences.english: Does Geoff’s behaviour seem strange to you?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得杰夫的行为反常吗？

sentences.english: She felt there was something strange about Dexter’s voice.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得德克斯特的声音有点奇怪。

sentences.english: Isn’t it strange how animals seem to sense danger?
sentences.chinese: 动物似乎能感觉到危险，这不是很奇怪吗？

sentences.english: It’s strange that we’ve never met before.
sentences.chinese: 很奇怪，我们以前居然从来没有碰见过。

sentences.english: For some strange reason, I slept like a baby despite the noise.
sentences.chinese: 很奇怪，不知为什么，尽管很吵闹，但我仍睡得很香。

sentences.english: Strange as it may seem, I actually prefer cold weather.
sentences.chinese: 听上去也许很奇怪，我竟然喜欢冷天。

sentences.english: That’s strange. I was sure Jude was right here a second ago.
sentences.chinese: 真奇怪，我肯定祖德刚刚还在这儿的。

sentences.english: The strange thing is all four victims had red hair.
sentences.chinese: 令人奇怪的是，四名受害者都是红头发的。

detailed_translations.english: not familiar because you have not been there before or met the person before

sentences.english: Children must not talk to strangers.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子千万不要同陌生人说话。

sentences.english: Sorry, I don't know where the bank is. I'm a stranger here myself.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我不知道银行在哪儿。我不是本地人。

detailed_translations.english: someone that you do not know

sentences.english: Military strategists had devised a plan that guaranteed a series of stunning victories.
sentences.chinese: 军事战略家们设计了一个保证了一系列惊人胜利的计划。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is good at planning things, especially military or political actions

sentences.english: the government’s long-term economic strategy
sentences.chinese: 政府的长期经济策略

sentences.english: a company’s business strategy
sentences.chinese: 公司的经营策略

detailed_translations.english: a planned series of actions for achieving something

sentences.english: Tears streamed down their faces.
sentences.chinese: 泪水顺着他们的脸颊流下来。

detailed_translations.english: to flow quickly and in great amounts
a natural flow of water that moves across the land and is narrower than a river

sentences.english: We moved to Center Street when I was young.
sentences.chinese: 在我小时候，我们搬到了中心大街。

sentences.english: She lives just a few streets away.
sentences.chinese: 她的住处就在几条街外。

sentences.english: I walked on further down the street .
sentences.chinese: 我继续沿着马路走。

sentences.english: Someone just moved in across the street .
sentences.chinese: 街对面有人刚刚搬进来。

sentences.english: a car parked on the other side of the street
sentences.chinese: 停在街对面的一辆车

detailed_translations.english: a public road in a city or town that has houses, shops etc on one or both sides

sentences.english: The police force is below strength at the moment (= there are fewer police than there should be ).
sentences.chinese: 目前警力不足。

sentences.english: the strength of a rope
sentences.chinese: 绳子的强度

detailed_translations.english: the number of people in a team, army etc

name: stress
trans: n.压力；应力；重音；强调 vt.强调，着重

sentences.english: Crawford stressed the need for more housing downtown.
sentences.chinese: 克劳福德强调市中心需要建更多的住宅。

sentences.english: She stressed the importance of a balanced diet.
sentences.chinese: 她强调了均衡饮食的重要性。

detailed_translations.english: to emphasize a statement, fact, or idea

sentences.english: Moving to a new house is a very stressful experience.
sentences.chinese: 搬新家是件很劳心的事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 充满著压力的，充满著紧张的
detailed_translations.english: a job, experience, or situation that is stressful makes you worry a lot

name: stricken
trans: a.被打中的，被击伤的；受灾的，受侵袭的

sentences.english: Fire broke out on the stricken ship.
sentences.chinese: 失事船只起火了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 患病的；受挫折的；受…侵袭的；遭殃的
detailed_translations.english: very badly affected by trouble, illness, unhappiness etc

name: strict
trans: a.严格的，严厉的；严谨的，精确的；完全的

sentences.english: a strict teacher
sentences.chinese: 严格的老师

detailed_translations.english: expecting people to obey rules or to do what you say

sentences.english: Alcohol is strictly forbidden on school premises.
sentences.chinese: 校内严禁喝酒。

sentences.english: The ban on hunting is not strictly enforced .
sentences.chinese: 狩猎禁令并未严格执行。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that must be obeyed

sentences.english: The government has promised that the army will be called in to help if there is a firemen’s strike.
sentences.chinese: 政府承诺，如消防员罢工，就将调军队来协助。

detailed_translations.english: a period of time when a group of workers deliberately stop working because of a disagreement about pay, working conditions etc

sentences.english: He was a big strong man.
sentences.chinese: 他高大健壮。

sentences.english: Jack was tall and strong.
sentences.chinese: 杰克又高又壮。

sentences.english: I’m not strong enough to fight him.
sentences.chinese: 和他打我还不够强壮。

detailed_translations.chinese: 坚强的；强壮的；牢固的；擅长的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of physical power so that you can lift heavy things, do hard physical work etc

name: strongly
trans: ad.强有力地；牢固地；坚强地；强烈地

sentences.english: I’m strongly opposed to capital punishment.
sentences.chinese: 我坚决反对死刑。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is meant to persuade someone to do something

name: structure
trans: n.结构，构造；建筑物 vt.建造，建立

sentences.english: challenges to the existing power structure
sentences.chinese: 对现有权力结构的挑战

sentences.english: A new management structure has been introduced.
sentences.chinese: 已推行一种新的管理结构。

sentences.english: molecular structures
sentences.chinese: 分子结构

detailed_translations.english: the way in which the parts of something are connected with each other and form a whole, or the thing that these parts make up

sentences.english: They had to struggle against all kinds of adversity.
sentences.chinese: 他们不得不同各种困境斗争。

detailed_translations.english: to try extremely hard to achieve something, even though it is very difficult

sentences.english: The student trotted out his knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 这个学生炫耀他的知识。

sentences.english: She buddied up with a student from another university.
sentences.chinese: 她与来自另一大学的一名学生交朋友。

sentences.english: The student left the university to go out into the world and find himself.
sentences.chinese: 这个学生离开了大学进入社会去发现自己的才能所在。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is studying at a university, school etc

name: studied
trans: a.深思熟虑的；故意的，蓄意的

sentences.english: She spoke with studied politeness.
sentences.chinese: 她说话的时候故意装得很客气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 深思熟虑的； 认真习得的

name: studio
trans: n.工作室；播音室，演播室；电影制片厂

sentences.english: a recording studio in Nashville
sentences.chinese: 在纳什维尔的一间录音室

sentences.english: a photographer’s studio
sentences.chinese: 摄影师的工作室

detailed_translations.english: a room where television and radio programmes are made and broadcast or where music is recorded

sentences.english: Recent studies show that women still get paid a lot less than men.
sentences.chinese: 最近的调查表明，女性的薪水仍比男性的要低很多。

sentences.english: The study was carried out between January and May 2008.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究是在 2008 年1月到5月间进行的。

sentences.english: Set aside a period of time specifically for study.
sentences.chinese: 留出一段时间专门用于学习

sentences.english: I’ve been studying English for six years
sentences.chinese: 我学英语已有六年了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 研究 (对某一课题或问题的)；中文释义: 学习 (尤指在家里或放学后的)
detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is done to find out more about a particular subject or problem, and usually includes a written report

detailed_translations.chinese: 中文释义: 学习，攻读
detailed_translations.english: to learn about a subject at school, university etc

name: stuff
trans: n.原料，材料；东西 vt.填满，塞满

sentences.english: I’ve got some sticky stuff on my shoe.
sentences.chinese: 我鞋子上有什么黏糊糊的东西。

sentences.english: How do you think you’re going to fit all that stuff into the car?
sentences.chinese: 你说这么多东西你怎么装进车里？

sentences.english: I felt sorry for the ones who had to eat the awful stuff.
sentences.chinese: 我很同情那些只能吃这种难吃东西的人。

sentences.english: Where’s all the camping stuff?
sentences.chinese: 野营用的东西都在哪儿？

detailed_translations.english: used when you are talking about things such as substances, materials, or groups of objects when you do not know what they are called, or it is not important to say exactly what they are

name: stumble
trans: vi.绊倒；跌跌撞撞地走，蹒跚而行

sentences.english: In her hurry, she stumbled and spilled the milk all over the floor.
sentences.chinese: 匆忙中她绊了一下，把牛奶洒得满地都是。

sentences.english: I make it into the darkness with only one stumble.
sentences.chinese: 我只踉跄了一下就把它弄进了黑暗中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 跌， 绊；结结巴巴地说话
detailed_translations.english: to hit your foot against something or put your foot down awkwardly while you are walking or running, so that you almost fall
Stumble is also a noun

sentences.english: an attempt to use Japanese management style in a European business
sentences.chinese: 将日本的管理方式用于欧洲企业的尝试

detailed_translations.english: a particular way of doing, designing, or producing something, especially one that is typical of a particular place, period of time, or group of people
to design clothing, furniture, or the shape of someone’s hair in a particular way

sentences.english: Paul has strong opinions on most subjects.
sentences.chinese: 保罗在大多数问题上观点激烈。

sentences.english: The subjects covered in this chapter are exercise and nutrition.
sentences.chinese: 本章涵盖的主题是运动和营养。

detailed_translations.chinese: 题目； 学科； 主语
detailed_translations.english: the thing you are talking about or considering in a conversation, discussion, book, film etc
to force a country or group of people to be ruled by you, and control them very strictly

sentences.english: As a critic, he is far too subjective.
sentences.chinese: 作为评论家，他过于主观。

sentences.english: a highly subjective point of view
sentences.chinese: 相当主观的看法

detailed_translations.english: a state-ment, report, attitude etc that is subjective is influenced by personal opinion and can therefore be unfair

name: subside
trans: vi.沉淀；沉降；平静下来，平息，减退

sentences.english: Simon waited until the laughter subsided.
sentences.chinese: 西蒙一直等到笑声平息下来。

sentences.english: The pains in his head had subsided, but he still felt dizzy and sick.
sentences.chinese: 他的头痛已经减轻，但仍感到眩晕和恶心。

detailed_translations.english: if a feeling, pain, sound etc subsides, it gradually becomes less and then stops

sentences.english: ...the chalk subsoil on the site.
sentences.chinese: ...工地的白垩底土。

detailed_translations.english: the layer of soil between the ground’s surface and the lower layer of hard rock

name: substance
trans: n.物质；实质，本质；主旨，大意

sentences.english: The leaves were covered with a strange sticky substance.
sentences.chinese: 树叶上覆着一层黏糊糊的怪东西。

sentences.english: The substance of his argument was that people on welfare should work.
sentences.chinese: 他论点的主旨是享受社会福利的人应该去工作。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of solid, liquid, or gas

name: subtle
trans: a.精巧的，精妙的；微妙的，难以捉摸的

sentences.english: The pictures are similar, but there are subtle differences between them.
sentences.chinese: 这些图片很相似，但它们之间有细微的差别。

sentences.english: The warning signs of the disease are so subtle that they are often ignored.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病的警示征兆不易察觉，因而往往被忽视。

sentences.english: a subtle form of racism
sentences.chinese: 隐性的种族歧视

sentences.english: The dish had a subtle hint of ginger.
sentences.chinese: 这道菜微微带点姜的味道。

detailed_translations.english: not easy to notice or understand unless you pay careful attention

sentences.english: The play lacks subtlety.
sentences.chinese: 这部戏不够精细。

sentences.english: She argued her case with considerable subtlety.
sentences.chinese: 她非常巧妙地为自己的论点辩护。

detailed_translations.english: the quality that something has when it has been done in a clever or skilful way, with careful attention to small details

name: subtly
trans: ad.精巧地，精妙地；微妙地，难以捉摸地

sentences.english: The impressive dissertation has subtly revealed a thought-provoking social phenomenon which is prevalent all over the world, which is __.
sentences.chinese: 这篇令人印象深刻的论文敏锐地反映了一种全球盛行的发人深省的社会现象：__（中心词）。

sentences.english: The use of lightweight zinc cladding gives the upper storey a muted tone, texture and colour that subtly merges with the surrounding environment.
sentences.chinese: 使用轻量的锌覆盖层为上层的楼层提供了柔和的色调、质地和颜色，使之巧妙地融入周围环境中。

name: subversive
trans: a.颠覆性的；起破坏作用的

sentences.english: He was engaged in subversive activities .
sentences.chinese: 他参与了颠覆活动。

detailed_translations.english: subversive ideas, activities etc are secret and intended to damage or destroy a government or an established system
someone who secretly tries to damage or destroy the government or an established system

sentences.english: She wanted to be the first woman to climb Mount Qomolangma, and she almost succeeded.
sentences.chinese: 她本想成为第一位登上珠穆朗玛峰的女性，而且差一点就成功了。

detailed_translations.english: to do what you tried or wanted to do
to be the next person to take a position or job after someone else

sentences.english: The experiment was a big success.
sentences.chinese: 实验非常成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成功，成就；胜利；大获成功的人或事物
detailed_translations.english: when you achieve what you want or intend

sentences.english: The operation was successful.
sentences.chinese: 手术成功了。

sentences.english: a highly successful (= very successful ) meeting
sentences.chinese: 十分成功的会议

detailed_translations.english: achieving what you wanted, or having the effect or result you intended

sentences.english: How dared they do such a thing?
sentences.chinese: 他们怎么敢做出这样的事?

sentences.english: He would not succumb to such an item.
sentences.chinese: 他不会对这样的条款做出让步的。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that you think that something is not good enough or that there is not enough of it

sentences.english: They waited in silence and sucked their sweets.
sentences.chinese: 他们静静地等着，吮着糖果。

detailed_translations.english: to take air, liquid etc into your mouth by making your lips form a small hole and using the muscles of your mouth to pull it in
an act of sucking

sentences.english: a sudden change in the weather
sentences.chinese: 天气的突然变化

sentences.english: Life is cruel, she thought, with a sudden rush of anger.
sentences.chinese: 生活真残酷，她想，心头突然涌上一股怒气。

sentences.english: a sudden movement
sentences.chinese: 突然的一动

sentences.english: Her death was sudden.
sentences.chinese: 她的死很突然。

detailed_translations.english: happening, coming, or done quickly or when you do not expect it

sentences.english: I suddenly realized that there was someone following me.
sentences.chinese: 我突然意识到有人跟着我。

sentences.english: George died very suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 乔治死得非常突然。

sentences.english: Suddenly, the eagle opened its wings.
sentences.chinese: 突然，鹰展开翅膀。

detailed_translations.english: quickly and unexpectedly

sentences.english: At least he died suddenly and didn’t suffer.
sentences.chinese: 至少他死得突然，没有遭罪。

sentences.english: She’s suffering a lot of pain.
sentences.chinese: 她遭受着巨大的痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: to experience physical or mental pain

name: suffer from
trans: 受苦，受害，受罚，受损失；患病

sentences.english: Why do people suffer from phobias?
sentences.chinese: 人们为什么会遭受恐惧？

sentences.english: If you suffer from these problems you can file them down with a pumice stone.
sentences.chinese: 如果你遭受这些问题，你可以用一块磨脚石把它锉去。

sentences.english: For instance, if your organization focuses on results and ignores how to achieve those results, it's likely that the group will suffer from low trust and consequently low morale.
sentences.chinese: 例如，如果你的组织集中在结果上，而忽略如何达到这些结果，这些组织很可能遭受比较低的信任，因此有比较低的士气。

sentences.english: We can only prosecute if there is sufficient evidence.
sentences.chinese: 有了足够的证据，我们才能提出起诉。

sentences.english: Unauthorized absence is sufficient reason for dismissal.
sentences.chinese: 旷工足以成为解雇的理由。

sentences.english: We need sufficient time to deal with the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要足够的时间来处理这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: as much as is needed for a particular purpose

sentences.english: Otherwise, the suffix will not be added.
sentences.chinese: 否则，后缀将不会被添加。

sentences.english: This required that all subtrees are all under the same suffix, since there is no common parent between suffixes.
sentences.chinese: 这需要所有的子树都位于相同的后缀中，因为后缀之间不存在公共父节点。

sentences.english: But only if the GAC as a whole does not like a suffix must the board take these objections into account—and then issue a detailed explanation if it overrides them.
sentences.chinese: 但是，只有在GAC也不同意新域名后缀的情况下，董事会才会考虑这些反对意见。 而且如果要撤销这些域名的话，它需要发布一份详细的解释报告。

detailed_translations.english: a letter or letters added to the end of a word to form a new word, such as ‘ness’ in ‘kindness’ or ‘ly’ in ‘suddenly’

sentences.english: Do you take sugar in your coffee?
sentences.chinese: 你的咖啡加糖吗？

detailed_translations.english: a sweet white or brown substance that is obtained from plants and used to make food and drinks sweet
to add sugar or cover something with sugar

sentences.english: The zoo asked its visitors to suggest a name for the new baby panda.
sentences.chinese: 动物园请游客提建议，给刚出生的大熊猫起一个名字。

sentences.english: It has been suggested that the manager will resign if any more players are sold.
sentences.chinese: 有人提议，如果再有球员被出售，球队主教练就辞职。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提议，建议；启发；使人想起；显示；暗示
detailed_translations.english: to tell someone your ideas about what they should do, where they should go etc

sentences.english: More people commit suicide at Christmas than at any other time.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节期间自杀的人比其他任何时候都多。

sentences.english: My mother attempted suicide on many occasions.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲多次试图自杀。

sentences.english: He apparently left a suicide note (= letter explaining his reasons for killing himself ) on his desk.
sentences.chinese: 他显然在桌上留了封绝笔信。

detailed_translations.english: the act of killing yourself

sentences.english: Johnson has filed suit against her.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊对她提起了诉讼。

sentences.english: a civil suit
sentences.chinese: 民事诉讼

sentences.english: There are countryside walks to suit everyone.
sentences.chinese: 有适合每个人的乡村步行路径。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or complaint that a person or company brings to a court of law to be settled
to be acceptable, suitable, or  convenient  for a particular person or in a particular situation

sentences.english: We are hoping to find a suitable school.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望能找到一所合适的学校。

detailed_translations.english: having the right qualities for a particular person, purpose, or situation

sentences.english: But no one knew where the sulfur came from.
sentences.chinese: 但是，没有人知道硫来自何处。

sentences.english: Well, this chlorine has taken one electron from the sulfur.
sentences.chinese: 对了，这个氯从硫那里得到了一个电子。

sentences.english: These pollutants are called aerosols and they include soot as well as compounds of nitrogen and sulfur and other stuff into the air.
sentences.chinese: 通常，我们称这些污染物为悬浮微粒，它们包含烟尘以及氮硫与进入大气的其他物质的混合物。

name: sum
trans: n.总数；金额 vi.共计 vt.总结

sentences.english: He owes me a large sum of money .
sentences.chinese: 他欠我一大笔钱。

sentences.english: You will have to pay the sum of the two sets of costs.
sentences.chinese: 你得支付那两笔费用的总和。

sentences.english: I was good at sums at school.
sentences.chinese: 我上学时擅长算术。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money

sentences.english: The authors summarize their views in the introduction.
sentences.chinese: 作者在序言里概述了他们的观点。

detailed_translations.english: to make a short statement giving only the main information and not the details of a plan, event, report etc

sentences.english: We tour by car every summer.
sentences.chinese: 每年夏天我们都驾车出外旅行。

sentences.english: Food must be refrigerated in summer.
sentences.chinese: 食物在夏天必须加以冷藏。

sentences.english: After a summer here the poorest sheep and cattle grow strong and fat.
sentences.chinese: 经过一个夏天， 连最差的牛羊在这里也长得又肥又壮了。

sentences.english: The sky was blue and the sun was shining.
sentences.chinese: 天空蔚蓝，阳光明媚。

detailed_translations.english: the large bright object in the sky that gives us light and heat, and around which the Earth moves
to sit or lie outside when the sun is shining

sentences.english: What are you doing Sunday?
sentences.chinese: 你星期天做什么？

detailed_translations.english: the day between Saturday and Monday

sentences.english: The water sparkled in the bright sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 水面在灿烂的阳光下闪闪发亮。

sentences.english: (= came in large amounts ) through the windows.
sentences.chinese: 阳光从窗户流泻进来。

sentences.english: a shaft of sunlight
sentences.chinese: 一束阳光

detailed_translations.english: natural light that comes from the sun

name: superior
trans: a.较好的，优的；上级的 n.上级，长官

sentences.english: She had that superior tone of voice.
sentences.chinese: 她带着那种傲慢的语气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上级的，较高的；优越的；有优越感的，高傲的
detailed_translations.english: thinking that you are better than other people – used to show disapproval
someone who has a higher rank or position than you, especially in a job

sentences.english: His eyes roved round the supermarket.
sentences.chinese: 他的眼睛环视了一下超级市场。

sentences.english: The whole supermarket was ruined in a great fire.
sentences.chinese: 整个超级市场被一场大火烧掉。

sentences.english: The supermarket near our school will be reopened soon.
sentences.chinese: 我们学校附近的那个超级市场不久将重新开业。

detailed_translations.english: a very large shop that sells food, drinks, and things that people need regularly in their homes

sentences.english: At least one supernova occurs per decade in our galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 每十年至少有一颗超新星在我们的银河系中出现。

detailed_translations.english: a very large exploding star

sentences.english: Why don’t you come over for supper on Friday?
sentences.chinese: 周五为什么不过来吃晚饭呢？

sentences.english: We had supper in a small Italian place.
sentences.chinese: 我们在一家意大利小餐馆吃了晚饭。

sentences.english: Have you eaten supper ?
sentences.chinese: 你吃过晚饭了吗？

detailed_translations.english: the meal that you have in the early evening

sentences.english: The nation’s fuel supplies will not last forever.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的燃料供应不会无穷无尽。

sentences.english: To protect the food supply , the government ordered the slaughter of affected cattle.
sentences.chinese: 为保护食品供应，政府下令宰杀被感染的牛。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that is available to be used

sentences.english: The bill was supported by a large majority in the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案得到参议院绝大多数人的支持。

sentences.english: We strongly support the peace process.
sentences.chinese: 我们大力拥护和平进程。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you agree with an idea, group, or person, and usually to help them because you want them to succeed

detailed_translations.chinese: 支持， 支撑物， 支持者
detailed_translations.english: something that presses on something else to hold it up or in position

sentences.english: There were many more deaths than was first supposed.
sentences.chinese: 死亡人数远远超过最初的预料。

sentences.english: There's no reason to suppose (= it is unlikely that ) he’s lying.
sentences.chinese: 没有理由认为他在说谎。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, based on what you know

name: supreme
trans: a.最高的，至上的；极度的，最主要的

sentences.english: the Supreme Allied Commander in Europe
sentences.chinese: 欧洲盟军最高指挥官

sentences.english: a country where the car reigns supreme
sentences.chinese: 汽车占绝对优势地位的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高的；至高的；最重要的
detailed_translations.english: having the highest position of power, importance, or influence

sentences.english: ‘That’s Sarah’s cousin.’ ‘Are you sure?’
sentences.chinese: “那是萨拉的表妹。”“你肯定吗？”

sentences.english: ‘What time does the show start?’ ‘I’m not sure.’
sentences.chinese: “表演什么时候开始？”“我说不准。”

sentences.english: My mother, I felt sure , had not met him before.
sentences.chinese: 我敢肯定我妈妈以前从未见过他。

detailed_translations.english: confident that you know something or that something is true or correct
used to say ‘yes’ to someone

sentences.english: Nearly 10% of the Earth’s surface is covered by ice.
sentences.chinese: 地球表面将近 10% 被冰层覆盖。

sentences.english: Gas bubbles in any liquid tend to rise to the surface .
sentences.chinese: 在任何液体中气泡往往都会浮到表面。

detailed_translations.english: the top layer of an area of water or land
relating to the part of the army, navy etc that travels by land or on the sea, rather than by air or under the sea
if someone or something surfaces, they suddenly appear somewhere, especially after being gone or hidden for a long time

sentences.english: major/minor surgery
sentences.chinese: 大 / 小手术

detailed_translations.english: medical treatment of injuries or diseases that involves cutting open a person's body and often removing or replacing some parts; the branch of medicine connected with this treatment

name: surgical
trans: a.外科的；外科手术的，外科用的

sentences.english: surgical techniques
sentences.chinese: 外科技术

detailed_translations.english: relating to or used for medical operations

sentences.english: His strange question surprised her.
sentences.chinese: 他那奇怪的问题令她感到意外。

sentences.english: I didn’t know you two knew each other. Mind you, it doesn’t surprise me .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道你们俩认识。 尽管如此，我并不感到意外。

sentences.english: What surprised me most was that she didn’t seem to care.
sentences.chinese: 最令我感到意外的是，她好像毫不在乎。

sentences.english: The man had a look of surprise on his face.
sentences.chinese: 那人脸上一副惊讶的表情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使诧异,使惊异,使感到意外
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel surprised
the feeling you have when something unexpected or unusual happens

sentences.english: He glared at the people who surrounded the tent.
sentences.chinese: 他怒视着围住帐篷的那些人。

detailed_translations.english: to be all around someone or something on every side

name: surrounding
trans: n.周围的事物；环境 a.周围的

sentences.english: Troops sealed off the surrounding area .
sentences.chinese: 军队封锁了周围地区。

sentences.english: We decided to explore the surrounding countryside .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定去附近的乡间走走看看。

detailed_translations.english: near or around a particular place

name: survival
trans: n.幸存，生存；幸存物，幸存者

sentences.english: The doctors gave him a one in ten chance of survival .
sentences.chinese: 医生说他有十分之一的生存希望。

sentences.english: The cult is a survival from the old Zoroastrian religion.
sentences.chinese: 这种膜拜仪式是古老的拜火教遗留下来的。

detailed_translations.english: the state of continuing to live or exist

name: survive
trans: vi.活下来，幸存 vt.比…活得长

sentences.english: Only 12 of the 140 passengers survived.
sentences.chinese: 140 名乘客中只有 12 人生还。

sentences.english: She survived the attack.
sentences.chinese: 她在袭击中幸免于难。

sentences.english: people who survive cancer
sentences.chinese: 癌症幸存者

detailed_translations.chinese: 活下来，继续存在；幸免于
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live after an accident, war, or illness

detailed_translations.chinese: 从中挺过来； 从…逃出； 比…活得长
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live normally in spite of many problems

name: suspect
trans: vt./vi.疑有；推测 n.嫌疑犯，可疑分子

sentences.english: She strongly suspected he was lying to her.
sentences.chinese: 她非常怀疑他在对她撒谎。

sentences.english: She’s not going to be very happy about this, I suspect .
sentences.chinese: 我想对于此事她不会太高兴。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, especially something bad
someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime

sentences.english: He leant against her so heavily that she could barely sustain his weight.
sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

sentences.english: Which planets can sustain life?
sentences.chinese: 哪些行星可以维持生命的存在？

detailed_translations.english: to hold up the weight of something

sentences.english: He swallowed the last of his coffee and asked for the bill.
sentences.chinese: 他喝完最后一口咖啡，要求结账。

sentences.english: Most snakes swallow their prey whole .
sentences.chinese: 大多数蛇都是把猎物囫囵吞下。

detailed_translations.english: to make food or drink go down your throat and towards your stomach

name: swear
trans: vt./vi.诅咒，咒骂；宣誓n.誓言；骂人话

sentences.english: Remember that you have sworn an oath and so must tell the truth.
sentences.chinese: 记住你已经宣过誓了，所以必须讲真话。

sentences.english: Presidents must swear allegiance to the US constitution.
sentences.chinese: 总统必须宣誓效忠美国宪法。

detailed_translations.english: to make a public official promise, especially in a court of law
to use rude and offensive language

name: sweat
trans: n.汗 vi.出汗 vt.使出汗

sentences.english: Ian came off the squash court dripping with sweat .
sentences.chinese: 伊恩大汗淋漓地离开壁球场。

sentences.english: Beads of sweat appeared on his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 他的额头上冒出了汗珠。

sentences.english: I was sweating a lot despite the air conditioning.
sentences.chinese: 尽管开着空调，我仍是满头大汗。

detailed_translations.english: drops of salty liquid that come out through your skin when you are hot, frightened, ill, or doing exercise
to have drops of salty liquid coming out through your skin because you are hot, ill, frightened, or doing exercise

sentences.english: Sweden borders Norway and Finland.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典与挪威、芬兰接壤。

sentences.english: During a holiday in Sweden， I found this note on my car： 'sir， we welcome you to our city.
sentences.chinese: 有一次在瑞典度假，我发现我的车上有这样一个字条："先生，欢迎您光临我们的城市。

sentences.english: Why did you choose Sweden for the procedure?
sentences.chinese: 为什么你会选择在瑞典进行治疗

sentences.english: Bert swept the path in front of the house.
sentences.chinese: 伯特清扫了屋前的小路。

sentences.english: Thunderstorms swept the country.
sentences.chinese: 雷暴横扫全国。

detailed_translations.english: to clean the dust, dirt etc from the floor or ground, using a brush with a long handle

sentences.english: This tea is too sweet.
sentences.chinese: 这茶太甜了。

sentences.english: sweet juicy peaches
sentences.chinese: 味甜多汁的桃子

sentences.english: sweet wine
sentences.chinese: 甜葡萄酒

detailed_translations.chinese: 甜的；悦耳的；芳香的；亲切的
detailed_translations.english: containing or having a taste like sugar
a small piece of sweet food made of sugar or chocolate

sentences.english: My letter received a swift reply.
sentences.chinese: 我的信很快就得到了回复。

sentences.english: She shot a swift glance at Paul.
sentences.chinese: 她迅速瞥了保罗一眼。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done quickly and immediately

sentences.english: Let’s go swimming this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午我们游泳去吧。

sentences.english: kids learning to swim the backstroke
sentences.chinese: 学习仰泳的孩子们

sentences.english: She was the first woman to swim the Channel.
sentences.chinese: 她是第一个游过英吉利海峡的女性。

detailed_translations.english: to move yourself through water using your arms and legs
a period of time that you spend swimming

name: swindle
trans: vt.诈骗，欺诈 vi.诈骗 n.诈骗行为

sentences.english: a big tax swindle
sentences.chinese: 巨额税款诈骗

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which someone gets money by deceiving someone else
to get money from someone by deceiving them

name: switch
trans: n.开关，转换器 v.转换；接通或切断…电流

sentences.english: The terrorists will switch tactics .
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子会改变战术。

detailed_translations.english: to change from doing or using one thing to doing or using another

sentences.english: Say I have an online resource that I want you to symbolically pay for.
sentences.chinese: 比如，我有一个在线资源，希望您能象征性地为其付出代价。

sentences.english: In order to have language, any language, you need to be able to think symbolically.
sentences.chinese: 为了有语言，无论任何语言，你需要能够象征性地思想。

sentences.english: Thinking symbolically is the foundation of everything we do — we live in a symbolic world.
sentences.chinese: 象征性思维是我们做一切的基础，我们生活在一个符号的世界里。

name: symphony
trans: n.交响曲，交响乐；交响乐队，交响音乐会

sentences.english: Bruckner’s Fifth Symphony
sentences.chinese: 布鲁克纳的《第五交响曲》

detailed_translations.english: a long piece of music usually in four parts, written for an orchestra

sentences.english: One of the most common symptoms of schizophrenia is hearing imaginary voices.
sentences.chinese: 精神分裂症最常见的症状之一是幻听。

detailed_translations.english: something wrong with your body or mind which shows that you have a particular illness

name: synchronize
trans: vi.同时发生，同步 vt.使同步

sentences.english: It was virtually impossible to synchronize our lives so as to take vacations and weekends together.
sentences.chinese: 为了一起度假和过周末而要让我们的生活同步几乎是不可能的。

sentences.english: Synchronize the score with the film action.
sentences.chinese: 让配乐和电影动作同步。

detailed_translations.english: If you synchronize two activities, processes, or movements, or if you synchronize one activity, process, or movement with another, you cause them to happen at the same time and speed as each other

sentences.english: a synthesis of Eastern and Western philosophical ideas
sentences.chinese: 东西方哲学思想的结合

sentences.english: the synthesis of proteins
sentences.chinese: 蛋白质的合成

sentences.english: speech synthesis software
sentences.chinese: 语音合成软件

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合，综合物；（化学或生物学物质的）合成；（用电子方式对声音、语音或音乐的）合成
detailed_translations.english: something that has been made by combining different things, or the process of combining things

sentences.english: an alarm system
sentences.chinese: 警报系统

sentences.english: a well-designed heating system
sentences.chinese: 设计良好的供暖系统

sentences.english: the digestive system
sentences.chinese: 消化系统

sentences.english: the railway system
sentences.chinese: 铁路系统

detailed_translations.chinese: 系统； 制度， 体制； 方法， 做法； 身体
detailed_translations.english: a group of related parts that work together as a whole for a particular purpose

name: systematically
trans: a.有系统地，有体系地；有计划地

sentences.english: Rumours of possible human cases in other parts of the country have been systematically followed up.
sentences.chinese: 已系统地对关于该国其它地区可能的人间病例的传闻进行跟踪。

sentences.english: Never before has anyone systematically looked for the last queen of Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 以前没有人曾系统地寻找过这位埃及最后的女王。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有系统地, 有条理地

sentences.english: The food was served on long tables.
sentences.chinese: 食物放在长餐桌上供应。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture with a flat top supported by legs
to leave a bill etc to be discussed or dealt with in the future

sentences.english: The dog wagged its tail .
sentences.chinese: 那条狗摇了摇尾巴。

detailed_translations.english: the part that sticks out at the back of an animal’s body, and that it can move

sentences.english: Will you take the job?
sentences.chinese: 你接受这份工作吗？

sentences.english: Do you take American Express?
sentences.chinese: 你们接受美国运通信用卡吗？

sentences.english: If you take my advice , you’ll see a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 如果你听我的意见，就去看医生。

sentences.english: Our helpline take s 3.5 million calls (= telephone calls ) a year.
sentences.chinese: 我们的求助热线每年接听350万个电话。

sentences.english: Some doctors are unwilling to take new patients without a referral.
sentences.chinese: 有些医生不愿意接收没有转诊单的新病人。

sentences.english: Liz found his criticisms hard to take .
sentences.chinese: 利兹觉得他的批评很难接受。

sentences.english: I just can’t take any more (= can’t deal with a bad situation any longer ) .
sentences.chinese: 我再也受不了了。

sentences.english: Staff have agreed to take a 2% pay cut.
sentences.chinese: 员工同意接受2%的降薪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拿走； 接受， 接纳
detailed_translations.english: to accept or choose something that is offered, suggested, or given to you

sentences.english: When the clock stopped, he took it apart, found what was wrong, and put the whole thing together again.
sentences.chinese: 当钟不走时，他把它拆了，找出毛病所在，然后再组装起来。

detailed_translations.english: If you take something apart, you separate it into the different parts that it is made of

name: take care of
trans: 爱护；照顾，照料；处理，对付

sentences.english: I always used to laugh to myself when I heard people say that we need to take care of ourselves in order to be able to take care of others.
sentences.chinese: 我听到一些人说要照顾好我们自己，这样我们才有能力去照顾好别人。 不知道为什么，当我听到这句话的时候，我经常笑我自己。

sentences.english: Because the office refrigerator is unowned by any individual, no one feels responsibility to take care of it, and certainly no one wants to take time out of his or her busy workday to do so.
sentences.chinese: 办公室里的冰箱因为不属于任何一个个人，没有人觉得自己有责任去管理或者照顾它，当然也没人在繁忙的工作时间抽出时间去做那些事情。

sentences.english: They will certainly need to take in plenty of liquid.
sentences.chinese: 他们会肯定需要吸收大量液体。

detailed_translations.english: If people, animals, or plants take in air, drink, or food, they allow it to enter their body, usually by breathing or swallowing

name: take over
trans: 接管，接任；把…从一处运到另一处

sentences.english: I'm going to take over the company one day.
sentences.chinese: 我总有一天会接管这家公司。

detailed_translations.english: If you take over a company, you get control of it, for example, by buying its shares

sentences.english: When does the wedding come off [take place]?
sentences.chinese: 什么时候举行婚礼?

sentences.english: How many of you believe that there are meetings that take place without you?
sentences.chinese: 你们中多少人相信会有会议,在你们不在场时也会举行？

sentences.english: William and Kate, both 28, have so far revealed only that the wedding will take place in either the spring or summer next year with bookmakers tipping July and August as favorites.
sentences.chinese: 威廉和凯特今年都是28岁。迄今为止，两人只透露说婚礼将在明年春天或夏天举行。博彩公司认为七月或八月结婚的可能性较大。

name: take responsibility for
trans: 负起对…的责任；对…负有责任

sentences.english: a book of old Japanese folk tales
sentences.chinese: 日本古老民间故事书

sentences.english: a fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen
sentences.chinese: 安徒生的一则童话

sentences.english: a cautionary tale
sentences.chinese: 警示故事

sentences.english: tales of her life in post-war Berlin
sentences.chinese: 有关她在战后柏林生活的传闻

detailed_translations.english: a story about exciting imaginary events

sentences.english: I could hear Sarah and Andy talking in the next room.
sentences.chinese: 我听到萨拉和安迪在隔壁讲话。

sentences.english: Sue and Bob still aren’t talking (= are refusing to talk to each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 休和鲍勃仍然互不理睬。

detailed_translations.english: to say things to someone as part of a conversation
to say things to someone as part of a conversation

sentences.english: He was young and tall.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻，身材高大。

sentences.english: a house surrounded by tall trees
sentences.chinese: 大树环绕的房子

sentences.english: This bush grows tall very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 这种灌木很快就能长高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 高的；长的；过分的；夸大的
detailed_translations.english: a person, building, tree etc that is tall is a greater height than normal

detailed_translations.chinese: (Tall)人名；(马里、阿拉伯)塔勒；(芬、罗、瑞典)塔尔；(英)托尔；(土)塔勒

name: tangible
trans: a.可触摸的，可感知的；确实的，真实的

sentences.english: The silence of the countryside was almost tangible .
sentences.chinese: 乡村的寂静几乎能感觉得到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有形的；切实的；可触摸的
detailed_translations.english: if something is tangible, you can touch or feel it

name: tape
trans: n.带子；磁带 vt.系，捆；录音

sentences.english: a photo stuck to the wall with tape
sentences.chinese: 用胶布贴在墙上的照片

detailed_translations.english: a narrow length of plastic that is sticky on one side and is used to stick things together

detailed_translations.chinese: 录音；用带子捆扎；用胶布把…封住
detailed_translations.english: to record sound or pictures onto a tape

sentences.english: Sara had the task of preparing the agenda for meetings.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉的任务是准备会议议程。

sentences.english: I was given the task of building a fire.
sentences.chinese: 我分配到生火的任务。

sentences.english: the skills required to carry out these tasks
sentences.chinese: 执行这些任务所需要的技能

sentences.english: He soon realized the scale of the task he had undertaken .
sentences.chinese: 他很快就意识到他所承担任务的艰巨性了。

sentences.english: Our first task is to gather information.
sentences.chinese: 我们的首要任务是收集信息。

sentences.english: Monkeys can be taught to do simple tasks .
sentences.chinese: 猴子能被教会做一些简单的事。

sentences.english: They have the unenviable task of supervising the most dangerous prison in the country.
sentences.chinese: 他们有个令人头疼的工作，就是管理国家最危险的监狱。

sentences.english: Volunteers had the thankless task of distributing campaign leaflets.
sentences.chinese: 志愿者的任务是分发活动传单，吃力不讨好。

sentences.english: Trying to bring up a small daughter on your own is no easy task .
sentences.chinese: 独自抚养年幼的女儿不是件轻而易举的事。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that must be done, especially one that is difficult or unpleasant or that must be done regularly

sentences.english: Some birds have a highly developed sense of taste.
sentences.chinese: 有些鸟的味觉很发达。

sentences.english: She has such good taste.
sentences.chinese: 她的品位很高雅。

detailed_translations.english: the sense by which you know one food from another

sentences.english: No-one enjoys paying tax.
sentences.chinese: 没人喜欢缴税。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you must pay to the government according to your income, property, goods etc and that is used to pay for public services

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…征税； 使负担重， 使费尽力气
detailed_translations.english: to charge a tax on something

sentences.english: Would you like a cup of tea or coffee?
sentences.chinese: 你想来一杯茶还是咖啡？

sentences.english: Do you take milk and sugar in your tea?
sentences.chinese: 你的茶里面要放牛奶和糖吗？

sentences.english: I’d like two teas and a piece of chocolate cake, please.
sentences.chinese: 我想要两杯茶和一块巧克力蛋糕。

detailed_translations.english: a hot brown drink made by pouring boiling water onto the dried leaves from a particular Asian bush, or a cup of this drink

sentences.english: She taught me fractions and counting.
sentences.chinese: 他教我分数和计算。

detailed_translations.english: to give lessons in a school, college, or university, or to help someone learn about something by giving them information

sentences.english: a primary school teacher
sentences.chinese: 小学教师

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to teach, especially in a school

sentences.english: black trousers teamed with a bright shirt
sentences.chinese: 配亮色衬衫的黑裤子

sentences.english: You can team up with one other class member if you want.
sentences.chinese: 例句：如果你愿意的话，可以找一个同学组成一组。

detailed_translations.english: to put two things or people together, because they will look good or work well together

sentences.english: The children were all in tears .
sentences.chinese: 孩子们全都哭了。

sentences.english: She came home in floods of tears .
sentences.chinese: 她泪流满面地回到家里。

sentences.english: I could see that Sam was close to tears .
sentences.chinese: 我看到萨姆都快哭了。

sentences.english: Bridget suddenly burst into tears and ran out.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特突然大哭着跑了出去。

sentences.english: He was fighting back tears as he spoke.
sentences.chinese: 他一边说，一边拼命忍住泪水。

sentences.english: A lot of people were moved to tears by his story.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都被他的故事感动得落泪。

sentences.english: He kissed her cheek, a gesture that brought tears to her eyes .
sentences.chinese: 他亲了亲她的脸，这个举动让她热泪盈眶。

sentences.english: I must admit I shed a few tears when the school closed.
sentences.chinese: 我必须承认，学校关闭时我掉过几滴眼泪。

sentences.english: I saw grown men reduced to tears that day.
sentences.chinese: 那天我看到成年男子都流下了眼泪。

sentences.english: ‘Please don’t talk like that,’ Ellen implored him, her eyes filling with tears .
sentences.chinese: “请别那么说。”埃伦恳求道，眼里噙满泪水。

sentences.english: By this time, tears were streaming down my face.
sentences.chinese: 此时，我已泪流满面。

sentences.english: The tears he shed were tears of joy .
sentences.chinese: 他淌下的是喜悦的泪水。

detailed_translations.english: a drop of salty liquid that comes out of your eye when you are crying

sentences.english: a laboratory technician
sentences.chinese: 实验室技术人员

sentences.english: a hospital technician
sentences.chinese: 医院技术人员

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to check equipment or machines and make sure that they are working properly

sentences.english: In mathematics, we use many techniques of problem-solving.
sentences.chinese: 在数学中，我们会使用多种方法解题。

sentences.english: He’s a great player, with brilliant technique.
sentences.chinese: 他是个伟大的球员，球技十分精湛。

detailed_translations.english: a special way of doing something

sentences.english: The steam engine was the greatest technological advance of the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽机是19世纪最伟大的技术进步。

detailed_translations.english: related to technology

sentences.english: Modern technology makes moving money around much easier than it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 现代科技使货币流动比以前便捷得多。

sentences.english: Advances in technology have improved crop yields by over 30%.
sentences.chinese: 科技的进步使庄稼产量提高了30%以上。

sentences.english: There have been major new developments in satellite technology.
sentences.chinese: 卫星技术有了重大的新发展。

sentences.english: Many people are unwilling to embrace new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不愿意接受新科技。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工艺学； 工艺， 技术
detailed_translations.english: new machines, equipment, and ways of doing things that are based on modern knowledge about science and computers

sentences.english: If large media and telecommunication companies decide to close their offerings to the web, I am convinced the web will route around it.
sentences.chinese: 如果大型媒体和电信公司决定停止向万维网提供内容，我很确信万维网会绕过这一点。

sentences.english: He became rich through his well diversified conglomerates which deal with oil, banking and telecommunication business in his homeland, Russia.
sentences.chinese: 他在他的祖国俄罗斯通过分类得当的联合企业集团以经营石油、银行业务及电信业务获得财富。

detailed_translations.english: the telegraphic or telephonic communication of audio, video, or digital information over a distance by means of radio waves, optical signals, etc, or along a transmission line

name: telegraph
trans: n.电报（机） vt.用电报发送 vi.打电报

sentences.english: Once he knew where we were, Lewis telegraphed every few hours.
sentences.chinese: 一知道我们在哪里，刘易斯就每隔几小时发一份电报来。

detailed_translations.english: an old-fashioned method of sending messages using radio or electrical signals
to send a message by telegraph

sentences.english: Lucy turned on the television to watch the evening news.
sentences.chinese: 露西打开电视收看晚间新闻。

sentences.english: They have a television in every room.
sentences.chinese: 他们每个房间都配有电视。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of electronic equipment shaped like a box with a screen, on which you can watch programmes

sentences.english: I’ll tell you all about it when I get back.
sentences.chinese: 我回来再告诉你这一切。

sentences.english: Sheppard was telling the truth .
sentences.chinese: 谢泼德说的是实话。

detailed_translations.english: if someone tells you something, they communicate information, a story, their feelings etc to you

detailed_translations.chinese: (Tell)人名；(英、德、瑞典)特尔；(罗、意)泰尔；(阿拉伯)塔勒

sentences.english: Pete hit his brother in a fit of temper .
sentences.chinese: 皮特一气之下打了他弟弟。

detailed_translations.english: the way you are feeling at a particular time, especially when you are feeling angry for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 调和， 使缓和； 【冶】使回火
detailed_translations.english: to make something less severe or extreme

sentences.english: The temperature of the water was just right for swimming.
sentences.chinese: 这水温游泳正好。

sentences.english: Water boils at a temperature of 100˚C.
sentences.chinese: 水在100摄氏度沸腾。

sentences.english: The nurse took (= measured ) my temperature .
sentences.chinese: 护士给我量了体温。

detailed_translations.english: a measure of how hot or cold a place or thing is

sentences.english: a thick oak door
sentences.chinese: 一扇厚实的橡木门

sentences.english: a thick slice of homemade bread
sentences.chinese: 一片厚厚的自制面包

sentences.english: He was wearing thick glasses.
sentences.chinese: 他戴着厚厚的眼镜。

sentences.english: short thick fingers
sentences.chinese: 短粗的手指

sentences.english: thick wool socks (= socks that are heavy and warm )
sentences.chinese: 厚厚的羊毛袜子

sentences.english: If you want a thicker blanket, there are more here in the closet.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想要更厚的毯子，这个柜子里还有。

sentences.english: The meat is done when the thickest part turns from pink to white.
sentences.chinese: 肉最厚的部分从粉红色变成白色，就说明熟了。

detailed_translations.english: if something is thick, there is a large distance or a larger distance than usual between its two opposite surfaces or sides

sentences.english: a thin gold chain
sentences.chinese: 一条细细的金链

sentences.english: She’s only wearing a thin summer jacket (= a jacket made of light material ) .
sentences.chinese: 她只穿了一件薄薄的夏装外套。

sentences.english: two thin slices of bread
sentences.chinese: 薄薄的两片面包

sentences.english: The road was covered with a thin layer of ice.
sentences.chinese: 路面上覆盖着一层薄薄的冰。

sentences.english: The skin on the eyelids is the thinnest on the body.
sentences.chinese: 眼睑上的皮肤是人体最薄的皮肤。

sentences.english: NATO will continue to thin out its forces.
sentences.chinese: 北约将继续裁军。

sentences.english: NATO will continue to thin out its forces.
sentences.chinese: 北约将继续裁军。

detailed_translations.chinese: 薄的；瘦的；稀薄的；微弱的
detailed_translations.english: if something is thin, there is only a small distance between its two opposite sides or surfaces
Thin out means the same as
Thin out means the same as

sentences.english: People say things they don’t mean when they are angry.
sentences.chinese: 人生气时就会口不择言。

sentences.english: It was a horrible thing to happen.
sentences.chinese: 发生这样的事情太糟糕了。

sentences.english: I plan to do all the things I’ve been meaning to do for ages.
sentences.chinese: 我打算去做我多年以来一直想做的事。

sentences.english: The first thing to do is to give them food and shelter.
sentences.chinese: 首要的事是给他们提供食物和住所。

sentences.english: That’s a terrible thing to say .
sentences.chinese: 这话说得太难听了。

sentences.english: Getting more American ideas into British business would be a good thing .
sentences.chinese: 将更多的美国式理念注入英国商界会是一件好事。

sentences.english: ‘I did no such thing ,’ he protested.
sentences.chinese: “我没干过这样的事。”他抗议道。

sentences.english: I know a thing or two (= a lot ) about dogs.
sentences.chinese: 我对狗所知甚详。

sentences.english: In a democracy, it is no bad thing to be able to compromise (= it is good, even though it may not seem good ) .
sentences.chinese: 在民主国家，能够妥协并非就是坏事。

detailed_translations.english: an idea, action, feeling, or fact that someone thinks, does, says, or talks about, or that happens

sentences.english: I thought I heard something.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我听到了什么声音。

sentences.english: He didn’t think anyone would believe him.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得没人会相信他。

sentences.english: Do you think I should call him?
sentences.chinese: 你认为我应该打电话给他吗？

sentences.english: For some reason, I keep thinking it’s Friday today.
sentences.chinese: 不知为什么，我总觉得今天是周五。

sentences.english: The recession lasted longer than anyone thought it would.
sentences.chinese: 谁也没有想到这次经济萧条会持续这么久。

sentences.english: Am I right in thinking that you have a brother?
sentences.chinese: 我想你是有个兄弟的，对吗？

sentences.english: I can’t help thinking that he’s made a mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我总觉得他弄错了。

sentences.english: Do you honestly think I would do something so stupid?
sentences.chinese: 你真认为我会做这么愚蠢的事吗？

sentences.chinese: 我们必须开始考虑降低成本了。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular opinion or to believe that something is true
to think about a problem or question

sentences.english: great thinkers such as Kant and Schopenhauer
sentences.chinese: 康德、叔本华等伟大的思想家

detailed_translations.english: someone who thinks carefully about important subjects such as science or  philosophy  , especially someone who is famous for thinking of new ideas

sentences.english: the thinking man’s pop band
sentences.chinese: 有思想的男士喜欢的流行乐队

detailed_translations.english: a thinking person is intelligent and tries to think carefully about important subjects
your opinion or ideas about something, or your attitude towards it

sentences.english: Divide it into thirds.
sentences.chinese: 把它分成三等份。

detailed_translations.english: one of three equal parts of something
coming after two other things in a series

sentences.english: They’ve only sold thirteen tickets so far.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止他们仅仅售出13张票。

sentences.english: When it happened, I was thirteen (= 13 years old ) .
sentences.chinese: 那事发生时，我13岁。

detailed_translations.english: the number 13
the number 13

sentences.english: In the thirties, air travel really began to take off.
sentences.chinese: 在30年代，乘飞机旅行迅速流行了起来。

detailed_translations.english: the number 30
the number 30

sentences.english: The table’s about this high and this wide.
sentences.chinese: 那桌子大约有这么高，这么宽。

sentences.english: You need to cut about this much off the end of the pipe.
sentences.chinese: 你要从管子头上切下大约这么多。

detailed_translations.english: used to say how big, how much etc, when you are showing the size, amount etc with your hands

name: thorough
trans: a./ad.彻底的，完全的；周到的，精心的

sentences.english: The doctor gave him a thorough check-up.
sentences.chinese: 医生给他做了一次全面的体检。

sentences.english: a thorough and detailed biography
sentences.chinese: 详尽的传记

sentences.english: The police investigation was very thorough.
sentences.chinese: 警方的调查十分彻底。

sentences.english: thorough notes of the meeting
sentences.chinese: 详尽的会议记录

detailed_translations.english: including every possible detail

sentences.english: He dotted down those notes.
sentences.chinese: 他匆匆记下了那些注解。

sentences.english: She ganged up on me with those rough boys.
sentences.chinese: 她伙同那些粗野的男孩对付我。

sentences.english: Two heart attacks in a year. It hasn’t stopped him smoking, though.
sentences.chinese: 一年里心脏病发作了两次，可是那也没让他把烟戒掉。

sentences.english: It sounds like a lot of fun. Isn’t it rather risky though?
sentences.chinese: 听上去很有趣。可是这不是也很危险吗？

detailed_translations.english: used after adding a fact, opinion, or question which seems surprising after what you have just said, or which makes what you have just said seem less true
used to introduce a statement that makes the main statement coming after it seem surprising, unlikely, or unexpected

sentences.english: It’s an interesting thought.
sentences.chinese: 这想法很有趣。

sentences.english: The thought that I might not have a job next year is a bit troubling.
sentences.chinese: 想到明年可能失业我有点心烦。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think of, remember, or realize

detailed_translations.chinese: 想，思考；认为（think的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: a journey of almost a thousand miles
sentences.chinese: 将近1,000英里的旅程

detailed_translations.english: the number 1,000

sentences.english: Your threats don’t scare me.
sentences.chinese: 你的那些威胁吓不倒我。

sentences.english: threats made against his wife and children
sentences.chinese: 对他妻儿的威胁

sentences.english: Nichols never carried out his threat to resign.
sentences.chinese: 尼科尔斯威胁过要辞职，但从未付诸行动。

sentences.english: The government will not give in to terrorist threats .
sentences.chinese: 政府不会屈服于恐怖分子的威胁。

sentences.english: She dismissed the statement as an empty threat .
sentences.chinese: 她无视这项声明，认为是个空口威胁。

sentences.english: They warned him with veiled threats not to mention anything he had witnessed.
sentences.chinese: 他们话中有话地威胁他不要提及他所目睹的事。

sentences.english: The police are investigating death threats made against the two men.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在调查针对这两名男子的死亡恐吓。

sentences.english: Officials at the school say they received a bomb threat at approximately 11:30 a.m. today.
sentences.chinese: 学校的官员说他们在今天上午11点半左右收到过炸弹恐吓。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you tell someone that you will cause them harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

name: threaten
trans: vt.威胁，扬言要；预示，是…的征兆

sentences.english: Postal workers are threatening a strike if they don’t receive a pay increase.
sentences.chinese: 邮政工人威胁如果不加薪，他们就要罢工。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you will cause someone harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

sentences.english: They’ve won their last three games.
sentences.chinese: 他们赢了最近三场比赛。

sentences.english: We’d better go. It’s almost three (= three o’clock ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们该走了。快3点了。

sentences.english: My little sister’s only three (= three years old ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的小妹妹只有3岁。

detailed_translations.english: the number 3
the number 3

name: thrilling
trans: a.令人激动的；颤动的，震颤的

sentences.english: a thrilling 3-2 victory
sentences.chinese: 比分为3比2的激动人心的胜利

detailed_translations.english: interesting and exciting

sentences.english: How many working days were lost through sickness last year?
sentences.chinese: 去年因为员工生病损失了多少个工作日？

detailed_translations.english: because of something

sentences.english: a large organization with offices throughout the world
sentences.chinese: 在世界各地都设有办事处的一家大型机构

sentences.english: The disease spread rapidly throughout Europe.
sentences.chinese: 疾病迅速在整个欧洲蔓延开来。

sentences.english: The house is in excellent condition, with fitted carpets throughout.
sentences.chinese: 这幢房子状况极好，全部铺着地毯。

sentences.english: We are open every weekend throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 我们全年每个周末都对外开放。

detailed_translations.english: in every part of a particular area, place etc
during all of a particular period, from the beginning to the end

sentences.english: The bus stopped suddenly and we were all thrown forwards.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车猛地停住，我们都往前栽。

detailed_translations.chinese: [threw-thrown] 投， 扔， 抛； 使突然陷入； 使困惑， 使吃惊
detailed_translations.english: to make an object such as a ball move quickly through the air by pushing your hand forward quickly and letting the object go

name: thrust
trans: vt.插，挤；戳，刺 n.戳，刺；推力

sentences.english: He jumped back to avoid another thrust of the knife.
sentences.chinese: 他往后一闪，躲避再次捅来的一刀。

sentences.english: She thrust her way into the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 她挤进了人群。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong movement in which you push something forward
If you thrust your way somewhere, you move there, pushing between people or things which are in your way

sentences.english: She was working Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 她星期四在工作。

detailed_translations.english: the day between Wednesday and Friday

sentences.english: Most of the evidence was destroyed in the fire. Thus it would be almost impossible to prove him guilty.
sentences.chinese: 大多数证据已在大火中烧毁，因而要证明他有罪几乎是不可能的。

detailed_translations.english: as a result of something that you have just mentioned

sentences.english: Slow down or you'll get a ticket.
sentences.chinese: 开慢点儿，否则你会接到一张罚款通知单。

sentences.english: parking/speeding ticket
sentences.chinese: 违法停车/超速行驶罚款单

detailed_translations.english: a printed note ordering you to pay money because you have done something illegal while driving or parking your car

sentences.english: He tied the ends of the plastic bag together.
sentences.chinese: 他把塑料袋的两头系在一起。

detailed_translations.english: if two players, teams etc tie or are tied in a game or competition, they finish it with an equal number of points

detailed_translations.chinese: 领带；平局；鞋带；领结；不分胜负
detailed_translations.english: a long narrow piece of cloth tied in a knot around the neck, worn by men

trans: （针对问题，挑战等）提出，想出；提供

trans: 是…的原因；有助于，有益于

trans: 赶上；振作；遵守；继续，保持

trans: 与…接触；自…时代存在至今

trans: 交出，让出；放弃，抛弃，辞去

trans: 把…挂起来；挂断（电话）；延迟，拖延

trans: 跟上（潮流，形势等）；保持联系

trans: 把…放在一边，把…搁置一旁；留存

trans: （由部分）组成，构成（全体）；捏造，虚构

trans: 打开；开办，开辟，开发；坦诚地谈话

trans: 决定不参加…，决定（从…）退出

trans: 累积；（指若干车辆）碰撞在一起

trans: 为某人谋方便；有利于某人

trans: 有记录；列入记录；将…列入记录

trans: 对…做出反应；因受影响而改变行动

name: to respond to
trans: 作答，回答；对…作出反应，响应

name: to rule out
trans: 把…排除在外；排除…的可能性

name: to sacrifice to
trans: 向…献祭；为…而牺牲；为…而失去

name: to set out
trans: 出发，起程；宣布，发表；展示，陈列

name: to suffer from
trans: 受苦，受害，受罚，受损失；患病

name: to take care of
trans: 爱护；照顾，照料；处理，对付

name: to take over
trans: 接管，接任；把…从一处运到另一处

name: to take to
trans: 开始从事；养成…的习惯；培养对…的爱好

trans: 关，关断（水源，电源，煤气等）

trans: 开，接通（水源，电源，煤气等）

sentences.chinese: 根据传统习俗，婚礼的费用由新娘的父母承担。

sentences.english: traditional Italian cooking
sentences.chinese: 传统的意大利烹饪

sentences.english: a traditional Irish folk song
sentences.chinese: 传统的爱尔兰民歌

sentences.english: a traditional method of brewing beer
sentences.chinese: 传统的啤酒酿造方法

detailed_translations.english: being part of the traditions of a country or group of people

name: traditionalist
trans: n.传统主义者；因循守旧者

sentences.english: We went all the way to Inverness by train.
sentences.chinese: 我们一路坐火车到因弗内斯。

detailed_translations.english: a set of several carriages that are connected to each other and pulled along a railway line by an engine
to teach someone the skills of a particular job or activity, or to be taught these skills

name: transaction
trans: n.办理，处理；（一笔）交易，业务

sentences.english: The bank charges a fixed rate for each transaction.
sentences.chinese: 银行对每一笔业务收取固定费用。

sentences.english: the transaction of government business
sentences.chinese: 处理政府事务

detailed_translations.english: a business deal or action, such as buying or selling something

name: transfer
trans: vt./vi.转移；改变 n.转移，传输，变换

sentences.english: He was transferred for a fee of £8 million.
sentences.chinese: 他以800万英镑的转会费转到了其他球队。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搬， 转移； 调动， 转学； 转让， 过户； 乘车， 转乘
detailed_translations.english: to move from one place, school, job etc to another, or to make someone do this, especially within the same organization

sentences.english: In recent years, the movie industry has undergone a dramatic transformation .
sentences.chinese: 近些年，电影业经历了巨大的变革。

detailed_translations.english: a complete change in someone or something

sentences.english: Poetry doesn’t usually translate well.
sentences.chinese: 诗歌通常都译不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 翻译；转化；解释；转变为；调动
detailed_translations.english: to change written or spoken words into another language

name: transmit
trans: vt.播送，发射；传送，传递；输送

sentences.english: The US Open will be transmitted live via satellite.
sentences.chinese: 美国公开赛将通过卫星现场直播。

sentences.english: The system transmits information over digital phone lines.
sentences.chinese: 这一系统通过数字电话线路传输信息。

detailed_translations.english: to send an electronic signal, radio or television broadcast, etc.

sentences.english: trucks used for transporting oil
sentences.chinese: 运输石油的卡车

sentences.english: Canals were used for the transport of goods.
sentences.chinese: 利用运河来运输货物。

detailed_translations.english: to take goods, people etc from one place to another in a vehicle
the process or business of taking goods from one place to another

name: transportation
trans: n.运输；运输系统，运输工具

sentences.english: The city needs to improve its public transportation (= buses, trains etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 这座城市需要改善公共交通。

detailed_translations.english: a system or method for carrying passengers or goods from one place to another

name: trap
trans: n.陷阱，圈套 vt.设陷阱捕捉；使中圈套

sentences.english: Mr Smith has walked straight into a trap laid by the Tories.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生直接落入了保守党布设的圈套。

sentences.english: He felt he had been trapped into accepting the terms of the contract.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得自己是中了圈套才接受这合同条款的。

sentences.english: Were you just trying to trap her into making some admission?
sentences.chinese: 你仅仅是在试图诱骗她招供吗？

detailed_translations.english: a clever trick that is used to catch someone or to make them do or say something that they did not intend to
to trick sb into sth

sentences.english: Light travels faster than sound.
sentences.chinese: 光比声音传播得快。

detailed_translations.chinese: 旅行； 行进； 被传送， 被传播； 走过， 驶过
detailed_translations.english: to move at a particular speed or in a particular direction
the activity of travelling

sentences.english: The message is the traveler, moving from one specific airport to another specific airport.
sentences.chinese: 消息是这个旅行者，要从一个特定的机场到另一个特定的机场。

sentences.english: By thus sweeping over centuries and minds, by miming man as he can be and as he is, the actor has much in common with that other absurd individual, the traveler.
sentences.chinese: 就这样，演员不知经历了多少世纪，横跨过多少心智，模仿着他们的所能与所是，渐渐的，他和那个荒谬的个体，那个旅行者，有了许多共同之处。

detailed_translations.english: a person who is travelling or who often travels

sentences.english: buried treasure
sentences.chinese: 埋藏的财宝

sentences.english: the priceless art treasures of the Uffizi gallery.
sentences.chinese: 乌菲齐美术馆收藏的无价艺术瑰宝

sentences.english: I treasure his friendship.
sentences.chinese: 我珍重他的友谊。

detailed_translations.english: a collection of valuable things such as gold, silver and jewellery
to keep and care for something that is very special, important, or valuable to you

sentences.english: She treats me like one of the family.
sentences.chinese: 她把我当作家人看待。

sentences.english: sewage treated so that it can be used as fertilizer
sentences.chinese: 经过处理可用作肥料的污水

sentences.english: Let's go out for lunch─ my treat (= I will pay) .
sentences.chinese: 咱们到外面去吃午餐，我请客。

detailed_translations.english: to behave towards someone or something in a particular way
something special that you give someone or do for them because you know they will enjoy it

sentences.english: There have been great advances in the treatment of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 癌症治疗有了很大的进展。

sentences.english: Just lately, Kyra has been giving me the silent treatment (= refusing to speak to me because she is angry with me ) .
sentences.chinese: 就在最近，凯拉一直对我不理不睬。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done to cure someone who is injured or ill

sentences.english: As a kid, I loved to climb trees.
sentences.chinese: 小时候，我喜欢爬树。

sentences.english: the trunk of an old oak tree (= the main central part, from which the branches grow )
sentences.chinese: 一棵老橡树的树干

detailed_translations.english: a very tall plant that has branches and leaves, and lives for many years

sentences.english: His lip started to tremble and then he started to cry.
sentences.chinese: 他的嘴唇开始颤抖，接着就哭了起来。

sentences.english: I will never forget the look on the patient's face, the tremble in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 我将永远不会忘记那病人脸上的表情和他颤抖的手。

detailed_translations.english: to shake slightly in a way that you cannot control, especially because you are upset or frightened
Tremble is also a noun

name: tribe
trans: n.种族，部落；（植物，动物）族，类

sentences.english: a tribe of Aborigines known as the Dolphin People
sentences.chinese: 一个叫“海豚族”的澳大利亚土著部落

detailed_translations.english: a social group consisting of people of the same  race  who have the same beliefs, customs, language etc, and usually live in one particular area ruled by their leader

sentences.chinese: 假装不记得是他的老花招了。

sentences.chinese: 他并没有真的丢了钱包——这只是一个骗局。

sentences.english: The trick is to bend your knees as you catch the ball.
sentences.chinese: 诀窍是接球时要屈膝。

sentences.english: She knew she’d been tricked, but it was too late.
sentences.chinese: 她知道自己被骗了，但为时已晚。

detailed_translations.english: something you do in order to deceive someone
to deceive someone in order to get something from them or to make them do something

name: tricky
trans: a.狡猾的，耍花招的；难以处理的

sentences.english: I can get you tickets for the show but it’ll be tricky.
sentences.chinese: 我能给你弄到演出的票，但会很费事。

detailed_translations.english: a tricky person is clever and likely to deceive you

sentences.english: Two lucky employees won a round-the-world trip.
sentences.chinese: 两名幸运的雇员赢得一次环游世界的机会。

sentences.english: It’s an 80-mile round trip (= a journey to a place and back again ) to Exeter.
sentences.chinese: 到埃克塞特往返有80英里。

sentences.english: I’m afraid you’ve had a wasted trip (= a trip in which you do not achieve your purpose ) . Mr Burgess has already left.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕你是白来一趟了，伯吉斯先生已经走了。

sentences.english: He was unable to make the trip to accept the award.
sentences.chinese: 他无法前去领奖。

detailed_translations.english: a visit to a place that involves a journey, for pleasure or a particular purpose

name: trophy
trans: n.胜利纪念品，战利品；奖杯，奖品

sentences.chinese: 他非洲之行的战利品之一是个狮头。

detailed_translations.english: something that you keep to prove your success in something, especially in war or hunting

sentences.english: the tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 热带雨林

sentences.english: tropical fruit
sentences.chinese: 热带水果

detailed_translations.english: coming from or existing in the hottest parts of the world

sentences.english: Recent stock market losses point to trouble ahead.
sentences.chinese: 最近股市的下跌预示着未来将有麻烦。

detailed_translations.english: problems or difficulties

name: troublesome
trans: a.令人烦恼的，讨厌的；麻烦的

sentences.english: The economy has become a troublesome issue for the Conservative Party.
sentences.chinese: 经济状况已成为保守党的一大难题。

detailed_translations.english: A troublesome situation or issue is full of complicated problems or difficulties.

sentences.english: His trousers were slightly too short.
sentences.chinese: 他的裤子有点短。

sentences.english: I need a new pair of trousers for work.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一条上班穿的新裤子。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing that covers the lower half of your body, with a separate part fitting over each leg

sentences.english: a truck driver
sentences.chinese: 卡车司机

detailed_translations.english: a large road vehicle used to carry goods

sentences.chinese: 起初，他们之间缺乏信任。

sentences.chinese: 在相互信任的基础上达成的一项协议

sentences.chinese: 你辜负了你父亲对你的信任。

sentences.chinese: 我就是不信任他。

sentences.chinese: 你父亲留给你的钱将被托管到你满21岁。

sentences.chinese: 我们休息一下，然后再试。

sentences.english: I tried everything to lose weight with no success.
sentences.chinese: 我试了各种方法减肥，但都没有成功。

sentences.chinese: 我一次次地尝试，终于有人给了我一份工作。

sentences.chinese: 他想尽办法，但脑子里仍摆脱不掉那件事。

an attempt to do something

name: tube
trans: n.管；电子管，真空管；[英]地铁

sentences.chinese: 一管牙膏

detailed_translations.english: a round pipe made of metal, glass, rubber etc, especially for liquids or gases to go through

detailed_translations.chinese: 使成管状；把…装管；用管输送

sentences.english: I’ll see you Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 星期二见。

detailed_translations.english: the day between Monday and Wednesday

sentences.english: Frozen dog dirt stipples the tundra of the golf course.
sentences.chinese: 冻成冰块的狗屎点缀着高尔夫球场的苔原。

sentences.english: The park contains 150 lakes and 450 miles of streams, plus ecosystems ranging from wetlands to pine forests to montane areas to alpine tundra.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家公园包括150个湖泊和450英里河流以及从湿地到松林、从山丘到高山冻原等各种生态系统。

detailed_translations.english: the large flat areas of land in the north of Russia, Canada etc, where it is very cold and there are no trees

name: tune
trans: n.曲调；和谐，协调 vt.调音；使合谐，调节

sentences.english: That’s a nice tune.
sentences.chinese: 那曲调很美。

sentences.english: She sang some old classics and a few new tunes.
sentences.chinese: 她唱了几首经典老歌和一些新曲。

sentences.chinese: 明天有人来给钢琴调音。

sentences.chinese: 里基转身走了。

sentences.english: She turned her head in surprise.
sentences.chinese: 她惊讶地转过头来。

sentences.chinese: 布丽吉特瞪了他一眼，猛地一转身，噔噔噔地走出了房间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 转弯；变化；(损害或有益于别人的)行为，举动，举止
detailed_translations.english: a sudden or unexpected change that makes a situation develop in a different way

name: turn (somebody) off
trans: （使）失去兴趣；（使）不再喜欢；（使）厌烦

sentences.english: He kept turning the central heating down.
sentences.chinese: 他不断地调低中央暖气系统的温度。

name: turn off
trans: 关，关断（水源，电源，煤气等）

sentences.english: The light's a bit too harsh. You can turn it off.
sentences.chinese: 那灯光有点太刺眼。你可以关掉它。

detailed_translations.english: When you turn off a piece of equipment or a supply of something, you stop heat, sound, or water from being produced by adjusting the controls

name: turn on
trans: 开，接通（水源，电源，煤气等）

sentences.english: I want to turn on the television.
sentences.chinese: 我想打开电视机。

detailed_translations.english: When you turn on a piece of equipment or a supply of something, you cause heat, sound, or water to be produced by adjusting the controls

sentences.english: Captain: : You're the twelfth in a long line of governesses, who have come to look after my children since their mother died.
sentences.chinese: 上校：自从孩子们的母亲去世以后，你是来照看他们的第十二位女家庭教师。

sentences.english: NIV] the fifth sardonyx, the sixth carnelian, the seventh chrysolite, the eighth beryl, the ninth topaz, the tenth chrysoprase, the eleventh jacinth, and the twelfth amethyst.
sentences.chinese: 第五是红玛瑙，第六是红宝石，第七是黄璧玺；第八是水苍玉；第九是红璧玺；第十是翡翠；第十一是紫玛瑙；第十二是紫晶。

detailed_translations.english: one of twelve equal parts of something
one of twelve equal parts of something

sentences.english: He received a twelve-month jail sentence.
sentences.chinese: 他获刑12个月。

sentences.english: Come at twelve (= 12 o’clock ) .
sentences.chinese: 12点来。

sentences.english: Their son Dylan is twelve (= 12 years old ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的儿子迪伦12岁。

detailed_translations.english: the number 12
the number 12

name: twentieth
trans: a.第二十的 n.二十分之一

sentences.english: He came in twentieth.
sentences.chinese: 他得了第二十名。

sentences.english: If you are twentieth, do you get a medal?
sentences.chinese: 如果你第二十，你得到奖牌吗？

sentences.english: Tutti was always first in her class before, but has slipped since the last move down to twentieth out of fifty children.
sentences.chinese: 图蒂从前在班上总是名列前茅，但打从上回搬家后，名次已掉到五十个学童当中的第二十名。

sentences.english: a small village twenty miles from Nairobi
sentences.chinese: 距内罗毕20英里的一个小村庄

sentences.english: I’m nearly twenty (= 20 years old ) .
sentences.chinese: 我快20岁了。

detailed_translations.english: the number 20
the number 20

sentences.english: He was questioned by police twice yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 他昨天被警察审问了两次。

sentences.english: None of our dinner menus are exactly the same twice over .
sentences.chinese: 我们的晚餐菜单从没有完全重样的。

detailed_translations.english: two times

sentences.english: I always confounded him with his twin brother.
sentences.chinese: 我总分不清他和他的孪生兄弟。

sentences.english: The twin brothers were removed from our class.
sentences.chinese: 这一对孪生兄弟已从我们班转走。

sentences.english: The twin brothers bled for their country and died without any regrets.
sentences.chinese: 这对孪生兄弟为国流血牺牲， 死而无憾。

sentences.english: I’d like you to line up in twos, please.
sentences.chinese: 请你们两个一组排好队。

detailed_translations.english: in groups of two people or things
the number 2

name: type
trans: n.类型，种类，品种 vt./vi.打字

sentences.english: I’ve already seen a few movies of this type.
sentences.chinese: 我已经看过几部这种类型的影片了。

sentences.english: He types with two fingers.
sentences.chinese: 他用两个手指打字。

detailed_translations.english: one member of a group of people or things that have similar features or qualities
to write something using a computer or a typewriter

sentences.english: typical British weather
sentences.chinese: 典型的英国天气

sentences.english: This advertisement is a typical example of their marketing strategy.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告是他们营销策略的一个典型例子。

detailed_translations.english: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing

sentences.english: a very ugly man
sentences.chinese: 非常丑陋的男子

sentences.english: the ugliest building in town
sentences.chinese: 城里最难看的建筑

sentences.english: Nick’s dog is as ugly as sin (= very ugly ).
sentences.chinese: 尼克的狗难看得要命。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丑陋的；邪恶的；令人厌恶的
detailed_translations.english: extremely unattractive and unpleasant to look at

sentences.english: The ultimate outcome of the experiment cannot be predicted.
sentences.chinese: 试验的最后结果无法预测。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s ultimate aim is their main and most important aim, that they hope to achieve in the future

sentences.english: Ultimately, the decision rests with the child’s parents.
sentences.chinese: 最终，决定权在这孩子的父母手中。

sentences.english: a long but ultimately successful campaign
sentences.chinese: 一场历时很久但最终成功的运动

detailed_translations.english: finally, after everything else has been done or considered

sentences.english: The military may feel unable to hand over power to a civilian president next year.
sentences.chinese: 军方可能觉得无法在明年把政权移交给一位民选总统。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不会的，不能的；[劳经] 无能力的；不能胜任的
detailed_translations.english: not able to do something

name: unacceptable
trans: a.不能接受的，不合意的，不受欢迎的

sentences.english: I found her attitude totally unacceptable.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得她的态度让人完全不能接受。

sentences.english: unacceptable levels of pollution
sentences.chinese: 无法容忍的污染程度

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能接受的；不受欢迎的
detailed_translations.english: something that is unacceptable is so wrong or bad that you think it should not be allowed

name: unanswered
trans: a.未予答复的；无响应的，无报答的

sentences.chinese: 还有许多其他问题没有得到解答。

detailed_translations.english: an unanswered question has not been answered

name: unattractive
trans: a.无吸引力的；不引人注意的

sentences.english: an unattractive man
sentences.chinese: 没有魅力的男子

detailed_translations.chinese: 无魅力的, 无吸引力的
detailed_translations.english: not attractive, pretty, or pleasant to look at

name: unaware
trans: a.未认识到的，未察觉到的，不知道的

sentences.english: Many people are unaware of just how much food and drink they consume.
sentences.chinese: 许多人不知道自己到底消耗掉多少食物和饮料。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不知道的，无意的；未察觉到的
detailed_translations.english: not noticing or realizing what is happening

sentences.english: ...eternal and unchanging truths.
sentences.chinese: ...永恒不变的事实。

detailed_translations.english: always staying the same

sentences.english: Lily spent years caring for her sick uncle.
sentences.chinese: 莉莉照顾了她生病的叔叔好多年。

sentences.english: After his parents cashed in, he lived with his uncle.
sentences.chinese: 他在父母去世后，与叔叔在一起过。

sentences.english: When she was orphaned,her uncle sent her to orphanage.
sentences.chinese: 她的父母刚一去世，她的叔叔便把她送进了孤儿院。
